job_desc:
Goodwill Caravan is a humanitarian charity operating in the UK and in Greece, founded in 2015, Goodwill Caravan run humanitarian protection projects for vulnerable refugee families, orphans, detained unaccompanied children at risk of organ trade, trafficking and kidnappings if left in detention centers, jails or homeless on arrival to host countries.
 
Our vision is of a world in which children affected by war or natural disaster can live safe and fulfilled lives. This vision drives our mission to deliver life-changing humanitarian support to refugees and others in great need.
 
Our current projects include:
• Legal aid for refugees and asylum seekers with emphasis on supporting vulnerable groups.
• Emergency shelter for vulnerable refugees.
• Weekly distributions of food, clothing, and other necessities.
• Medical and healthcare support services.
• Educational and vocational training.
 
SCOPE
The Grants and Partnerships Officer will be responsible for the overall Grants management processes for Goodwill Caravan and support with partnerships oversight. S/he will oversee the implementation of GWC partnership management system, ensuring that GWC identifies, appropriately allocates and effectively mitigates programmatic, operational, financial, and reputational risk, establishing a strong foundation for strategic partnerships. S/he lead in all partnership identification, serve as the primary liaison with all sub-grantee partners, ensure compliance to donor rules and regulations while maintaining active and cooperative relationships with all the GWC staff and partners. 
 
The Grants & Partnership Officer will be based in London, UK and might be expected to travel occasionally.
Location: London, UK
Duration: 6 months (fixed term) with Initial Trial Period of Three months.
Start date: 1
st
 of April
 
Role & Responsibilities: 
 
Donors proposals and reports writing
 
Proposals:
Support in the coordination and the writing of proposals
Provide timelines and ensure timely submission to Management Team
Make sure that the proposals match GWC criteria.
Make sure that all indicators are SMART and target realistic
Be the focal point at mission level for HQ for grants/reporting, and consider donor compliance and guidelines to ensure adherence
 
Donor's and internal reporting:
Support mission in the coordination and writing of donor reports
Ensure timely submission of reports to HQ
Ensure adherence to donor deadlines, including developing and disseminating timelines to relevant staff
Support by taking the lead in the writing of certain parts of the reports (non-technical part) and help in the compilation of the different contributions
Ensure consistency among the different components of the reports
Act as the focal point for report related queries and take the lead in the preparation of the monthly GWC situation report
Donor engagement
Maintain overview of all donors' requirements, rules and regulations and ensure their good dissemination and acceptance by key staffs
Carry out regular donor mapping exercises and identify new funding opportunities.
Maintain a database of current and expected call for proposals.
Support the mission in the organization of external audit or evaluation.
Memorandum of Understanding (MoU)/Partnership agreements
Support in the writing of needed operational MOU or amendments.
Take the lead in the preparation or review of MOU between GWC UK and partners. 
 
REQUIREMENTS
§ University degree in related field or equivalent experience; 
§ 2-3 years’ experience in the NGO/civil society sector and Grant management;
§ Demonstrate understanding of donor compliance rules and grant management;
§ Report writing skills, attention to detail and organization skills;
§ Excellent interpersonal, cultural and diplomatic skills; Friendly and constructive approach in managing work relations and addressing challenges;
§ Demonstrate ability to influence; 
§ Fluent in English both written and verbal, other languages will be valued.
§ Ability to carry out responsibilities independently with minimal technical support


 Candidates are requested to submit a Cover letter along with their CV. Applications without Cover letter will not be reviewed.


Disclaimer Clause: This job description is not an exhaustive list of the skills, effort, duties and responsibilities associated with a position.


GWC is an Equal Opportunity Employer GWC considers all applicants based on merit without regard to race, sex, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability.


GWC and GWC workers must adhere to the values and principles outlined in the GWC Code of Conduct and Internal Policy. In accordance with these values, the GWC operates and enforces policies on Beneficiary Protection from Exploitation and Abuse, Child Safeguarding, Anti Workplace Harassment, and Anti-Money Laundering Policy.
title: Grants Coordinator and Partnerships Officer

job_desc:
Job description
Salary
: £30k - £45k
Location
: Remote-first (UK based)
 
About the role
Analytics Engineers are the engine room of Measurelab, using their expertise in data collection, transformation, automation and cloud technologies to solve complex client problems. Their work contributes to clean, comprehensive, and trusted marketing data, which adds significant value to our clients. The Engineering team works in fortnightly agile sprints and liaises closely with the consulting and analysis teams to deliver impactful, timely work. Measurelab seeks to evolve continually, so as well as client work, Analytics Engineers also explore and refine internal processes and help build new tools to make our offering even more compelling.
 
Perks of the job
 
28 days a year holiday as standard (includes Christmas closure - typically three days) not including Bank Holidays
Plus, an extra day off if your birthday falls on a working day!
Additional holiday buy-back scheme (up to 10 extra days)
Three charity days a year - to give back to good causes
Healthcare, wellness and pension scheme with 5% employer contribution
Plenty of socials and opportunities to hang out with colleagues, if that’s your thing, both remote and IRL
Being part of a fantastic team, doing great work and having a bit of fun along the way


 
Location
Even though our HQ is in the SE of England (just outside Brighton), since the pandemic, we are now a distributed team - working all over the UK. We expect to continue to work in a distributed way but will want to see each other from time to time IRL too!
 
As well as our HQ, we use co-working spaces in London (Soho, Farringdon, London Bridge, Camden) and Manchester. Being a remote-first company now, we don’t mandate any time in the office, but if you live locally or want to get some in-person time with the team, it’s there for you to use. Additionally, we expect the team to get together over a weekend once a year for our annual company kick-off.
 
 
Job Requirements
 
Must-have
 
Ability to work in sprints and meet specified deadlines
A passion for data and the confidence to impart the technical & business implications of the services we can bring
Working knowledge of Google Tag Manager (GTM), including
Debugging GTM tagging (Either via dataLayer, GTM Debugger, or JavaScript)
Setting up eCommerce tracking
Implementing cookie solutions (e.g. OneTrust)
Adhering to GTM best practices (naming conventions, workspaces, clear descriptions)
Familiarity with pipelining tools like Fivetran, Skyvia or Funnel
A flair for good documentation practices & the ability to think calmly and logically in demanding situations
A desire to grow and explore knowledge within the space of cloud analytics. Particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
An ability to think of new approaches to existing problems


 
Nice-to-have
 
Experience working within agile sprint framework
Experience working with server-side GTM
Experience working with app analytics
An understanding of the concept of ‘consent mode’ and how it can be implemented
An understanding of the tools and services offered within the GCP, specifically those that pertain to analysis, ETL pipelines, and automation
Experience using python to manipulate data. Familiarity with libraries like pandas
Experience working with APIs
Experience with SQL (including automation, versioning and testing platforms like dbt/dataform)
An understanding of GTM tag templates and sandboxed Javascript


 
Responsibilities
 
Partner closely with stakeholders and team members to identify and meet requirements to deliver engineering solutions across multiple clients.
Responsible for working in and helping to improve evolving sprint process, ensuring the timely delivery of tickets
Helping to grow further our GCP offering by lending experience and or willingness to explore and learn
Maintain consistency in the delivery of technical implementations and analysis – beating the drum of an ongoing approach to delivery


 
We're an equal opportunities employer, and celebrate diversity in all forms at Measurelab. We understand the importance of having different perspectives, ideas, and backgrounds, and welcome applications from
 
everyone
. We're particularly keen to hear from candidates who identify with underrepresented groups in our industry.
 
This also extends to neurodiverse candidates as we recognise the unique skills and perspectives that individuals with autism, ADHD, dyslexia, and other neurodevelopmental conditions bring to the workplace.
 
If we can support you with any adjustments or further information to help with your application, please get in touch at callum@measurelab.co.uk.
title: Analytics Engineer

job_desc:
Tech & Data Lead - House of Colour - £70k - £80k
 
At House of Colour, we change lives every day through the power of colour. Our Franchise Owners cultivate long-lasting relationships with their clients by helping them understand what colour, makeup, and clothing look best on them. As a House of Colour UK employee, you work every day to help ensure that our Franchisees and their employees can be their most successful. We wear many hats – as one does in a lean yet rapidly growing organization, so the ability to be flexible, accept change, and be a team player is essential. We support each other to get the work done and make sure that no matter where we are in the world – we stay connected and have fun while doing it.
 
We are a team made up of hardworking, passionate, and dedicated individuals who thrive on developing meaningful work and high-quality relationships and are motivated by the company’s and our franchisees’ collective success.
 
SUMMARY/OBJECTIVE
:
 
As the Tech & Data Lead, you are joining at a critical moment and will build and oversee the House of Colour (HOC) Tech & Data strategy. You will be an instrumental part of shaping the product & infrastructure that delivers our franchise management systems and internal business systems which will place data central to everything we do. You will own the tech strategy and select and manage 3rd party technology and software development suppliers. Furthermore, you will be responsible for setting up the technical capabilities of the business for growth. You must have a good understanding and experience developing scalable service-oriented architecture. The successful incumbent will have experience developing and implementing databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize data to enable decision-making to support growth. The incumbent must be a detailed, organised self-starter with the ability to move at a very fast pace and have a high ability to prioritize based on a rapidly changing and growing franchise-based industry environment.
 
You’re excited about this opportunity because you will….
·       Use planning, organisation, and communication skills to help HOC deliver complex and innovative projects, from inception, requirements gathering, development, integration, and testing to launch.
 
·       Develop and achieve data ownership within the organisation and best translate the data to meet the needs of the business for the executive team to support growth and daily decision-making.
 
·       Make complex and technical information and language simple and accessible for non-technical audiences.
 
·       Lead the overall delivery including, Engineering, Product, Quality, and Design practices, and drive tech and data methodology and mindset across the organisation.
 
·       Build strategic technology and product roadmaps based on company strategy and objectives and delivering them within agreed timelines and budget.
 
·       Create necessary technical documentation and Entity Relationship Diagrams (ERD).
 
·       Lead and execute an agenda in an uncertain and fluid environment with untapped learning opportunities.
·       Act as an escalation point of contact for technical issues within the business.
 
·       Performs other duties as assigned and modified at the Head of Operation’s discretion.
 
You’re excited because you possess the following skills…….
·       Excellent at working co-operatively in a remote work setting.
 
·       Evidence of making key decisions on technical architecture that enables business growth and scalability.
 
·       Creative problem-solving on product strategy to identify opportunities to quickly deliver value.
 
·       Deep technical understanding of web services and system integrations.
 
·       Strong knowledge of the payment ecosystem, payment gateways, card acquirers, and 3DSecure.
 
·       Practical experience with ERP software and systems.
 
·       Good knowledge of eCommerce products and solutions to support high-volume retail.
 
·       Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
 
·       Results-focused, able to achieve both short- and long-term goals based on desired outcomes.
·       Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
·       Proactive and independent with the ability to take initiative.
 
We’re excited about you because you have……..
·       Undergraduate degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field preferred. Extensive experience in the technology industry may be substituted for education.
 
·       Minimum of five (5) years of experience delivering high-quality technical solutions.
 
·       Motivated by a great product and solving problems for people through technology.
 
·       Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc.), databases (SQL, etc.), and programming (XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks).
 
·       Care about good practices, such as writing tests, code reviewing, and prioritising work, that has the most business impact.
 
·       Nurture a growth mindset and are willing to learn new things.
 
·       Entrepreneurial spirit, flexibility, and willingness to work across a range of areas to operate in a start-up environment.
 
·       Data-driven abilities to enable evaluation of product-market fit and other aspects of product performance, able to identify insights that will influence future decisions.
 
·       Excellent communication skills with high emotional intelligence.
 
·       Decision-making ability with a bias for action and a sense of urgency; and an ability to exercise discretion in handling sensitive, confidential matters.
·       Ability to be a team player with the confidence to take the lead and guide others.
 
 
OUR BENEFITS
:
·       Salary range £70k-£80k
·       Flexible remote working
·       Company-wide performance bonus and employee discounts on services and products
·       31 days paid holiday including bank holidays, plus one personal “birthday” paid day.
·       Wellbeing support
·       The chance to be part of a rapidly growing company with career progression and the next success story
·       An international and diverse work atmosphere where individuality is celebrated and encouraged
·       The opportunity to work with a knowledgeable, high-achieving, experienced, and fun team who are happy to provide mentorship, support and guidance
 
·       Retail discount scheme
title: Tech & Data Lead

job_desc:
Company Description
 
Fascinated by the future and captivated by technology? Smart, driven and want to make a difference in the world? You will fit right in.
 
By joining one of our teams at Visa Payments Limited, a division of Visa Inc since 2019, you’ll have an opportunity to shape the payments experience globally. Being part of Visa, the world’s leader in digital payments technology, our mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive.
 
Visa Payments Limited is a financial technology business that provides cross-border payment processing services to banks and payments businesses across six continents through its global network.
 
Individuality fuels our brand and our global team – we are proud that we are a talented team of 18,000 individuals with unique backgrounds, perspectives and experiences. Therefore, we understand that you are much more than your day job. We encourage quality of life both within and outside of the office, and whether it is taking advantage of agile work schedules or our wellness programmes, Visa Payments Limited and Visa Inc. respects and encourages meaningful work/life balance for everyone.
 
If you think you could support the Visa family by joining Visa Payments Limited as a Operations Analyst, we want to hear from you.
 
You're
 
an individual.
 
We're
 
the team for you.
 
Together
, let's transform the way the world pays.
 
Job Description
 
What’s it all about?
 
 
Working as part of the Capacity Modelling Team, Operations Data Analyst will be responsible for growing the scope of the operational capacity modelling capability, and in turn support the wider business by delivering granular insights to support effective decision making for FTE management and scalability.
 
The role will allow the individual to gather a broad knowledge of the business from a process and data analysis perspective, as well as exposure to data analytics tools and the software development lifecycle of the Capacity Modelling Tool. Additionally, the role will have the opportunity to work multiple projects simultaneously across new process modelling, process change, and major change initiative impact assessment.
 
What We Expect Of You, Day To Day.
 
 
Use and support the further delivery of the Capacity Modelling Tool to understand how operational capacity is calculated in Visa Payments Limited, and how those insights are used to support decision making across the business
 
Responsible for designing capacity modelling capability - combining process maps with historical payment data to determine probability of process outcomes; overlaying time value to calculate workload
 
Work with operational teams to understand further variables affecting workload and assessing links to existing capacity modelling
 
Using Python, Pandas and other tools to build and test capacity modelling solution
 
Build a suite of tests to automate the process of validating expected results against results generated by the tool. These tests will be run as part of the build process before and after new releases.
 
Analysis of process changes to determine impact to Capacity Modelling Tool and subsequent impact to workload required
 
Work alongside colleagues in business intelligence to map transaction data to the Capacity Modelling Tool to, so recent data can efficiently and accurately be fed in to analyse changes in forecast capacity
 
As the algorithm expert, act as the Capacity Modelling SME in the Ops Change team, supporting wider initiatives and being a point of contact for all capacity modelling queries
 
Production of good-quality documentation and management information
 
Proactively propose improvements and/or provide support and guidance to SMEs in pursuit of solutions
 
Provide ah-hoc analysis support to the wider VPL Operations (and other) teams
 


 
Qualifications
 
What we’re after…
 
 
 
An analytical and logical mindset – a desire to fully understand complex variables affecting workload
 
A desire to understand the wider business and what data would support further insights to support decision making
 
Demonstrated ability to analyse information/data, propose solutions and drive thorough to implementation
 
Have previous experience working within a data analysis or insights role
 
Working experience of python including unit testing or test automation
 
Strong MS Excel skills to manipulate large datasets and calculate basic workload requirements from scratch. Building those requirements into wider capacity modelling algorithm using Python
 
Working experience of Python (required) including unit testing or test automation and basic data manipulation using tools such as Pandas, working with data frames, SQL and machine learning
 
Have experience importing data to visualisation tools such as Microstrategy (desirable) / Power BI / Tableau
 
Basic model building and deployment
 
Basic understanding of version control software (e.g. BitBucket or Git)
 
Strong time management
 
The ability to understand complex technical solutions and communicate these in a concise and relevant way to various stakeholders including Product and Technology teams
 
The ability to multi-task and prioritise your own workload based on deadlines
 
The ability to confidently interface with stakeholders across all levels
 
The ability to articulate and demonstrate changes and success
 
Experience within the Financial Services sector, preferably within Payments and FX services (desirable)
 


 
Additional Information
 
Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.
title: Operations Data Analyst

job_desc:
Are you a motivated, hands-on Data Analyst who is looking to change your game?
 
Expleo is offering a great opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst in search of joining a global vision in supporting the transformation of the reporting landscape within Talent Acquisition and enable the team to deliver high-quality analysis efficiently and on time.
 
People are at the center of everything we do, be it our employees, candidates or clients. We focus all our energy providing the best experience. Recruiting data and insights are key to us understanding how we can continuously improve our candidate journey. The Talent Acquisition Data Analyst role plays an integral part in helping us understand our recruiting metrics to make informed decisions.
 
Be bold. Apply now!
 
 
 
 
Build and maintain required dashboards and visualizations to show results at a glance
 
 
Provide monthly, quarterly and annual global talent acquisitions reports for the Executive Committee based on key metrics and KPIS
 
 
Create new reports within our global recruitment tool iCIMS for users based on business needs
 
 
Partner closely with the business and our global IT team to ensure a high degree of data accuracy is maintained at all times
 
 
Identify data issues and implement corrective actions to ensure data accuracy is maintained
 
 
Safeguard Expleo’s data by implementing the relevant data protection policies
 
 
Create, refine, and automate reporting tools / models / dashboards that provide analysis and insight into KPIs
 
 
Deal with ad-hoc insights requests and queries
 


 
In addition, you will take responsibility for all periodic reporting. The aim is to improve and automate regular management reporting formats, allowing for timely and transparent reporting on the most relevant KPIs as well as ensuring data accuracy is maintained. The successful candidate has strong analytical skills, is motivated to get things done, shows a hands-on approach, and is keen on working in an international team.
 
 
 
 
Bachelor's degree in a data-related field or a combination of education and experience.
 


 
 
 
 
Experience in SQL and PowerBI
 
 
Experience in Python
 
 
Good communication and stakeholder Management.
 
 
Attention to detail, and analytical thinking
 
 
Confident knowledge of corporate organization, management, and applied analytics.
 
 
Significant personal initiative and tenacity both when working alone or as a member of a team.
 
 
Ability to review and analyze data and compile detailed professional and investigative reports.
 
 
Ability to operate in a global multicultural environment.
 


 
 
 
 
4-6 years of experience with Data Analytics, Data Visualization, and technology such as Power BI and Excel.
 
 
Prior experience in Recruitment and or Human Resources is a plus.
 


 
 
 
Why Join Us
 
 
Expleo is a trusted partner for end-to-end, integrated engineering, quality services and management consulting for digital transformation. We are a talent incubator. The time you spend at Expleo will turbo-charge your career, allowing you to work on complex technical challenges, enjoy opportunities to expand your skills and take part in inspiring, multi-disciplinary collaborations with your colleagues. Let’s change the game together. To find out more, visit www.expleo.com
 
 
 
 
Professional and Dynamic work setting
 
 
Opportunity to grow within organization
 


 
 
Expleo Values
 
 
We are guided by shared values in all things we do: Courage, Excellence, Collaboration, Respect and Accountability.
 
 
 
Courage – We are bold thinkers and doers, always ready to take on new challenges. We think of ourselves as entrepreneurs, matching creativity with vigilance.
 
 
Excellence – We are united by a shared ambition: change the game, together. Continuous performance is both an objective and a mindset.
 
 
Collaboration –Teamwork and emotional intelligence are what makes us stand out in a crowd. We stand shoulder to shoulder, with our clients and our peers, through good times and setbacks.
 
 
Respect – We are a hive of different profiles, and we place a high value on openness and transparency. We show respect, always.
 
 
Accountability – We are reliable. We celebrate our successes; we take responsibility and learn from our failures. This is why we protect our “right to fail” as an opportunity to bounce back and progress.
title: Data Analyst (Talent Acquisition)

job_desc:
Recruitment/HR Administrator
 
Head Office - outskirts of Brighton (BN1 8AP) – Office Based Role
 
37.5 hours per week Monday – Friday 9.00am – 5.30pm
Circa £22-23K depending on experience
 
At Capital, we have an opportunity within our HR team for an in-house Recruitment/HR Administrator.
Who are we?
We’re the UK and Ireland’s largest independent wholesaler and trusted supplier in the hair, nail and beauty industry with a Capital team of circa 550 colleagues. With 60 stores across the UK and Ireland and a growing ecommerce website, we sell top range brands such as
 
Olaplex, L’Oreal, Redken, Schwarzkopf, OPI, Sienna X, Babyliss
 
and many more, for professionals in the industry.
 
This is an excellent opportunity to “career step” into an in-house recruiter role taking on a range of varied and independent tasks.
 
Working as part of a small, interactive and friendly team, with the opportunity for occasional home working, you’ll have responsibility for administering the Company recruitment & selection process alongside assisting with HR administration and providing other general administration support. A normal day will also be taken up with:
 
 
 
Producing and placing job adverts on nominated job boards i.e. Indeed, LinkedIn and Company website.
Liaising between the appointed agency and the hiring manager for all vacancies placed with agencies on the PSL.
Completing and sending job offer letters, contracts of employment and all supporting job offer documents using Docusign.
Undertaking all administration relating to recruitment to comply with GDPR Regulations.
 
Providing additional HR administration support.
 


 
We also expect you to be a team player who will get involved in other elements of work in both the department and office, if required, so flexibility and adaptability are essential qualities for you to succeed, enjoy your working day and develop.
 
The role is supported on a day to day basis by the HR Administrator and reports to the HR Manager.
 
What can you bring to the HR team?
 
excellent and efficient administration skills, with a high attention to detail
good knowledge of LinkedIn and Indeed packages and processes
an intermediate knowledge of Microsoft packages, particularly Excel & Word
the ability to work in a fast paced & challenging environment
 
a natural aptitude to build relationships with colleagues throughout the business, particularly hiring managers, through personal interaction


 
Previous experience in a Recruitment admin role would be desirable.
 
Benefits include working in a friendly & inclusive head office environment and being part of a developing HR team with a successful company where people feel valued; we also offer staff a range of health & well-being /social activities, a discretionary bonus scheme and discounts on all our fabulous products!
 
We thank you for your interest in working for Capital Hair & Beauty and for taking the time to apply today.
 
Due to the high interest our roles receive, we are unable to respond to everyone individually and therefore only short listed candidates will be contacted.
 
 
Capital processes Job Applicant’s data within the principles of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
 
For the recruitment of this role the Company is not basing decisions on automated decision making.
title: Recruitment/HR Administrator

job_desc:
Acteon provides a range of industry-leading products and services to support marine and subsea projects for renewable energy, nearshore construction and oil and gas sectors across all phases of the lifecycle. We engineer solutions and integrated services using data and knowledge-based insight across our customers' floating and fixed marine infrastructure.


The market in which Acteon operates is shifting in favour of data-driven companies. Leading this transition, Acteon has a cross-discipline Digital team to promote development of new data-driven insights into our services and our customers' assets to drive increased performance and safety to personnel and environment.


We are looking for a dynamic Data Analytics Specialist to join this core team and be an integral part of our Digital Centre of Excellence. Awaiting the successful candidate are novel projects in marine installation optimisation, geo-data visualisation, and many others. Acteon Group is at an exciting point in its digital journey and the Data Analytics role will play a key part in its future development. 


Key Responsibilities
Transform domain expertise of technical authorities into intuitive, insightful digital products
Build and deploy models and data pipelines which support those and other digital services
Quickly prototype nascent digital concepts to build up value propositions
Work closely with Acteon's cloud IT Ops team to put prototypes into production
Establish and maintain governance processes for analytics models


Available Opportunities
Be seen as a transformative leader in data science within Acteon and by our clients
Gain domain knowledge in marine engineering
Grow our Data Analytics Centre of Excellence
Publish papers and attend industry conferences
Mentor Masters students and interns


Candidates Must Come Armed With
Analytical, inquisitive mindset
Exceptional listening skills and ability to translate concepts to non-technical audiences
Data science / advanced statistical analysis experience
Strong Python programming skills, focused on engineering and/or data science applications
Drive and ability to self-deliver work from concept to production
Knowledge of cloud analytics services and infrastructure (Azure preferred)
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases


Traits of a Successful Candidate
Degree in engineering, computer science, or similar (or equivalent industry experience)
Plan, organise and prioritise work; balance skills, priorities and timescales to achieve objectives
Ability to fully plan, build, and deploy Azure data analytics pipelines
Strong desire to be a digital promoter and transformer
Experience developing data models to aggregate data streams and delivering semantic layers to users
Familiarity interacting with IOT transport protocols and REST APIs
Understanding of ERP systems, e.g. Microsoft Dynamics 365
Experience working with engineering and operations teams in marine construction, renewables, or offshore oil & gas industries
title: Data Analytics Specialist

job_desc:
Great that you're thinking about a career with BSI!
 
We are looking for a permanent
 
Research & Data Analyst
 
to join our Research & Intelligence team.
 
The team combines the expertise of Information professionals, Market Research and Insight staff to deliver high-quality standards and regulatory intelligence, market insights, industry research and impact assessment.
 
The role will provide an interesting and varied workload conducting research and supporting analysis across a range of areas of emergent technology and innovation.
 
A core focus will be the provision of consultative enquiry and research services to BSI members, external customers, and staff. This includes responding to inbound enquiries via several channels, information retrieval across a range of resources and presentation of results back to the enquirer in a variety of formats. In addition, you will participate in cross-functional project teams to deliver research services as part of wider BSI commercial services.
 
The Research & Data Analyst will also be involved in a cross-business collaboration to ensure that knowledge acquired from enquiry and research activities is shared effectively across the division and more widely, if appropriate. You will work with the Senior Research, Data and Analytics Manager to identify and implement improvements to the enquiry and research services in order to respond to emerging client needs.
 
About The Company
 
BSI is a market-leading, globally renowned organisation and, as the UK’s national standards body, our role is to help improve the quality and safety of products, services, and systems by enabling the creation of standards and encouraging their use. From business continuity to recycling waste, from medical devices to the exploration of space, we help businesses embed the habits of excellence so that they perform better, manage their risks more effectively, and achieve sustainable growth and in doing so we touch the lives of many across the globe
 
Key Responsibilities
 
 
Assimilate the research approach, and understand the standards ecosystem and landscape on a sector and topic basis quickly.
Answering complex enquiries within agreed timeframes and policies.
Delivery of high-quality research outputs and analysis to a client brief, within agreed timescales and within budget.
Relationships built, successful collaboration and knowledge sharing across the team and with key stakeholders as appropriate.
Ability to ideate and deliver analysis in effective visual forms.
Excellent presentation skills.
Research delivered to meet a client brief, within required timescales and budget.


 
Education/Qualifications
 
What we are looking for:
 
 
Educated to degree level or equivalent


 
Knowledge, Skills & Experience
 
 
Experience in delivering complex research projects.
Experience in developing effective charts and/or infographics to convey complex data using data visualization tools.
Experience querying and manipulating data using SQL, Python or similar.
Customer-focused (internal & external), with a consultative approach to understanding requirements and issues.
Experience in data analysis, bibliographic databases and internet searches.
Experience in working directly (face to face and remotely) with clients on research briefs, the design of research services and the delivery and presentation of commercial research projects.
Experience in working cross-functionally and effectively sharing knowledge with colleagues.
Excellent presentation skills (verbal, written and formal)
IT literate
Ability to provide research outcomes in a useful, visual format.
Research skills, with the ability to provide insight and overviews from large data sets
Proven ability to engage successfully with cross-functional stakeholders


 
What we offer!
 
We offer a highly competitive starting salary with 27 days annual leave with the opportunity to increase this to 30 days, company-paid private medical insurance, an excellent company-contributed pension scheme, and a wide range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your lifestyle.
 
Our Excellence Behaviours: Client-centric, Agile, Collaborative. These three behaviours represent how we do things at BSI. They help us ensure that BSI is a great place to work and a highly successful business.
 
BSI is conducting face-to-face interviews where appropriate and possible. If you are invited to a face-to-face interview but feel more comfortable with conducting the interview virtually, please speak to a member of our recruitment team.
title: Research & Data Analyst

job_desc:
Calling all sales enablers, sales engineers, sales analysts...we have a completely unique new role that could be for you! We're not precious about the title, if you are confident at putting together unique customer value propositions, then we want to hear from you.

The successful candidate will support our enterprise sales team in closing six-figure deals. You'll be the product expert, from a technical and commercial standpoint, in demos and pitches. You will work your magic to create customer value documents and present them to our clients to get them over the line. 🧙‍♂️
 
So, what's our product?
 
We create ground-breaking immersive learning experiences in virtual reality 🥽, for senior leaders in companies such as Nike, Adidas, Amazon, Nvidia, Volvo...
 
Your responsibilities:
 
👇
 
 
Create customer value calculators to demonstrate potential ROI
 
Create standardised templates and process
 
Build customer value packs, unique to each customer’s use case, with numerical insights on investment versus return
Work with marketing and account management to create case studies
Support in sales meetings as the technical product expert, knowing which questions to ask to understand the customer business case, needs and requirements
Document customer meetings from a technical standpoint
Prepare demo agenda based on customer needs
Prepare customer presentations outlining the benefits of our product
Work closely with senior stakeholders to manage, deliver and present responses to RFPs
Stay up to date with new functionality within Gemba VR
 


Our Ideal Candidate will have: 👇
 
 
3+ years of experience in a similar role in SaaS enterprise sales, consulting, product marketing or business analysis
Demonstrable experience of creating value propositions
Experience leading application demos
Excellent communication skills and the ability to communicate patiently and effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
 
Exceptional attention to detail
Advanced PowerPoint and Excel skills
Experience in data analysis is desirable
 


In retur
n, we’ll give you 🎁
 
 
Generous learning budget of up to £1,000 per employee per year 📚
 
25 days annual leave🌴
 
3 extra days off if the office closes over Christmas 🎄
 
Birthday day off 🥳
 
Beautiful office with unlimited snacks 🍫 (healthy options available) 🍌
 
Private healthcare 🏥
 
Unlimited therapy sessions and support through Oliva 🧘‍♀️
 
Pension 👵
 
Competitive annual salary depending on experience 💸
 


Hours: Full Time - Permanent
 
Salary: £40,000 - £55,000 per annum depending on experience
 
Location: Wapping, London, UK. This is an office based role, Monday - Friday
 
Fast, flexible and compelling metaverse learning for global companies.

We deliver world class training through virtual reality.
title: VR Sales Engineer

job_desc:
Data Analyst
Leeds
 
(Please note this is NOT a remote working role and is based in Leeds)
£ Competitive & Benefits
 
Do you have SQL experience?
 
Do you have great data, reporting, MI and Analytical skills and experience?
 
 
The Markel National Markets UK Innovation & Change Team, based in Leeds, are rapidly expanding and are looking to hire a
 
Data Analyst
 
to help the business make data led informed decisions. The team is relatively new but growing and evolving, so we are looking for someone who can be flexible and adaptable as you’ll be supporting other projects, both short and long-term.
 
If you’re looking to foster your career working for a global insurance company then this may be the role for you!
 
What you’ll be doing:
 
 
Monitor/audit data quality & integrity and deduce necessary data-fix corrections
Work closely with, and provide support to, IT to ensure bug-fixes deliver the required data confidence
Filter and clean data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to locate and data anomalies / problems
Provide consultative advice on the implementation of databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other process / procedures or strategies to optimise data efficiency and quality
Mine and analyse large datasets to interpret trends or patterns and present them successfully to management using an appropriate reporting tool
Work with management to prioritise business and information needs
Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to fully understand data content
Gather, understand and document detailed business requirements using appropriate tools and techniques
Create spreadsheets, data dashboards, graphs and visualisations to convey a data-lead story
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities (automation and simplification) in order to increase reporting efficiency


 
What we’re looking for:
 
 
SQL is essential
Data extraction, collation and analysis generally
Writing complex SQL queries
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills able to drive insights out of data
Preparation of regular reports in multiple formats for different audiences / uses
Be able to communicate clearly, especially taking complex data and turning this into easily used and easily understood information for use by colleagues and other stakeholders
Being able to create influence and get along easily with colleagues often with whom most contact will be by telephone, email or video conferencing
Knowledge of the Insurance sector would be beneficial but not essential !
Experience of Power BI would be beneficial
Experience of T-SQL and Sequel Server Management Studio (SSMS)
Database design / utilisation
Working with data and making it useful for the business
Be flexible enough to be integral to a small team whilst collaborating with a large number of colleagues across a wider business
You will live in the Leeds area as the role involves 2 days per week in the Leeds office (this is not a 100% remote working role!)


 
About Markel:
 
Markel Corporation (NYSE – MKL) a fortune 500 company with over 60 offices in 20+ countries, is a holding company for insurance, reinsurance, specialist advisory and investment operations around the world.
 
In each of our businesses, we seek to deliver innovative products and adaptable customer service so that we can be a market leader. Our time horizon is long-term, our approach is disciplined, and our focus is on continuously improving the quality of the customer experience.
 
What’s in it for you?
 
 
A very competitive basic salary plus bonus & benefits
25 days’ holiday plus Bank Holidays, with the opportunity to buy / sell extra leave
Company matched pension scheme, private medical and dental cover, life assurance, travel insurance cover, income protection, a cycle2work scheme, season ticket loan, Employee Assistance Programme (EAP), parental, adoption and shared parental leave pay and plenty more
Voluntary benefits designed to suit your lifestyle – from discounts and cash back on retail and socialising, to health & wellbeing, travel and technology
The possibility of working from both the office and from home (hybrid), flexible working or other options are available
You’ll get the chance to follow your chosen career path anywhere within Markel
You’ll be joining a global network of experienced, innovative and dedicated individuals across multiple teams and countries. There are countless opportunities to learn new skills and develop in your career, and we’ll provide the support you need to do just that


 
What we hope you’ll do next:
 
Choose ‘Apply now’ to fill out our short application, so that we can find out more about you.
 
Markel celebrates the value of a diverse workforce that brings experience and expertise from a wide variety of backgrounds and life circumstances. Whatever your background, if you feel you meet the requirements of this role then we want to hear from you. We are also happy to consider candidates who are looking for flexible working patterns.
 
We are a Disability Confident Committed employer which means we want to ensure that you have a positive experience applying for a role at Markel and are able to perform at your best. If there are any adjustments we can reasonably make to ensure that the process is accessible for you at every stage please let us know.
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
We are a team on a mission, to put accessible and affordable healthcare in the hands of every person on earth. Our mission is bold and ambitious, and it’s one that’s shared by our team who shares our values, to dream big, build fast and be brilliant.
 
To achieve this, we’ve brought together one of the largest teams of scientists, clinicians, mathematicians and engineers to focus on combining the ever-growing computing power of machines, with the best medical expertise of humans, to create a comprehensive, immediate and personalized health service and make it universally available.
 
At Babylon our people aren’t just part of a team, they’re part of something bigger. We’re a vibrant community of creative thinkers and doers, forging the way for a new generation of healthcare.
 
We’re only as good as our people. So, finding the best people is everything to us. We serve millions, but we choose our people one at a time…
 
 
We’re building a top-tier data organisation. To help with that, we’re looking for talented and driven analytics engineers to work on our Analytics Platform team. You will be key member of the team tasked with designing and building the next iteration of our Analytics Platform. This platform is already the foundation of everything that the wider Analytics team does - and as such is key to the future success of the business. The next iteration requires us to build on what we have learnt so far and build a bigger, better and more accurate version of what we have today. It’s a big task but one we think is incredibly exciting.
 
TECH STACK
 
BigQuery, dbt, Tableau, Looker, Mixpanel, Airflow
 
 
 
Help to design and build the next iteration of our Analytics Platform - in particular our data warehouse
 
Architect complex datasets at scale and define standards to ensure consistency and ease of use across database models
Implement and design automated monitoring processes to ensure high-quality data for both internal and external stakeholders
Implement strong Data Governance practices to ensure the accuracy of data models
Collaborate with Subject Matter Experts to translate requirements into scalable solutions
Share our perspective on analytics - which is heavily influenced by this post from dbt Labs


 
 
 
Essential
 
2-5 years experience in similar roles
Mathematical background
Expert SQL skills
Experience of data modelling in a warehouse context
Strong attention to detail
Some python experience
Ability to self-organise and manage stakeholders
Demonstration of impact/going above and beyond basic role requirements




 
 
Desirable
 
Experience of dbt is a huge plus
Tableau/Looker and data visualisation ability
Knowledge of Airflow for scheduling models




 
 
 
Competitive salary package
 
New Hire Company Stock Grants (RSU)
Refresh Company Stock Grants (RSU)
Unlimited PTO
Flexible working hours and remote working
Private health care including physio and wellbeing for you, your partner and children
Life insurance cover of 4x salary
Pension contribution matched up to 5%
The Babylon App! Gain access to unlimited free consultations for you and your nearest and dearest


 
WORKING AT BABYLON
 
 
Whether you work in one of our amazing offices or a distributed team, Babylon is highly collaborative and fun! You’ll have a chance to work in a fast-paced environment with experienced industry leaders. We have a learning environment where you can make an impact.
 
 
We are a team on a mission, to put accessible and affordable healthcare in the hands of every person on earth. Our mission is bold and ambitious, and it’s one that’s shared by our team who shares our values, to dream big, build fast and be brilliant. To achieve this, we’ve brought together one of the largest teams of scientists, clinicians, mathematicians and engineers to focus on combining the ever-growing computing power of machines, with the best medical expertise of humans, to create a comprehensive, immediate and personalized health service and make it universally available.
 
At Babylon our people aren’t just part of a team, they’re part of something bigger. We’re a vibrant community of creative thinkers and doers, forging the way for a new generation of healthcare. We’re only as good as our people. So, finding the best people is everything to us. We serve millions, but we choose our people one at a time…
 
DIVERSITY AT BABYLON
 
We believe that difference inspires a better, healthier world. That’s why it’s at the heart of everything we do. From our people to our products, difference enriches every part of our business and creates a culture based on equality of opportunity, and in which all Babylonians can progress their careers. We’re committed to creating an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, pregnancy status, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
title: Analytics Engineer

job_desc:
About Enable
 
Market forces are dramatically reshaping supply chains, forcing drastic changes in trading behaviors between manufacturers, distributors and retailers. Many key business decisions are being made without a single source of truth to back them up, resulting in struggles to keep up with consumer expectations and increased disputes between partners.
 
At Enable, we believe in removing barriers between trading partners to create a healthier supply chain — and there’s no better way to do this than with rebates. Rebates drive partner behaviors, while increasing loyalty and trust. They help businesses and their trading partners better understand their data, boost their financial performance, mitigate risks, and drive efficiency and trust. When trading partners can make the best decisions for their businesses, everyone wins: manufacturers, distributors, retailers and, most importantly, end consumers.
 
That’s
 
the core of what we’re doing at Enable: creating a healthy, vibrant supply chain ecosystem
 
where partner collaboration drives the best products, services and values to customers.
 
This is an exciting role that will be contributing to the development and operations of the Data Platform to drive maximum value from data for business users and in line with company best practices. You will work as part of a cross-functional agile delivery team, including front and back-end engineers, customer support, product managers and infrastructure.
 
You will have the opportunity to work on complex problems, implementing high performance solutions that will run on top of our cloud based big data platform in Azure. Data drives Enable.
 
Accountabilities
 
 
 
Work as part of the Data Engineering team to uphold and evolve common standards and best practices, collaborate to ensure that our data solutions are complementary and not duplicative.
Build and maintain high-performance, fault-tolerant, secure, and scalable data platform to support multiple data solutions use cases.
Interface with other technology teams to design and implement robust products, services and capabilities for the data platform making use of infrastructure as code and automation.
 
Build and support platforms to enable our engineers to build our cloud based big data platform.
Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines on Azure using technologies such as Azure Data Factory and Azure Synapse Analytics
Help to engineer our platform ingestion, data warehouse/data lake and API strategies for our data management ecosystem
Work with large, complex datasets and integrate data from multiple sources
Work with our DevOps team to provide high availability data solutions that scale geographically


 
Experience
 
 
Experience working with Cloud architecture/administration in production environments.
Experience with object oriented and functional design, coding, and testing patterns as well as experience in engineering software platforms and large-scale data infrastructures.
Experience writing production quality code in C#/Python/Bash/Powershell/Go, etc
Experience of building and maintaining distributed platforms to handle high volume of data.
Good platform-level design, architecture, implementation and troubleshooting skills.
 
Experience with MS SQL
Good understanding of Enterprise patterns and best practices applied to data engineering and data science use cases at scale.
Good understanding of cloud storage and orchestration, and computing platforms (especially document/blob stores, GraphDB Kafka, Airflow, Elastic, Spark ).
Good understanding of DevOps/DataOps in an Agile Environment, familiarity with Jira and Confluence.
Experience of Docker/Kubernetes would be beneficial.
Expertise in Databases (Postgres, MySQL, etc)
Understanding network and security concepts on cloud-based environments, specifically on cloud services such as VPCs, Security Groups, NACLs and IAM roles.
 
Good understanding of CI/CD using tools like Jenkins/CircleCI/Azure Data Pipelines, along with deep experience in source control like Git.


 
Competencies
 
 
Great problem-solving skills, and the ability and confidence to hack their way out of tight corners.
Ability to prioritise and meet deadlines.
Conscientious, self-motivated, and goal orientated.
Excellent attention to detail and solid written and verbal English communication skills
Willingness and an enthusiastic attitude to work within existing processes / methodologies


 
Enable Global Inc provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Enable complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
 
Enable expressly prohibits any form of unlawful employee harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, genetic information, disability or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Enable employees to perform their expected job duties is absolutely not tolerated.
title: Junior Data Engineer

job_desc:
Data Analyst – 12 Month Contract
 
 
Your role with us
This role is responsible for defining, collating, requirement gathering and analysis of data within The Royal Mint to support the design of data repositories and analytical warehouses.
 
 
As the Data Analyst you will be responsible for supporting the data architecture and design of the analytics and insight architecture for TRM and help drive the data strategy for supporting customer and business insight, supporting near real time data processing, data streaming and advanced analytical modelling processes.
 
You will help promote an ethos of data informed decision making throughout the business and help drive the ambitious TRM business strategy through the delivery of a Data & Analytics strategy encompassing strong governance, agility of engineering and advanced analytical approaches covering all types of data.
 
We are looking for people who have:
 
 
Previous Data Analyst experience with addition technical skills (PowerBi, Power Query, DAX, Advanced Excel Capability) would be desirable
Experience with AX or other ERP platforms (desirable)
Strong working knowledge of and experience with different design approaches such as Inmon Corporate Data Model, Kimball Dimensional Modelling and Datavault 2.0
Working knowledge of a variety of database architectures, especially SQL Server


 
 
We are looking for people who are:
 
Highly experienced with an intimate understanding of data and analytics in the context of real world uses in a fast-moving business
Able to both articulate complex data designs and needs in a business-friendly manner and feel confident with discussing detailed technical needs with our engineering and architecture teams
Organised, commercially minded and a team player, you will bring a new set of ideas and skills to the team and won’t be afraid to put your opinions and ideas forward


 
 
If you think this role is for you and you would like to be considered for this opportunity, click “apply now” to complete our simple an online application form and ensure you attach an up-to-date copy of your CV.
 
 
More information and employee benefits:
 
 
Working within a flexible hybrid-working model (optional), a blend of home working and an office presence two / three days a week
Supportive and sponsored professional development opportunities + reimbursement of professional membership fees
25 days holiday + bank holidays
Generous Pension Scheme – with the ability to adjust your contribution amount
 
Automatic enrolment to The Royal Mint’s Life Assurance Scheme
 
Access to free onsite car parking and canteen proudly serving Costa Coffee
Access to various salary sacrifice schemes e.g. Technology, Cycle to work, Pendragon Car Leasing Scheme
 
Automatic access to our Hapi App offering retail and leisure discounts, and employee assistance/wellbeing programme in partnership with Health Assured
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
People are living longer than ever before, and we’re excited by the opportunities this brings. As a purpose-led business, we’re focused on supporting our customers as they navigate through new stages of their lives and all the moments that matter. We’re here for everyone who wants to make the most of their time on the planet and leave it a little better than they found it – however grand or humble their ambitions. Working at Aegon, you’ll play an important part in helping achieve this. We have three behaviors that are central to how we operate as a team and a business: we step up, we tune in and we’re a force for good.
 
 
The Team
We have an exciting opportunity for a Global Insights Data Analyst to join us, reporting to the Global Insights Manager, you will play a vital role in Aegon Asset Management.
 
The Role
As a Global Insights Data Analyst the role is to support the Global Insights team in its objective to inform, shape and drive business strategy through insights and analytics; ensure the reliability of data, examine data sets and design new processes for data modelling to identify trends to inform management on strategic decisions.
 
Key responsibilities
 
Drive and coordinate the development of data solutions for the Global Client Group to ensure timeous and competitive levels and qualities of data are available for internal and external use;
Drive and coordinate the implementation of data science tools for advanced analysis to create new processes for identifying trends to support the management of the Global Client Group;
Support the development of the Global Client Group’s technical infrastructure and implement processes and procedures for ongoing Global Client Group data analysis and management needs;
Support and at times represent the Global Client Group in major corporate change projects such as project RAFT and other RTS initiatives; develop and maintain productive relations with the key CAO functions (Finance, IT, Change and Data);
Support the management and optimisation of data content and quality in mastering systems and support the development of a Global Salesforce framework;
Support wider Global Insights Group’s initiatives in carrying out tactical and strategic quantitative and qualitative research as per business need, including using external data sources such as Morningstar and eVestment.


 
Skills
 
 
Experience in business analysis in the field of data; experience of working across functional teams;
Self-motivated with the ability to drive projects through to a successful conclusion, using a consultative approach and “can-do” attitude;
Good communication and writing skills, including excellent attention to detail;
Good influencing skills with the ability to source accurate information;
Proven ability to manage own time, demonstrating self-direction and resourcefulness;
Ability to deal credibly with business and technical users at varying levels of the organisation;
Experience of working in a fast-paced change environment.


 
Knowledge
 
 
Experience of working with Python and or Tableau
 


How we look after you
Outside of a competitive salary, working with us comes with a range of benefits that you can access from day one, including:
 
Non-contributary pension between 9-13% dependant on age
Life assurance cover
Private medical cover and health assessments
Access to Peppy – a digital health app for employees of all genders with a range of support covering areas such as general health, menopause, fertility, baby etc
Critical Illness cover
A suite of enhanced parental leave policies to support you in the moments that matter
Holiday trading
Private GP appointments with Doctor at Hand
Cycle2Work scheme
2 paid days per year for charitable volunteering
Employee wellbeing is key to our culture. We offer a range of online classes to support this, including yoga and meditation


 
We champion a collaborative, supportive working environment where you’ll have the opportunity to develop yourself and your career in a way that works for you. Our reward programmes encourage peer-to-peer recognition, and we offer a discretionary annual bonus dependent on company and individual performance.
 
How we look after the community and the environment
Aegon supports local causes that align with our purpose and ambitions. Our goal is to serve and strengthen the communities where we do business and create a better quality of life for everyone. Our employees are encouraged to support charities they feel passionate about and are offered volunteering days.
 
Responsible investment is a key element of Aegon’s company-wide approach to sustainability. Aegon is committed to Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) investing, we have over 30 years' experience managing responsible investments​ and offer over 200 responsible investment options across our platforms.
 
Flexible working
We’re transitioning to our new normal and we’re welcoming everyone back to working in new, collaborative, and exciting ways. We’ve adopted a hybrid environment of remote and office working, so it’s important that you live within a commutable distance to our offices.
We know that people have busy lives and commitments outside of work, so we offer flexible work arrangements where possible to support our employees.
 
We’re an equal opportunities employer
We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their age, disability, race, religion/belief, gender, sexual orientation, or gender identity.
As an international and multicultural business, we celebrate a range of festive days to support the rich diversity of our employees. Our Chief Marketing Officer leads our own LGBTQ+ community group, and we proudly sponsor Pride events across the UK.

job_desc:
Data Analyst/Insight Analyst
 
 
 
£50,000-£80,000
Knutsford (on site)
Flexible start times between 8am & 9:30 with 4pm finishes
25 days holiday + bank
Pension 8% employer contribution
Private medical BUPA
On site restaurant which is completely FREE

Free on site gym, machines, squat racks coupled with group classes including yoga & karate. Towel service, shower facilities and drying area.
On site parking
Share options after one year of service
Parental leave: 26 weeks at full pay, plus return to work bonus.
Daily transport support with shuttles to the train station, environmentally friendly car hire and bike storage


 
About the business & the role….
 
Are you a Data Analyst looking for a new challenge in a company with more benefits than we have ever seen!
 
We are partnered with a highly reputable cyber security business based on the outskirts of Knutsford in Cheshire. The business is a globally recognised for delivering cyber security software across more than 150 countries.
 
The business has been going through steady growth since its inception with over 20% revenue growth year on year. The business has remained privately owned meaning the benefits and development opportunities can constantly be developed.
In order to help growth initiatives the business formed an analytics and insight function which they are now in a position to expand (hence this advert).
 
Whilst being a very successful business the data journey is still in its infancy and the aim it to bring in some top talent to help mold the future of the data work within the business.
Based just off the M6 the offices are easily commutable from Manchester, Stockport, Wilmslow, Warrington, Crewe, Nantwich, Chester, Macclesfield and Northwich.
 
The business offer lots of scope for your future development, with planned out and achievable goals for you to get to the next step.
 
What Technical skills do you need?
 
 
Experience of working in a commercial Data Analyst or Insight Analyst role
Experience of building ETL processes to enable effective analysis and presentation of data
Strong SQL skills
Ability to write SQL queries
Experience of working with PowerBI or other visualisation tools
Would LOVE to see some Python but not required


 
What’s next?
 
Since there is an awful lot to tell about this business the best way to find out more is to apply and someone will be in touch, alternatively email any questions to danb@burnssheehan.co.uk
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
About Us:
 
StatsBomb was founded in January 2017 to provide data, analytics and consultancy to football teams, media and gambling companies, and has grown into a global multi-sports data and analytics SAAS provider.
 
StatsBomb are well known in the sports analytics industry for providing unique insights into the game of football and have developed a strong brand synonymous with highest quality and accuracy of data coupled with excellent customer service and support.
We have grown from our initial founder team of 3 at the start of 2017 to over 800 employees based in Europe, the US and Egypt, and are continuing to expand our operation as we build out our product portfolio and customer base.
 
Our core products are data and analytics tools, with a tech stack that includes computer vision, machine learning, stream processing, and web-based dataviz. We also have a growing consultancy service that allows customers to have additional access to our expertise and insight. From our origins as a blog pre 2017, StatsBomb have always had a strong foothold in the football analytics community and education remains a constant feature of both our products and our customer support ethos.
 
StatsBomb is an inspiring place to work. Our vision is clear - to be the world's leading sports data company - and we have a driven and dedicated leadership team to get us there, including the original founders, and headed up by CEO Ted Knutson. Our culture is open, honest, transparent, supportive and driven. Our employees are dedicated, motivated and genuinely love their work as well as the people they work with.
 
 
About The Role
 
At StatsBomb we are at the cutting edge of various aspects of the data analytics industry, however our Customer Success team is a truly unique offering within the industry. The StatsBomb Customer Success team manages and maintains the relationship with our customers within the football, gambling and media industries by offering detailed product demos, providing tools to manage the raw data, creating custom queries and reports and more. Our aim is to help our customers get more from our data, whether they are analysts, Sporting Directors, pundits/commentators, content creators or data scientists. A good customer success practitioner needs to be part consultant, part project manager, part product expert, part account manager and crucially for StatsBomb, an industry expert.
 
The majority of the work is done online, in the form of written emails or providing customers with reports as well as code - often creating new bespoke analysis either in R or Python depending on the customers internal set up. We also have a number of video calls with our customers and occasional face to face visits.
 
We are looking for an energetic and ambitious French speaking Customer Success Analyst to join our growing team. We are looking for someone who loves to scrutinize data to solve problems, who has experience with football data and with excellent communication skills. The ideal candidate will have advanced French language skills and will have impeccable written and spoken English skills.
 
The role is full time (38 hours) and can be flexible to suit your location/time zone and preferred ways of working. You should expect to be hands on from the beginning. You will be part of the Customer Success team who aim to provide the best customer service in the industry. You will be expected to fulfill some shifts during evenings and weekends - usually about 2 weekend days per month. You will be compensated at 1.5x per hour for all out of hours work that falls outside of your normal working week.
 
The career opportunities at StatsBomb are unlimited. Within the Customer Success team you will be working with our Data Scientists, Engineers and Product Owners, Marketing and Sales and there is flexibility to specialize in areas that interest you. We are keen to ensure that this role has growth opportunities and space for individuals to follow their areas of passion whilst also providing great value to our customers.
 
 
Job Responsibilities
 
 
Assist our customers and partners with setting up and using the products and services
Teach and demonstrate our products and services and assist in creating presentations and training
Respond to customer queries ranging from basic questions to advanced problem solving
Managing a subset of our customer base, ensuring they have everything they need to get the best out of StatsBomb Data and Analytics.
Responsible for customer renewals and upsells, establishing clear retention goals.
Creating bespoke reports and solutions for customers depending on their analysis needs
Updating customer information within our CRM to ensure one source of truth for all communication with our customers
Creating content and processes for our customer knowledge base in order to ensure that all bespoke reporting can scale and be used by all our customers as we grow
Helping customers use our API’s - showing them how to download, store and manipulate data using Python and R programming languages


 
Your technical skills:
 
Essential:
 
 
Confident interpersonal and written communication skills in English and French
Understanding Football / Soccer both generally and using data
Ability to solve problems on your own as well as in a team environment
A customer first mindset
Organized individual who can manage their time effectively
An eternal student who wants to continually learn and improve
A positive and optimistic attitude
2-4 years proven experience working in a similar role


 
Desirable:
 
Experience using Tableau/Power BI
Previous experience using StatsBomb Data
Python and / or R programming languages
Experience within a Customer Success Team
Written and verbal communication skills in German would be a plus.


 
Your background:
 
Experience working with Football Data
Educated to degree level
A passion for Football / Soccer
Proven ability to excel in a fast paced environment
Experience of Customer Success in a SAAS based industry


 
Salary
: £ 25-35K PA depending on experience plus a competitive stock option package.
 
 
Our process
:
 
An interview with someone from the Customer Success Team and HR plus a background check
An interview with 2 Customer Success Team members
A short task to check football / data analytics knowledge and approach to solving data queries
A final interview with at least one member of the senior management team


 
StatsBomb is an inspiring place to work. If you think you have the passion, drive and talent to join our exciting and fast paced team, we’d love to hear from you!
 
In return, we offer the following:
 
 
Excellent career development opportunities
The opportunity to work with smart and dedicated colleagues, working towards a shared vision
A collaborative and diverse team environment
Remote and flexible working as well as inclusive wellbeing benefits
Team social activities
Competitive salaries and commission
Out of Hour compensation
Competitive stock option package for all employees
Competitive holiday allowance:
25 days holiday,
1 well-being day per quarter,
1 day off on your birthday,
possibility to buy and sell holidays
Equal maternity and paternity provision (20 weeks)
title: Customer Success Analyst - French Speaking

Gemba is an award-winning EdTech company, bringing the metaverse to life for senior professionals in Global Fortune 2000 companies. 🚀

We create ground-breaking immersive learning experiences in Virtual Reality 🥽 for senior executives from companies such as Nike, Adidas, Amazon, Nvidia, Volvo...

Respond to security incidents and conduct investigations
Collaborate with IT and development teams
Keep up to date with regulation changes and ensure we are meeting them

👇
 
 
5+ years' experience in security and compliance
Deep understanding of compliance regulations and standards
Strong knowledge of GDPR
Strong knowledge of ISO 27001
Bsc in computer science, IT or related field
Professional security certificates highly desirable
 


In return, we’ll give you
 
🎁

25 days annual leave🌴
 
3 extra days off if the office closes over Christmas 🎄
 
Birthday day off 🥳
 
Beautiful office with unlimited snacks 🍫 (healthy options available) 🍌
 
Private healthcare 🏥
 
Unlimited therapy sessions and support through Oliva 🧘‍♀️
 
Pension 👵
 
Competitive annual salary depending on experience 💸
 


If this sounds like you, then apply today!
 
Please note that unfortunately we cannot offer sponsorship for this position so all candidates must have the right to work in the UK.
 
Hours: 8.30am - 5pm, Monday - Friday

Location: Wapping, London, UK

Salary: £50,000-70,000 per annum, depending on experience

Fast, flexible and compelling metaverse learning for global companies.

We deliver world class training through virtual reality.
