job_desc:
This role has been identified as "job share friendly" by the team at Roleshare.com. As a result, Roleshare is promoting this role via our channels to showcase forward-thinking employers that offer this form of workplace flexibility. If you are interested in finding a jobshare partner for this role, please sign up on Roleshare.com and click "show interest" on the role.
 
The Opportunity
 
As a data Analyst you will work in partnership with stakeholders from a variety of internal teams to create and deliver MI reports, dashboards, and solutions. You will be involved in the production of a portfolio of reports, ad-hoc analysis, and projects that will help the business make better data-led decisions and streamline processes. On top of generating business insights and presenting analysis findings, you will aim to challenge the status quo by introducing new perspectives and innovative thinking to drive new methods and you will represent the MI/Data team in a variety of interesting projects.

You may be an Data Analyst looking for a fresh new challenge or you may even be working as a Reporting Analyst, Financial Analyst, MI Analyst or Data Scientist and looking to take your career in a different direction.
 
Key Areas Of The Role
 
 
Responsible for all areas of MI reporting.
A good communicator able to present findings and solutions to senior stakeholders, in a clear and concise manner.
Embrace and encourage the use of technology to deliver MI/BI in the most effective ways
Drive continuous improvement and challenge the status quo by introducing new perspectives and innovative thinking beyond recognised ways of doing things.
Comprehensive experience of data extraction, cleansing, and validation from our core platforms and systems.
Document as-is and to-be business reporting data models, processes, and workflows, identifying relevant problems with existing systems and processes.
Assist with the design, production, and on-going maintenance of detailed, accurate and consistent monthly reporting dashboards, including management accounts, month end financial results, monthly key performance indicators and capacity reporting.
Create new reporting models which combine and summarise data from multiple sources using Excel and other reporting/analytical tools.
Analysis of complex datasets to create a clear, accurate and accessible reports with the aim of helping the wider business to plan effectively.
Be responsible for providing crucial data led insights, trend analysis and other factors like seasonality which will help the wider business to identify opportunities for improvement.
Be a Team Player by seamlessly working alongside our wider Engineering teams, including tax, finance, and credit control.
Knowledge of Reconciliation methodologies with a good understanding of financial concepts.
Assist with requirements for internal and external audit and ensure SOX compliant
 


Your Skills And Experience
 
 
Strong analytical skills and previous experience of working in a MI Analyst/Data Scientist capacity preparing MI and Insights for key stakeholders.
Excellent numeracy and organizational skills to ensure a strong focus upon accuracy and maintenances of company documentation & processes
Experience of using business intelligence and reporting tools such Power BI to a high level.
Proven experience of using Excel, Power Query and SQL
Has worked in industry to gain experience of:
Finance with a good knowledge of VAT requirements.
Project work to deliver and support MI reports or solutions
Ability to work autonomously, as well as effectively collaborating within a team
Good knowledge and understanding of IT and data concepts.
Creative problem solving and critical thinking.
Effective communicator, with a high level of interpersonal skills, demonstrating the ability to explain complex issues in a concise and straightforward way to a wide range of audiences.
Ability to effectively manage time and resources to consistently prioritise and deliver within a fast-paced environment.
Desirable experience of the following:
Working in a customer focussed environment, ideally within an insurance or Engineering business.
Knowledge of engineering / inspection terminology and working practices.
 


What will you get in return?
 
Benefits
 
In addition, we also offer an excellent lifestyle benefits package which includes

We are offering a salary in the region of £27,000 to £32,000, depending on experience.
 
 
Flexible ways of working to help support a healthy work life balance
Annual company bonus
12% company pension contribution (employee contribution optional)
25 days holiday plus bank holidays and additional 3 volunteering days
Contribution to medical cover
Discounted technology offers
Virtual GP appointments
Discounted gym membership,
Free flu jab
Discounted gadget insurance
 


In this role you can also work towards a Level 4 qualification (HNC) in Data Analysis – dependant on meeting qualifying criteria.

At Zurich we will consider requests for flexible working on hiring. Many of our employees work flexibly in many ways, including part-time, flexible hours, job share, or compressed hours. Please talk to us at interview about the flexibility you may need.
 
Who We Are
 
With about 55,000 employees serving customers in more than 170 countries we aspire to become the best global insurer as measured by our shareholders, customers, and employees. If you're interested in working in a dynamic and challenging environment for a company that recognises and rewards your creativity, initiatives, and contributions - then Zurich could be just the place for you. The success of our business is built on the contributions of our highly talented employees - people who work every day to position us at the forefront of the insurance industry. We therefore look to hire great people and we encourage those people to give their best.

You’ll feel the support of being part of a strong and stable company. A long-standing player in the insurance industry, we make every effort to address the career development needs and plans of our employees to ensure their success in the future.
 
Our Culture
 
At Zurich we are proud of our culture. We are passionate about Diversity and Inclusion. We want you to bring your whole self to work we have a diverse mix of customers, and we want our employee base to reflect that.

Our diversity and inclusion initiatives are creating an environment where everyone feels welcome regardless of protected characteristics.

With the above in mind, we accept applications from everyone regardless of your background, beliefs, or culture however we especially welcome applications from women, people from ethnic minorities, people with a disability and people who are LGBT+ as these groups are currently under-represented in our organisation.

We are committed to continuous improvement, and we offer access to a comprehensive range of training and development opportunities. Zurich is passionate about supporting employees to help others by getting involved in volunteering, charitable and community activity through the Zurich Community Trust.
 
So, make a difference. Be challenged. Be inspired. Be supported, Love what you do. Work for us.
title: Data Analyst - Part-Time, Job-Share and Full-Time

job_desc:
Job details
 
Work Settings Disability confident Job type Full-time Permanent
 
 
Pulled from the full job description Company pension Cycle to work scheme Employee discount Gym membership Paid volunteer time
 
 
Overview:
 
Barnett Waddingham is proud to be a leading independent UK consultancy at the forefront of risk, pensions, investment and insurance. Each individual delivers on our shared values and our commitment to ensuring the highest levels of trust, integrity and quality. We aim to continue our growth by recruiting talented and committed individuals that have the desire to learn and develop. We strive to employ staff who share our values and can bring special skills – enhancing the service that we provide to our clients. Our Longevity team undertakes assignments for life and health insurers, both in the UK and internationally, and also for pension schemes. Ongoing clients include the Continuous Mortality Investigation (CMI), part of the Institute and Faculty of Actuaries, and J P Morgan. Our work often involves analysis of individual data portfolios and population data, to help clients understand future longevity experience and its implications. The Longevity team is part of the Insurance and Longevity Consulting (ILC) business area, which collectively provides consultancy services under both long-term support contracts and on standalone projects to a range of insurance and non-insurance clients. The ILC Team is predominantly based in London and has around 45 staff. We pride ourselves on being a friendly and inclusive firm, which maintains its core values of
 
Principled, Quality, Partnership and Respect.
 
We have a supportive structure in place to help you manage your work/life balance. As part of the longevity team you will be working on the following tasks:
 
 
Undertaking analyses of data portfolios for both life and health insurers, both in the UK and internationally, as well as for pension schemes, to understand current and recent mortality (or morbidity) experience.
Analysing individual data portfolios and population data, to understand future longevity experience and its implications.
Peforming and summarising calculations, model runs and data analysis.
Developing models and processes under guidance of more senior team members to improve efficiency.
Assisting with drafting client communications and deliverables, including emails, papers and presentations.


Who are we looking for?
 
The individual we are seeking will need a minimum of B in A-Level of Maths and have an interest in developing their skills in Microsoft Excel, R, Tableau and other software, through training in the role, and learning to use and maintain analysis systems What's in it for you?:
 
Core benefits paid for by BW:
 
 
Competitive discretionary annual bonus
Life assurance
Group income protection
Private medical cover
25 days holiday per year (up to 30 days with holiday trading)
A generous pension scheme where we contribute 8% of your salary from day one of your employment and you contribute 1% as a minimum
Employee Assistance Programme to support you and your family through any concerns or challenges you may experience
Fresh fruit, hot and cold drinks provided free of charge in all of our offices
Sports Allowance - we pay 50% (up to £50) of your monthly gym membership or sports costs


A comprehensive range of voluntary benefits to suit your life stage and lifestyle including:
 
 
Tech scheme
Cycle to work scheme
Dental cover
Healthcare cash plan
Health assessments
Critical illness cover
Extension of private medical cover or life assurance to family members
Discounted gym membership options
Travel insurance
Broad range of discounts at hundreds of retailers including supermarkets, fitness centres, travel and leisure companies


Giving Something Back:
 
 
1 paid volunteering day per year as a commitment to our Corporate Social Investment
Support your favourite charity with the "Give as You Earn" option
Match-funding for individuals raising money for a recognised charity
Our corporate social investment programme is an integral part of what we do and is focused on ensuring that our overall impact is a positive one. We recognise that we have an impact that goes beyond our core activities.


Values
: our values are PRINCIPLED, RESPECT, QUALITY AND PARTNERSHIP - they are important to us and we want them to be important to you as well.
 
Wellbeing
: employee wellbeing has always been important to us and our approach is to create an environment where individuals will be engaged at work, successful in what they do and able to achieve their full potential, benefiting both their self and the business. BW offer a great range of employee benefits as we believe it's important individuals are supported in making choices which are flexible enough to meet their needs and help support their wellness.
 
Diversity
: we are committed to having a diverse and inclusive workforce where people from all backgrounds, beliefs and perspectives can thrive, feel welcome and develop to their full potential. We are committed to equality of opportunity for all and welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates, regardless of their race, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, disability, religion/belief, age, pregnancy and maternity, and marriage and civil partnerships. Our recruitment processes are designed to be fair and consistent and enable candidates to compete on a level playing field. We recognise that diversity today means more than race and gender. This is why we created an environment where a variety of different voices are encouraged and heard through our employee network groups. The groups work together to build an inclusive and diverse place for us all to work. We have attained the Disability Confident Committed status and are actively working towards the next level, Disability Confident Employer.
 
Your progression:
 
we offer career progression opportunities and a focus on training and professional development to provide you with the tools and skills to thrive. We also offer study support for relevant professional or skills qualifications.
 
Other activities
: we have clubs, sporting events, social, cultural and belief groups across our offices if you’d like to join in and meet like-minded people.
 
Accessibility
 
Please visit AbilityNet should you benefit from advice on making your device easier to use if you have a disability. Should you require information in a different format, have other accessibility or reasonable adjustment requirements or if you find any problems not listed on this page, please contact careers@barnett-waddingham.co.uk or call us on 0333 11 11 222.Postal applications should be sent to: Talent Acquisition, Barnett Waddingham, St James's House, St James Square, Cheltenham, Gloucestershire, GL50 3PR
 
Not quite the right opportunity for you this time?
 
Follow Barnett Waddingham on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/barnett-waddingham-llp in order to receive updates and posts about future opportunities, webinars and industry event invites, industry news and insights, exposure to new connections, BW services and new content.
title: Junior Data Analyst

job_desc:
TransUnion's Job Applicant Privacy Notice
 
 
About TransUnion:
 
TransUnion is a global information and insights company which provides solutions that help create economic opportunity, great experiences and personal empowerment for hundreds of millions of people in more than 30 countries. We call this Information for Good®.
 
TransUnion is a leading credit reference agency and we offer specialist services in fraud, identity and risk management, automated decisioning and demographics. We support organisations across a wide variety of sectors including finance, retail, telecommunications, utilities, gaming, government and insurance.
 
 
This is a Talent Community pool and by submitting your application here will allow us to save your details and we will contact you regarding any suitable opportunities as they arise.
 
At TransUnion we’re happy to talk flexible working, both in terms of location and hours. We operate a hybrid model allowing you to explore the balance of work from home or from our offices in Leeds or London.
 
 
In the Data Science and Analytical team, we rely on powerfully insightful data and we’re seeking analysts and consultants to work in a dynamic, research-oriented team. We serve a broad range of customers who we provide predictive modelling and scoring solutions. We are also involved in the development of and update of key data products. Our roles include opportunities to take part in data analysis and modelling projects from design to communication of results.
 
We in an exciting period of growth and have several roles available both in the UK and Lithuania.
 
 
 
Analyst
Senior Analyst
Analytical Consultant
Product Manager - Data
Senior Manager - Banking & Payments Insight Analytics
 


 
We pride ourselves on the collaborative and supportive way in which we work, both in our dealings with customers and as an internal community of professionals. We’ve established effective ways of working from home that help to keep our associates engaged with our work and with each other, regardless of location.
 
We’re part of a Global structure and work together with our international colleagues to share best practice, knowledge and expertise.
 
 
We know that you may not possess every aspect of the essential and/or desirable skills listed above but if there’s something you can’t tick off, don’t let that put you off applying as we could explore training for you.
 
 
What’s In It For you?
 
At TransUnion you will be joining a friendly, forward thinking global business underpinned with a focus on employee wellbeing and engagement. As well as a competitive salary and bonus scheme our benefits package starts with 26 days’ annual leave + bank holidays (increasing with service), a generous contributory pension scheme, private health care and a whole host of other employee lifestyle benefits.
 
That is in addition to a variety of physical, mental, and financial fitness wellbeing programmes such as lunchtime yoga, mindfulness app access and our diversity forums.
 
Interview & Hiring Process
 
Most of our recruitment processes are virtual, so you will get to know our hiring managers and teams over the phone and through video. If we need you to attend a physical in person interview your recruiter will inform of this.
 
Reasonable Adjustments
 
If you require any reasonable adjustments to attend an interview with us, please detail this on your application.
 
TransUnion Job Title
 
Analyst NE, Data Science and Analytics

job_desc:
Please note this is a part-time role for 3 days per week with a view of being full-time in the future. Salary is negotiable depending on experience and is on a pro-rata basis.
 
THIS IS AN ON-SITE / HYBRID ROLE. PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU ARE UNABLE TO WORK IN MACCLESFIELD.
 
Remap Consulting is searching for a talented, friendly, and enthusiastic individual to join our expanding team in the
 
Presentation Specialist
 
role. We are looking for candidates to support our project and operations teams in all aspects of delivery.
 
You may apply via LinkedIn jobs, however, in order to be considered for this role, you will also be required to send a CV, covering letter and a portfolio of presentation design work demonstrating your abilities to careers@remapconsulting.com.
 
About Remap
 
Remap Consulting is a specialist pharmaceutical pricing, reimbursement and market access consultancy offering an integrated, evidence-based approach to optimising price and patient access for our client’s products. We work with a broad range of clients, from top 10 pharma through to small start-up organisations on a diverse range of business-critical projects, market access training and product launches.
 
Job Purpose
 
You will be working closely with senior management, operations and project delivery teams in preparing and supporting various projects such as styling and formatting documents for pitches, client deliverables, training materials and providing various administrative support activities that support our strategic pricing and market access projects that meet the client and business needs.
 
You will be expected to spend approximately 3 days per week supporting the delivery of our projects, principally through interpreting complex data-driven content in PowerPoint. You must be able to clearly communicate complex text driven information through visual representation in PowerPoint in a concise and impactful way. Fundamental to your PowerPoint capabilities will be solid formatting and proof-reading ability to ensure our deliverables are accurate and consistent.
 
As part of your application, we would like to see a portfolio of presentations work demonstrating your capabilities in this area.
 
Your remaining time will be spent on various other administrative responsibilities, which will vary week by week depending on the needs of the project/business.
 
The role requires the ability to work well as part of a team but also be self-motivated to complete the tasks independently, using your own initiative where appropriate.
 
The Ideal Candidate
 
The ideal candidate will be experienced in creating engaging data revisualisation’s, recreating figures and data-led charts in PowerPoint such as styling and formatting documents for pitches, client deliverables, training materials and providing various administrative support activities that support our strategic pricing and market access projects that meet the client and business needs.
You will have a proven creative aptitude of developing and communicating complex information visually in PowerPoint in a clear and simple way coupled with strong administrative skills. Candidates will be highly organised, able to efficiently multi-task and can communicate effectively in a friendly and courteous manner at all levels and have a keen eye for detail with an ability to complete tasks efficiently to meet challenging deadlines.
 
The successful candidate will be enthusiastic, confident and have a flexible approach to work. You should be able to demonstrate good organisational skills including the ability to multi-task, prioritise work under pressure and meet conflicting deadlines. You will be willing to go the extra mile to support a diligent team of like-minded individuals.
 
Required skills
 
Proven advanced PowerPoint creative design with a minimum of 3 years experience, preferably within the pharmaceutical / life sciences industry
Highly proficient in creating meaningful PowerPoint presentations through creative design, advanced drawing techniques, formatting and animations
Ability to work quickly and accurately to produce original and compelling presentations using native PowerPoint
Strong typographical and composition skills
Proven administrative experience, preferably within the pharmaceutical industry and/or a consultancy environment
Excellent IT skills – Spreadsheets, word processing, PowerPoint, email, and data entry
Excellent work ethic and commitment to delivering high quality work
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
Knowledge of graphic software (i.e. Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign – Advantage
Portfolio or work samples (presentations preferable) – Advantage


 
Behaviours
 
Results driven:
 
Takes responsibility for own activities and tasks, demonstrating a desire to achieve the best possible results. Takes a proactive approach to tasks, requiring minimal supervision
Team working:
 
Actively work with colleagues to build relationships and maintain a strong effective team
Effective communication:
 
Able to communicate effectively with both excellent written and verbal communication skills
Planning and organising:
 
Highly organised with the ability to prioritise and respond to requests and enquiries in a timely and accurate manner
Time management:
 
Ability to multi-task, prioritise work under pressure and meet conflicting deadlines
Quality management:
 
High level of accuracy/attention to detail. Be proactive about improving processes and ways of working, actively seeking and acting on feedback.


 
Key Responsibilities
 
Presentation Design Skills
 
Responsible for the comprehensive preparation of PowerPoint presentations for designated projects to be delivered to global pharmaceutical clients
Creation of effective, dynamic and well-thought-out internal and external presentations
Formatting and styling of high-quality creative PowerPoint presentations to specific guidelines with a high level of consistency and accuracy
Creatively re-visualise and animate slide content, recreating figures in PowerPoint
Create new fit for purpose icons, figures and diagrams and re-drawing graphs, charts and tables in PowerPoint
Proof reading and document formatting ensuring adherence to company branded guidelines
Manage your own projects, ensuring deliverables are achieved within stated timelines
Support the team in the creation of high-quality reports, presentations, and other client deliverables


 
Other Responsibilities May Include:
 
Proof reading and document formatting ensuring adherence to company branded guidelines


 
You must be able to demonstrate that you are eligible to work in the UK
title: Presentation Specialist

job_desc:
About The Role
 
Balfour Beatty Vinci has an exciting opportunity for an Data Analyst to join our team in Coleshill.

There has never been a more exciting time to join Balfour Beatty Vinci in the delivery of Europe's largest major infrastructure project.

We are currently looking to recruit an Data Analyst as part of our core team.
 
What We Can Offer You:
 
Joining the countries largest infrastructure project there are a whole host of opportunities to develop, progress and gain experience that will last a lifetime.

Our employees are at the heart of everything we do and as such we realise they are the reason we are able to achieve the performance expected from our clients.

In addition to a competitive base salary, we can also offer a wide range of benefits, including:
 
 
Company Pension scheme;
Share Scheme opportunities;
Competitive annual leave;
Company car/allowance;
Flexible Benefits;
Flexible Working.


What you'll be doing
 
 
Support BBV Data Model, including process and procedures for onward management and communication to the project team.
 
Resolving/directing issues logged with our central helpdesk regarding PowerBI
Map chosen and delivered systems to the data model.
Managing the model and interfaces into other systems "Common Coding"
Support processes in place for data lake ingestions and common coding feeds
Power platform and similar tools to support master data management and reporting solutions


Who we're looking for
 
 
 
Database development (SQL)
 
 
Application architecture and reporting from underlying databases or APIs
 
 
Ability to present reports and information in a variety of ways
 
 
Experience of gathering user requirements and producing appropriate documentation/specifications
 


Why work for us
 
Balfour Beatty VINCI (BBV)
 
is responsible for designing and building part of the most exciting and challenging infrastructure project in Europe: HS2.

We are building the West Midlands section of HS2's Phase One route, spanning approximately 90km from Long Itchington in Warwickshire to the centre of Birmingham and on to Handsacre in Staffordshire. We will be employing thousands of people from the region to design and build the civil infrastructure for HS2 and we are looking for a wide range of skills to join the team and support this unique and ground breaking project.
 
Diversity and Inclusion:
 
We aim to be a leader in equality, diversity and inclusion by creating a safe inclusive working environment for all - living our values of Safety, Respect, Integrity and Leadership. We are positive and inclusive about making adjustments, providing flexible working, encouraging all staff to engage in a diverse range of year round learning opportunities and provide personal development opportunities. Our aim is to attract more people from diverse backgrounds to help us build on our inclusive culture.
 
Flexible working:
 
Flexible or agile working is encouraged at BBV and we recognise the value and diversity of candidates which this can bring to our business operations. Not every role can provide a variety of working patterns to suit people's personal needs however we are happy to discuss agile working opportunities at BBV with you.
 
Disability confident:
 
We care about being inclusive and that means we encourage applications from people with diverse set of backgrounds and experiences. BBV is Disability Confident committed and we welcome applications from candidates with a disability.
 
About Us
 
Balfour Beatty VINCI is a long established joint venture between two global leaders in the delivery of critical infrastructure. Working together for over 30 years, we have been successful in delivering a number of significant infrastructures; creating unrivalled expertise and capability across rail, highways and aviation sectors in the UK and beyond.

In 2008, we announced our formal alliance with the aim of delivering modern and innovative solutions to the UK's infrastructure needs. Since then, our collaboration has gone from strength to strength. We've successfully bid and delivered many key projects for Crossrail and Highways England Smart Motorways Programme. Balfour Beatty VINCI is a powerhouse for critical infrastructure.
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
About us
Inosys is an independent consultancy providing creative solutions to the marine energy sector in the fields of geophysics, geotechnics, geohazards and foundation engineering.
We think creatively to delivery high-performance integrated services throughout the marine project life cycle.
We are a small but expanding team with decades of experience, embracing and developing new and innovative technologies to leverage optimal solutions.
 
Roles and responsibilities
- Geotechnical data interpretation
- Production of integrated desk studies
- Scoping studies for marine site investigations
- Scoping, specification and supervision of geotechnical laboratory programmes
- Production of factual and interpretive site investigation reports
- Creation and population of GIS ground models in collaboration with GIS
colleagues
- Leading projects and supervising others
- Providing advice and guidance to project stakeholders
 
About you
You will be an ambitious and self-motivated geoscientist, seeking to utilise your skills and behaviours to deliver high-quality work individually and as a team member. You will be curious, with a desire to embrace knowledge and technologies to further the needs of both the business and your own professional development.
 
Experience and skills
- Comprehensive knowledge of soil mechanics, geophysical and geotechnical data acquisition and interpretation, geohazard risk, laboratory testing and GIS processes.
- Robust working knowledge of geophysical and geotechnical data acquisition, engineering ground modelling, numerical analyses, data management, value & solution-driven engineering aspects of the offshore industry.
- Minimum of 5 years of direct experience in engineering geology roles including offshore data acquisition of both geophysical and geotechnical data use would be beneficial.
- BSc or MSc in Geotechnical Engineering or Engineering Geology.
- Proficiency in a range of analyses using the application of industry standard software, such as gINT, HoleBase, OpenGround or GeoDin.
- Familiarity with GIS platforms and use.
- Technical report writing skills.
- Successful applicants must have the right to live and work in the UK.
 
Behaviours
- Collaborative mindset
- Excellent communication and organisational skills
- High level of self-motivation
- Strong desire to develop skillset and knowledge further
- Strong ability to motivate and mentor others development
 
What we’ll offer you
Benefits of this role include a competitive salary together with an attractive package including contributory pension scheme, private medical insurance, life assurance, 25 days annual leave and option for hybrid working.
 
Please send your CV and cover letter to info@inosys.co.uk.
title: Senior Geotechnical Engineer

job_desc:
Capita is looking for a Data Migration Analyst to join our team to support the execution of client implementation projects to a high standard within a controlled project environment. Home based role.
 
Help strengthen our Data Management Team as our Senior Data Analyst. Home based role.
 
Capita is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our team to support the execution of client implementation projects to a high standard within a controlled project environment. You'll participate in the design, implementation, integration and support of mainframe, mid-frame and operating systems ancillary software products.
 
What you'll be doing:
 
 
Suggest improvements to Implementation data processes
Troubleshoot and resolving client issues
Support and develop team members and manage resource for specific tasks
Own and be responsible for performing ad-hoc or unusual Implementation data processes
Lead on client implementation projects
Act as a centre of technical and process expertise accessible to other team members, checking other members of the teams' work
Gather and interpret client requirements and processes, translating these into online solutions


 
What we're looking for:
 
 
Extensive data analysis and data migration experience
Ideally good SQL skills
Ideally possess DB Pensions knowledge and experience
Strong MS Excel skills, ability to use filters, sorting, pivot tables (rows, columns, grouping, filters and totalling), lookups, control totals, IF and nested IF statements and formatting of cells to specific guidelines
Can parse and import data/text files and use data validation on excel
Can create and run macros on excel
Can analyse data requirements and specifications and/or documentation to translate into internal processes, configuration and setup
Ability to understand requirements and able to produce specifications
Ability to analyse content and can select the pertinent points for the tasks


 
About Capita Pensions Solutions:
 
At Capita Pension Solutions (CPS), we create and implement resilient and responsible pension strategies to help your organisation and your people look forward to a more secure financial future. From pensions administration and consultancy, to the latest technology and engagement techniques, we help ensure sustainable investments which support your success. Join us and discover better ways to engage with and value today's employees.
 
 
What's in it for you?
 
 
Opportunity to progress your career
23 days' holiday (rising to 27 days with length of service) with the opportunity to buy extra leave
The opportunity to take a paid day out of the office, volunteering for our charity partners or a cause of your choice
Access to our Employee Network Groups, which represent every strand of diversity and allow colleagues to connect and learn from each other on an open, inclusive platform
Company matched pension, a cycle2work scheme, 15 weeks' fully paid maternity, adoption and shared parental leave and plenty more


 
You'll get the chance to follow your chosen career path anywhere in Capita. You'll be joining a network of 55,000 experienced, innovative and dedicated individuals across multiple disciplines and sectors. There are countless opportunities to learn new skills and develop in your career, and we'll provide the support you need to do just that.
 
What we hope you'll do next:
 
Choose 'Apply now' to fill out our short application, so that we can find out more about you.
 
To view our Covid-19 and process adjustments information, please visit the Capita Careers site.
 
We're an equal opportunity employer, which means we'll consider all suitably qualified applicants regardless of gender identity or expression, ethnic origin, nationality, religion or beliefs, age, sexual orientation, disability status or any other protected characteristic.
title: Data Analyst (Level 3)

job_desc:
Title: Cannabis Market Data Analyst
Employment type: 
Full time
Location: 
CanXchange Headquarters - London, UK
Reporting to 
CFO - Co-founder


OVERVIEW 
As industrial cannabis becomes an increasingly important agricultural commodity globally, CanXchange is committed to providing it with the infrastructure that more established commodities benefit greatly from.
We launched an innovative and user-friendly trading platform in February 2020 to provide our users with the first cannabis exchange of its kind to help unlock the potential of cannabis.
At CanXchange we believe the industry needs and deserves the right tools and secure market to perform trusted transactions.
Our team is driven to support our peers by sharing a wealth of trading, technology, client services, and industry knowledge and experience.
The CanXchange team is value driven, strategic, and entrepreneurial, and in order to continue our growth we are seeking a talented Cannabis Commodities Analyst to help further expand our business footprint.
For more information please visit: www.canxchange.eu


ROLE SUMMARY 
The Cannabis Commodities Data Analyst is responsible for generating market intelligence and reports aimed to be distributed to the company’s clientele but also to external stakeholders of the cannabis industry. The selected individual will work closely with Canxchange customers along with its internal sales and trading team in order to offer valuable insights that create an edge for trading decision-making. The ideal candidate is someone who can both improve the existing data offering and be an idea generator on how to best optimize the use of market data. The role comprises a number of responsibilities including but not limited to:
Publish Cannabis Commodities market research on a weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis;
 Work closely with the Sales & Trading Team in order to collect their market insight;
Liaise with the press when Canxchange’s opinion is asked about market prices and trends;
Develop & nurture customer relationships in order to create a global network of data contributors;
Build detailed fundamental cannabis commodity supply and demand models;
Develop and expand analytics tools and processes while staying on top of the market
research and insights
Model cannabis commodity data and produce ad hoc analysis based on short-term
market developments
Evaluate and improve data quality
Participate in the development of the data department and become the key individual of
a naissant team;


SKILLS & EXPERIENCE 
Prior Market data analyst (at least 2 years)
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in statistics, mathematics, computer science,
finance or economics
Strong understanding of data modeling using Python and/or VBA
Excellent analytical and quantitative skills, with strong attention to detail
Strong written and verbal communications skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks and thrive in a fast-paced team environment


GOOD TO HAVE 
Knowledge of the European and Global Cannabis Market ( Industrial and Medicinal)
Good understanding of commodities markets
Good understanding of financial markets


WHAT WE OFFER 
Opportunity to work for an innovative and fast-growing start-up within the canna-tech space

job_desc:
Full-time, permanent. Office-based with potential for hybrid working.
Salary £30,000 - £35,000 DOE.
 
Are you experienced in event management and have excellent organisational skills? We’re looking for a new Events Fundraising Manager who can multitask and manage a busy events portfolio.
 
Job details
 
At an exciting time to join The Grand Appeal, the post of Events Fundraising Manager is an exceptionally rewarding role for a motivated and passionate events fundraiser who has excellent organisational and project management skills.
 
 
You will be working collaboratively across the charity, ensuring the successful delivery of income generation, high-level stewardship and the cultivation of events. Working on both existing events and developing new initiatives, you will deliver a high degree of creativity and supporter insight, to secure committed long-term engagement and to maximise income.
 
 
You’ll be experienced in event management and have excellent organisational skills and the ability to multitask to manage a busy events portfolio, working across fundraising teams to engage our incredible community, corporate and major donor supporters. Our events include Wallace & Gromit’s Wrong Trousers Day, Wallace & Gromit’s BIG Bake, the Great Bristol Run, Bath Half Marathon, skydives and other stewardship and engagement events.
 
 
We have some exciting projects planned in the coming years and this role will be an integral part of the strategy to raise money to support Bristol Children’s Hospital and St Michael’s Neonatal Intensive Care Unit, and to deliver first class, engaging events both for our supporters and the city.
 
Key responsibilities include:
 
 
Strategic Planning
 
Work with the fundraising team to refine and develop the established fundraising strategy to maximise income and return on investment
Manage and develop our annual portfolio of events
Manage budgeting and forecasting for the portfolio of events
 


 
Events Management
 
Plan, develop and implement effective integrated event campaigns
Work with third-party stakeholders
Manage event logistics, attend on the day and ensure events run smoothly
Recruit and oversee volunteers to assist at events
Prepare and present evaluation reports, including reporting against financial and non-financial KPIs
 


 
Stewardship
 
Plan and deliver excellent supporter care for event participants, forging strong relationships
Increase support and encouraging long-term engagement
Represent the charity at events and converse with supporters at all levels
 


 
Line Management
 
Line manage, motivate and inspire the Events Fundraiser: set objectives, monitor delivery of objectives and support development needs
Oversee the administration of event fundraising activity
Develop stewardship programmes with the Event Fundraiser to increase average gift values and supporter conversion and retention rates
Work with the Event Fundraiser to ensure accurate and effective use of the database


 
Marketing & Communications
 
Work hand in hand with the Communications and Marketing team to ensure events are effectively promoted
Attend photo shoots and press opportunities to help maximise media exposure
Speak publicly at events and to the media
 


 
Wider responsibilities include
 
Team-working
 
Contributing to and collaborating with the wider Fundraising and Communications team activities, sharing new ideas and supporting income generation, and promoting positive team-working.
 


Statutory:
 
 
Compliance with all relevant data protection, gambling, and fundraising legislation, e.g., Fundraising Regulator, relevant codes of conduct
 


Support
 
Carry out other tasks/duties to support teams and colleagues across the organisation.


 
Please find the full job description and application form on our website.
 
How to apply
Please complete the application form on our website and return it with your CV to jobs@grandappeal.org.uk.
 
The closing date for applications is midnight Wednesday 8 March 2023.
For informal discussions, please contact Helen Haskell at hello@grandappeal.org.uk.
title: Events Fundraising Manager

title: Assistant Manager

job_desc:
Trust Payments have an exciting opportunity for a
 
Head of Operations Technology
 
to join their team.
 
Location: Bromley
Salary: Competitive + Benefits
 
 
About Us:
 
Trust Payments is a global unified payment technology group that was formed in 2019 bringing together technology and financial services into an omnichannel solution. The new business model has enabled Trust Payments to establish itself as a leading Fintech Payments group.
 
Head of Operations Technology
 
– The Role:
 
-
 
Lead Operations Technology department within Trust Payments Group – with teams across UK and US operations
- Own the technology, processes and data flows that underpin the business operations departments
- Drive continuous improvements in processes and data flows across business operations systems to maximise ease of use and operational scaling
 
- Lead key supplier engagements to ensure operational service performance is optimal, trackable and meets agreed SLAs
- Lead group wide 24/7 technical operations / support team and strategy across multiple sites. Partnering with Technology and Product teams to deliver next generation monitoring capability
- Lead group wide incident and problem management team and strategy – collaborating with multiple teams across the business
 
Head of Operations Technology
 
– Key Responsibilities:
 
- Provide operations technology leadership and direction to the business
 
- Ensure that all processes / systems are scalable to meet the company’s growth expectations while retaining data integrity and operational efficiency.
 
This includes:
 
- Onboarding: To create best in class onboarding and UW systems making use of the latest technology and products on the market
 
- Client Services & Support: Ensure the teams have omnichannel technology with the ability to offer instant messaging and self service
 
- Monitoring: Ensure that the organisation has efficient and accurate platform monitoring systems and processes that are scalable
 
- Compliance: To create a compliance solution that can be used across multiple regulatory jurisdictions
- Settlement: Review and improve all merchant settlement processes
 
- Ongoing management and development of the 24/7 technical operation / support team, including scope and strategy of the teams’ deliverables
 
- Partnering with IT and Product to deliver a centralised monitoring solution to cover all platforms (internal and external) and products
 
- Owning the group wide incident management and problem management strategy and deliverables – including relevant systems, processes and communication used internally and externally
- Manage a number of integrations between the various components of the company’s infrastructure
- Manage the relationship with external service providers that provide integrations into various components of our infrastructure
- Support the Group COO and the other operations leaders in optimising internal processes and systems across multiple business functions.
- Negotiate and manage internal yearly budgets related to your area
- Regularly report to EXCO on the internal IS landscape, project status and operational requirements
- Set, manage and report relevant KPI’s and metrics - including weekly reporting and monthly reporting to company EXCO
 
Head of Operations Technology
 
– You:
 
- Proven Operations Technology leader
 
- Strong technology background with understanding of systems, networks, security, database and cloud-based technology
- Previous merchant services / acquiring experience in leadership position
 
- Strong and effective leader, able to communicate effectively at board level
- A strong problem solver
- Manage high performance teams in an operations technology environment
- Organised and strong relationship builder
- Experience working in a matrix organisation
 
Head of Operations Technology
 
– Benefits:
 
- Opportunity to be part of a rapidly scaling and market-leading Fintech business
- Health and Wellbeing ethos including regular wellness sessions, fitness and nutrition and other events as well as supported by internally qualified mental health first aiders
- Family-friendly enhanced benefits/policies
- Pension, Healthcare, Life Assurance
- Social events and team building
- Celebrations
 
We understand the value that a diverse and inclusive working environment brings to Trust Payments. We celebrate the differences that people can bring through their cultures, backgrounds and perspectives. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other protected characteristic.
 
During the recruitment process we welcome you to inform us confidentially of any special adjustments required in order to participate fully in our recruitment experience.
 
To submit your CV for this exciting
 
Head of Operations Technology
 
opportunity, please click ‘Apply’ now!
title: Head of Operations Technology

job_desc:
Company Description
 
Forbes Advisor is a new initiative for consumers under the Forbes Marketplace umbrella that provides journalist- and expert-written insights, news and reviews on all things personal finance.

We’re dedicated to helping turn aspirations into reality. We do this by providing consumers with the knowledge and research they need to make informed financial decisions they can feel confident in, so they can get back to doing the things they care about most.
 
Job Description
 
Forbes Advisor is a new initiative under the Marketplace umbrella that provides consumers with journalist- and expert-written insights, news, and reviews on all things personal finance. Our goal is to help small and medium businesses (SMBs) make informed decisions by providing them with the knowledge and research they need.

We are seeking an SMB Data Analyst to join our team and assist our editorial team in creating top-quality content. In this role, you will provide competitive analysis on the market and ensure the quality and accuracy of data collection and analysis for products and services relevant to SMBs, with a focus on software. Your research and analysis will be a key component of making trustworthy, relevant assessments of products and services, and will help thousands of SMBs make informed decisions about the products and services they use.

If you are looking for a challenging and exciting opportunity similar to those found at a start-up, with the benefits of a seasoned and successful company, then this may be the role for you.
 
 
Review editorial data requests for feasibility, usability, and scalability
Leverage a team of freelancers to collect product and service data, with a focus on products for SMBs
Perform analysis on collected data to identify top-quality products and services for SMBs
Develop and implement processes for quality control
Collaborate with peers to introduce and develop new techniques and processes for efficient data collection
Collaborate with the editorial team to ensure deadlines and goals are met
Review editorial content resulting from work product for accuracy and completeness
 


 
Highly organized, with strong attention to detail and critical thinking abilities
Comfortable working in G-Suite, with an emphasis on Google Sheets
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to adapt to a changing environment and prioritize projects accordingly
Previous experience in a quality role is preferred
Comfortable managing your own projects and deliverables
 


 
Associates Degree or Certificate in a relevant field, such as business or computer science, or equivalent training and experience
Proficiency in using Google Sheets for data analysis and manipulation
Proven experience in software testing, as well as proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation are desirable
 


 
We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits program for full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, unlimited PTO, disability coverage, employee assistance program, and a paid parental leave program.
 


Additional Information
 
Forbes Marketplace provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

job_desc:
Job Reference #
 
269828BR
 
Job Type
 
Full Time
 
Your role
 
Are you interested in using data and the latest technologies to solve real world business problems? Does the prospect of collaborating with different areas to deliver business value excite you?
 
We’re looking for an innovative, and detail oriented collaborator to help the surface opportunities to improve data as a result of a new platform, Cumulus. Cumulus will transform how we acquire and manage data that is mission critical for our business.
 
In this role you will partner with UBS business divisions and group functions, the Cumulus platform team and product owners to identify opportunities to improve data.
 
We are looking for a data analyst to:
 
 
 
identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using structured analysis techniques and tools
 
use data analytics to surface opportunities to improve the quality of reference data
 
use data visualization to educate stakeholders on the scale and impact of data issues to gain buy in for investment and improvement
 
use data analytics to evidence when benefits are realized as a result of change
 


 
Your team
 
You’ll be working in the Reference Data Services team in UK, reporting to the Reference Data Advisory Lead. This global team continually challenges and enhances the way reference data is managed at UBS. We do this is by engaging closely with our clients, developing our people and harnessing new technology.
 
Our currently technology stack is highly fragmented with many systems that manage data. This leads to inconsistent data quality, duplication of efforts across teams, high costs, and impacts our ability to adapt to new data requirements.
 
We aspire to solve these problems with Cumulus – a cloud native platform that will become the single place where we acquire and manage reference data, built using microservices that give flexibility to our clients.
 
Having all of the reference data in one place for the first time presents an exciting opportunity in surfacing and quantifying the impact of data challenges in a way that we have never been able to before.
 
Your expertise
 
 
 
data analytics experience in global programs cutting across business divisions, functions and locations, preferably in the Financial Services sector across multiple relevant reference data domains (e.g. External Legal Entity, Client, Counterparty, Instrument, Product, Static)
 
experience in using data in order to identify issues, trends or exceptions to drive improvement and find solutions
 
experience using common reporting and analytics solutions e.g. PowerBI, Alteryx, Databricks, Qlik, Tableau
 
proficient in one or more scripting languages e.g. SQL, Python, R, Scala
 


 
You are:
 
 
 
an effective self starter who excels in a lean and fast paced organization with a diligent and detail oriented work style
 
highly driven and motivated with a can do attitude
 
a strong written and verbal communicator, able to simplify and explain complex problems for various levels of stakeholders, interested in building a network across a global organization
 
eager to continuously learn and solve complex problems, focusing on practical and implementable solutions
 


 
About Us
 
UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.
 
With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?
 
How We Hire
 
This role requires an assessment on application. Learn more about how we hire: www.ubs.com/global/en/careers/experienced-professionals.html
 
Join us
 
At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.
 
From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?
 
Disclaimer / Policy Statements
 
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Data Analyst
– Permanent
Location:
 
Central London
 
The client
A think-tank who are committed to creating poverty indexes to help governments create policies.
 
Your responsibilities
 
Quality assurance of the raw data underpinning them, and how they contribute to the growth of Prosperity.
Improving data sources and methodology to ensure the U.S. Index is World class.

In light of findings, assemble conclusions, including via oral presentations and in written format, ensuring that the outputs are effectively communicated to non-technical audiences, to drive maximum value from our data assets


 
Your experience

Confident in manipulating data within Excel
A demonstrable interest in data analysis and public policy, and/or social and economic affairs
A strong attention to detail: Ensures accuracy, quality and process control
Communication: An ability to present problem statements, concepts and conclusions to a variety of internal and external stakeholders through reports, presentations and other written output

What’s next?

title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
We are looking for Data Analysts to join us in London!
 
You'll create data visualisations in the most appropriate way to deliver insightful analysis to support informed business decision making and assess commercial performance. Acting as an SME in the field of data visualisation, you'll also help the business to make data more accessible and interpretable, and will strive for automation where possible to reduce inefficiencies and cost within the business. You’ll also collaborate closely with a wide variety of colleagues across different business units, working across an array of exciting projects.
 
This is a unique opportunity to join a rapidly growing team, as we become more mature in the data space to meet the increased demand for reporting and data analytics across the business, in addition to visualising that data in an impactful way.
 
 
Understanding the data systems and structures within the business. Contributing towards improvements to these systems where possible and linking understanding of source data to value-adding analytics and reporting
Ensuring all outputs are visualised to a high standard through use of best practice. Being an advocate for data visualisation best practice, sharing knowledge and guidance with others
Continuously developing processes so that deliverables are created in the most efficient way to improve performance
Being accountable for the delivery of ad hoc analytics and visualisations for internal colleagues; understanding the business need and delivering the outcome in a flexible and insightful manner through the use of code to manipulate data (e.g. SQL) and visualisation tools to display outputs clearly (e.g. Tableau/PowerBI)
Developing and maintaining productive relationships with all colleagues; providing advice and guidance on data, analytics and visualisation to improve their knowledge and understanding
Delivering regular reports to the business; always aiming for automation and standardisation
 
Experience in dealing with high volumes of data with excellent attention to detail and reconciliation
Experience of creating dashboards/data visualisations with dashboarding software such as Tableau or PowerBI
Performing data manipulation and transformation to create and maintain datasets. Creation of structured datasets that facilitate efficient dashboard creation
Producing and automating regular reporting to a wide range of stakeholders through the use of analytical tools
Experience with coding languages for data manipulation, such as SQL
Any knowledge of Alteryx, Python or R would be a huge plus!
 


 
When you commit to Legal & General, we’ll commit to you too. That means we’ll recognise and reward your hard work, your performance and your contribution.
 
If you join us, you’ll get access to some great benefits, including private medical insurance, at least 25 days holiday (excluding bank holidays), a generous pension scheme, life assurance, and Income Protection. You can participate in our electric car scheme, which offers employees the option to hire a brand new electric car through tax efficient salary sacrifice. We’re also proud to offer competitive family leave.
 
You’ll have the opportunity to participate in our annual, performance-related bonus plan and valuable share schemes. And then there are the many discounts we offer that you can take advantage of - both for our own products and at a range of high street stores and online offerings.
 
The brand with the brolly is choosing today to change tomorrow.
 
Since 1836, we’ve grown to become one of the world's largest asset managers, homebuilders, pension providers and insurance brands.
 
We’re all here to improve the lives of our customers, build a better society for the long term, and create value for our shareholders - helping to shape a better future for society and the planet.
 
We need people who share our ambitions, agility and entrepreneurial spirit to help us do it.
 
At L&G, you’ll find a balance that helps you be your best. Empowered by hybrid working, we’re supported by technology and workplaces that enable us to work effectively wherever we are. We come together in offices to collaborate and connect, and use time at home for individual, focused activities. And, when we achieve great things, we celebrate our success and reward strong performance.
 
Today, there’s over 10,000 of us, working towards our mission, with plenty of opportunities to grow your career as we grow L&G. Will you join us?
 
Helping over ten million people around the world manage their savings, retirement plans and life insurance requires a lot of people behind-the-scenes. It’s up to us in
 
L&G Group functions
 
- which includes our tech and digital teams, Group Finance, HR, Risk and Corporate Comms to provide the essential support services that all areas of the business need, here in the UK and overseas. Simply put, we enable everyone at Legal & General to do what they do best. That means we’re helping to improve our customers’ lives, and contributing to the success of the business every day.
 
Great minds don’t have to think alike, so we welcome voices from all backgrounds. Bringing together people with different life experiences helps us build empathy with our customers and drive innovation.
 
We don’t just talk about it, we actively promote diversity and equitable opportunities for all. That means our employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or protected veteran status. In fact, we embrace every dimension of diversity to reflect the customers and communities we serve.
 
We think it’s important to create an inclusive environment where we can all belong, contribute and drive progress, where you can develop and grow, and be empowered. We want you to use your voice to help us build a better tomorrow.
 
We all work differently, and have different needs, which is why. we’re always open to discussing flexible working arrangements. Likewise, we’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs during our recruiting process.
 
So whoever you are, wherever you are, whatever your story, we'd love to hear from you.
 
If this opportunity excites you but you’re not sure you meet all the requirements, or you’d like to know a bit more, please contact James Shields at james.shields@landg.com (LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/jamesshields1//).
 
If you’d like to be considered for this role, please submit your application through our careers website as we’re not accepting email applications.

job_desc:
MODARI Data Analyst (UKRI Grade D)
 
Salary:
 
£31,931
 
Contract Type:
 
Fixed Term, 12 months
 
Hours:
 
Full Time/Part Time – Job Share
 
Based at:
 
London
 
Overall Purpose
 
The UK Collaborative on Development Research (UKCDR) Secretariat works with funders of research relevant to international development to bring people together, share information and promote opportunities. We exist to amplify the value and impact of research for global development by promoting coherence, collaboration, and joint action among UK research funders. This role will contribute to delivering UKCDR’s overall mandate, leading and supporting a number of areas of work.

The MODARI (Mapping ODA Research and Innovation) project aims to map the ODA Research and Innovation investment across His Majesty’s Government (HMG) to deliver timely, tailored outputs to HMG funders in support of, mainly, portfolio prioritisation and engagement with in-country partners. The project launched in March 2020 and initially ran for two years, UKCDR aims to restart the project in early 2023 following a pause in activity.

More information about the project can be found on the project website: https://www.ukcdr.org.uk/what-we-do/our-work/data-on-uk-funded-research-and-innovation/

The jobholder will implement and enhance the Mapping ODA Research and Innovation (MODARI) project, under the leadership of the UKCDR Head of Operations and Strategic Projects, and the MODARI Senior Data Analyst (an FCDO secondee). Working on large data sets, cleaning, coding, validation, as well as mapping and analysis work.

The jobholder will also work on other UKCDR priority work strands, including providing research and policy advice, convening stakeholders, and supporting outreach activities. In the UKCDR Strategy Period 2022-2025, UKCDR project work focuses on impact (e.g. analysing REF2021 impact case studies), equitable partnerships, effective funding mechanisms and a shift towards climate focussed activity. There will be significant opportunities for the jobholder to work on other project activity.
 
Main Duties / Key Responsibilities
 
Data management
 
 
Working with the Senior Data Analyst to access data and government systems, the postholder will be responsible for routine MODARI data management and will review operation of tools, design and implement enhancements to MODARI.
 
Adding data to database and excel spreadsheets (e.g. ODA Research and Innovation funding).
Verifying existing data on the database/spreadsheet.
 
Working with technical staff in government departments with ODA R&D allocations (BEIS, DHSC, FCDO, DEFRA), as well as with UKRI.
 
With colleagues, liaison with UKCDR Officials Group and others on the potential uses of the data for planning and communicating UK ODA R&D.
 


Data Analysis
 
 
Analysis and coding of data to various established categorisation systems.
Undertake specific repeat analyses (using established methodology) to contribute to the updates of MODARI data and publications.
 
Under the guidance of experienced staff, develop new analyses and insights for regular mapping updates or for further stakeholder needs.
 
Support the development of a system for the efficient generation of country level reports of current UK funded R&D activity, to enable timely updates to be provided to end users and key stakeholders.
 
Draw on data analysis to identify areas for improvement and further development of the project.
 


Working Relationships
 
 
Proactive member of a team working under supervision of senior personnel. Able to identify key stakeholders, and develop & maintain relationships with current partners, funders, collaborators, governance groups and other relevant external bodies.
 
Though mainly focused on ODA R&D, the postholder will be expected to understand opportunities for the UK’s wider international science investments and engagement.
 
Lead or assist with the co-ordination of relations and the communication of information with bodies such as Government Departments and agencies, higher education organisations, relevant private sector organisations and other charities, including representing UKCDR at meetings and conferences as and when relevant
 


Research and Policy Advice
 
 
Support the UKCDR Executive Director and other Secretariat staff to provide research and policy advice to UKCDR member organisations and key stakeholders.
 
Provide verbal/written briefing on policy, research, funding and delivery issues concerning research which may impact on international development outcomes.
The jobholder will work on a range of different project activities, subject to the priorities of the secretariat and where possible in-line with the interests of the person appointed. The current areas of work include funding impact equitable partnerships, effective funding mechanisms. In the year to come there will also be significant activity on climate change. The jobholder will take the lead on discrete pieces of work alongside the key areas listed above.
 


Profile
 
Essential
 
Education / Qualifications / Training:
 
 
A first or upper second-class Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in a subject relevant to the work of UKCDR.
 


Desirable
 
 
Qualifications relating to coding, data analysis and/or project management.
Post-graduate qualification relevant to international development, or PhD.
 


Essential
 
Previous work experience required:
 
 
Quantitative analytical expertise, including experience working with statistical and visualisation software.
Experience working on large data sets and mapping activities, including: collating, cleaning and validating data, as well as record keeping/ data analysis.
 


Desirable
 
 
At least 1 to 3 years’ experience in a research, funding or policy role relevant to science and/or international development, e.g. government, Research Council, NGOs (Non-Government Organisations), higher education, or consultancy.
Experience of working in public sector partnerships, for example linking government departments, research councils, or research teams, or in partnerships between the public sector and stakeholders.
 


Essential
 
Knowledge and experience:
 
 
Competency in MS Excel, familiarity with manipulating spreadsheets and quantitative analysis techniques.
 
Strong qualitative and quantitative skills including experience of coding, management information and systems.
 
Working knowledge of MS Office programmes (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Teams).
 


Desirable
 
 
Experience of working to SOPs/standardised processes and computerised record keeping
 


Skills/behaviours/qualities
 
Essential:
 
 
Strong analytical skills and the ability to analyse complex information and summarise key conclusions or recommendations
Strong attention to detail
Able to work as part of a team, under the supervision of senior personnel but also to take the initiative in organising and prioritising work efficiently and independently.
 
Ability to deliver results to a high standard and an agreed schedule.
Good communication and prioritisation skills.
 


About UKRI International
 
UKRI International enables and delivers cross-cutting international activity on behalf of all of UKRI, working in partnership with all 9 councils and corporate areas of UKRI, UK Government, and partners in the UK and across the world.

We lead UKRI’s long-standing relationships with North America, India, China, and the European Commission through our offices in Washington DC, Ottawa, New Delhi, Beijing, Brussels. We design & deliver centrally managed international funds, develop strong international partnerships where we do not have offices, provide a robust evidence base for UKRI’s international work through analysis and evaluation, create and implement a strategic approach to UKRI’s international policy and stakeholders, and ensure our international operations are carried out to high standards of governance and effectiveness.

UKRI’s approach to internal collaboration is set out in the UKRI International Strategic Framework (UKRI international strategic framework – UKRI) which describes how our international work directly contributes to each of UKRI’s 6 strategic objectives.
 
UKRI International Is Comprised Of 9 Teams
 
Analysis, Evaluation & Implementation

International Funds

International Governance & Operations

International Partnerships

International Policy & Stakeholder Engagement

UKRI China – Beijing

UKRI India – New Delhi

UKRI North America – Washington & Ottawa

UKRO – Brussels
 
How We Support EDI In The Workforce
 
At UKRI, we believe that everyone has a right to be treated with dignity and respect, and to be provided with equal opportunities to thrive and succeed in an environment that enables them to do so. We also value diversity of thought and experience within inclusive groups, organisations and the wider community. For further information, please visit 'How we support EDI in the workforce'.
 
Disability Confident Employer
 
As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy/ies. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
 
How To Apply
 
Online applications only preferred for this role. Please submit a CV and covering letter which clearly outlines how you fulfil the criteria specified along with your motivation for UKRI and the role. Ensure that the job reference number is included in the filename description of each document uploaded. Note that failure to address the above criteria or submit an application without a covering letter may result in the application not being considered. Assessment will only be based upon the content of your submitted covering letter and CV and not the experience section of the application.

UKRI seeks to ensure it creates and maintains a system of openness, fairness and inclusion - a collaborative, trusted environment, which is attractive to and accessible to everyone who is interested in developing their career with us.

job_desc:
AAT is the UK’s leading qualification and professional membership body for vocational accountants. We pride ourselves on providing practical qualifications that meet the needs of both employers and employees.
 
Term:
 
Fixed Term Contract till 30/09/2024
Hours:
 
Full time (35 hours per week)
Salary
: £33,965 - £41,000 per annum
Location:
 
We have hybrid working in place, with 1-2 days per week, in our office in Canary Wharf.
 
What exactly will you be doing?
As the Data Reporting Developer, you will support the data and information needs of AAT through the continued development and delivery of SSRS and Power BI paginated reports.
 
Major objectives
The key objectives for the role are:
 
Lead reporting for specific projects
Review and modernise the existing library of reports, reducing the number of reports in the process
Provide support to the Data Development Manager as required


 
What are we looking for?
 
Knowledge and application of SSRS and SQL
Prior experience in creating a variety of complex SSRS and/or Paginated reports
Prior knowledge and experience using Azure Synapse and Azure Data Factory.
Experience working with complex data sets
Prior experience in creating and maintaining complex SQL objects such as views, stored procedures, functions, common table expressions and SQL Agent jobs, relating to automated processes
Ability to deal with complex environments and being able to translate requirements into action


 
What are the benefits?
At AAT we believe in treating our staff well and this is reflected in our wide-ranging benefits, which include:
 
Hybrid working (1-2 days per week in our London office) and opportunities for further flexible working
25 days’ annual leave, increasing one day per year up to a maximum of 30 days plus bank holidays
Great pension scheme, life assurance, and critical illness cover
Health cash plan
Regular wellbeing initiatives and fresh fruit in the office
Enhanced maternity and shared parental leave contributions of up to 6 months’ full pay depending on the length of service
Cycle2Work scheme and much more


 
Closing Date:
 
The planned closing date for this role is
 
24 February 2023 at 17.00,
 
however, we reserve the right to close the role earlier than planned.
 
It’s an exciting time to join AAT and we would love you to join us on our journey. In 2022 we achieved one-star company status in the
 
Best Companies
 
survey, and we are currently developing our strategy to 2030.
We are committed to being an inclusive and welcoming place to work. We encourage applications from diverse candidates and make recruitment decisions based on skill and experience. We have a Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) Champions group, which leads on our D&I strategy and organise events to celebrate and raise awareness. We are a disability-confident committed employer and have signed up to the Race at Work Charter. We have also signed up for the Women in Finance Charter, and in 2022 we exceeded our target for appointing females into senior positions.
Come and help us to make AAT an even better place to work!
 
Interested?
To apply please submit a copy of your CV and covering letter. Please note, that applications without a covering letter will not be considered.
If you have a disability, need further support, or reasonable adjustments to assist you in our process, please contact us at hr.enquiries@aat.org.uk or by calling 0207 735 2468 and asking for a member of the HR team.
