job_desc:
Cell Capital Overview
Cell is breaking down the traditional venture capital model and taking it to the next level. We work with corporate investors to design and build bespoke portfolios of direct start-up investments based on a jointly crafted strategy. Our team of seasoned venture investors with both operational and financial experience empower smart capital to access the latest technology innovation and talent.
 
We invest thematically across a number of sectors and proactively support our entrepreneurs on their journey. We began investing in 2020 and have built a portfolio of 20 investments across Agrifood, Sustainability & Impact, and Deep Tech, investing alongside the likes of 7percent, Animoca Brands, Episode1, Forward Partners, IQ Capital, LocalGlobe, Molten Ventures, Playfair Capital, Seedcamp, Speedinvest, Union Square Ventures and Y Combinator.
 
The Role
We are expanding the team with a newly created position offering exposure across both business development and investments. We are looking for an individual who has a deep passion for early stage VC and corporate innovation. You will have an entrepreneurial mindset and ambition to grow with the firm.
 
You will play a crucial role in a dynamic team, be working closely alongside the Partners, supporting them in their efforts with both clients and investments.
 
Main Duties and Responsibilities
 
Market mapping and thematic analysis of new and emerging technology trends
Prepare marketing materials for existing and potential investors
Ability to generate new business within a corporate environment and proactively identify new opportunities and stakeholders
Prepare, conduct and follow up on client/investor opportunities as a means of achieving sales targets
Support the investment team on due diligence of investment opportunities, management of deal pipeline and portfolio reporting
Actively maintain the CRM system with updates on all current and prospective investors


 
About You
 
2yrs+ experience in a fast-paced environment (VC/PE, investment banking, consulting or similar) in either an investment or sales/fundraising role
Strong network of investors across Europe including corporates and family offices
Confidence in dealing with clients both face-to-face and virtually
Client-driven; high levels of client service, long-term view to relationship building
Demonstrable ability to understand, analyse and articulate financial data and statistics
Experience preparing marketing material, including factsheets and presentations
Ability to combine niche local market knowledge with an understanding of wider business impact
Highly entrepreneurial, driven and self-motivated
Highly organised and experienced in managing relationships at all levels including senior management
An intellectually curious, open, humble and pragmatic team player with a solutions-first attitude
Strong MS Office skills, including Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with a high level of attention to detail
Fluency in written and spoken English; additional European language proficiency is a bonus
A valid UK/EU working permit


 
Compensation
 
– Competitive base + benefits + carried interest
 
Location
 
– London, UK
 
As a young firm, we actively look to embed diversity and inclusion at our core. We take this seriously, and genuinely believe that building a diverse and inclusive culture would deliver significant outperformance and simply create a better place for us to work. We fully encourage applicants from all backgrounds and traditions regardless of gender, race, disability, belief, sexual orientation or age.
title: Analyst/Associate

job_desc:
At Samsung Research UK, the Emerging Solutions team’s role is to develop new technologies and services in new business areas for Samsung. The team currently has a focus on Health and Energy. We are now looking for a Data Scientist Intern to work in our highly experienced data science team. It is a great opportunity to use data science to solve real world problems and help develop new technology and services which could be commercialised globally.
 
Through this position the candidate will have an opportunity to contribute to the development of future Samsung products and build a strong network within Samsung, while continuing to enhance their network within other communities (e.g. startup and academia).
 
We are ideally looking for someone who is available to start in spring 2023 for a 9-12 month placement, however if you are available for a minimum of 6 months we still encourage you to apply.
 
 
The role is based at our Research & Development Institute in Staines-upon-Thames, Surrey, UK. We operate a Hybrid Working Policy of 3 days working from the office weekly and 2 days working from home if required.
 
Role and Responsibilities
 
 
The role involves, but is not limited to, the following:
 
Designing, implementing and evaluating efficient algorithms for meeting the objectives of the project.
Leveraging his / her knowledge Data Analytic, AI, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Time-Frequency Analysis.
 
Providing basic technical support to schools to help them set up equipment for Samsung’s Energy in Schools project.
Strong team spirit and willingness of extending and adapting technical knowledge.
To collaborate with Schools on Samsung’s Energy project.


 
Skills and Qualifications
 
 
 
MS in Engineering fields and / or Computer Science, PhD (Biomedical Engineering preferred) / Under PhD.
Programming skills in Python or other modern programming languages including Java
Understanding of Deep Learning & Medical Statistics & Time-Frequency Analysis algorithms.
Strong python skills for data analytics, familiar with common python packages including numpy, pandas, sk-learn and Keras and/or TensorFlow frameworks.
Ability to read research papers, and quickly turn the ideas from paper to prototype solutions.
Good communication skills, ability to learn quickly on-the-job.
Fluent English speaker


 
Contract Type:
 
9 Month Internship starting in spring 2023
Job Location
: Staines-upon-Thames, Surrey, UK
Hybrid Working
: Typical working week will be 3 days working from the office and 2 days working from home.
title: Data Scientist Intern

job_desc:
Our Data Analysts help improve the data analytics which help our Mercer Marsh Benefits (MMB) consultants, build market-leading, more tailored products, helping our Global & local clients make better, data driven decisions.
 
Together, we are focussed on driving our competitive advantage through analytics, owning the strategy, definition and building of our analytics proposition including product/dashboard, to our clients, creating better data driven decision making.
 
We work more as a consultancy and a business within a business, than a traditional technical development team. Adopting a product approach rather than working on one off projects.
 
You will understand the value of data, working consultatively & collaboratively as product teams, delivering projects end-to-end, from briefing and setting client expectations to presenting to internal and external business stakeholders (including senior leaders).
 
We want to better deliver our client requirements and create operationalised analytics, so as well as your data visualisation experience, will also look for your ideas and input, to help design and build products at a large scale.
 
Our roles are based in London with the expectation that you will be in the London Tower Place office one day a week.
 
What can you expect?
 
 
To join a fast-growing team & the chance to learn and implement Front End design best practices and technology
Joining a new, fast-growing, innovative team, encouraging & welcoming your ideas
 


 
What you need to have:
 
 
 
Proven ability to define and deliver analytics at scale, resulting in business outcomes or change
An understanding and experience of how to structure data, allowing business users to draw out better insights
Hands-on experience using standard analytics methods, practices and logic (e.g. lookups and pivot tables) Using tools to present data, build data visualisations and analytics stories
Ability to work with data engineering teams to define data structuring needs
Experience and use of Qlik and/or other data visualisation and product dashboarding tools
Working on developing larger products
 


 
What makes you stand out:
 
 
Ability to turn requirements into valuable and usable deliverables
Any experience owning or leading the development process for a product
Knowledge or experience of UI and UX best practices in a dashboarding or analytics sense
 


 
At Marsh McLennan, we understand the complexity, and the reality, of the modern career path. If your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified and you think you would be a great fit for the role, we would love to hear from you.
 
What is in it for you?
 
 
The opportunity to build market leading analytics solutions on a Global and local scale
The ability to design, innovate & improve large scale products
The opportunity to input into defining solutions
 


 
Mercer believes in building brighter futures by redefining the world of work, reshaping retirement and investment outcomes, and unlocking real health and well-being. Mercer’s approximately 25,000 employees are based in 43 countries and the firm operates in over 130 countries. Mercer is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people, with 85,000 colleagues and annual revenue of over $20 billion. Through its market-leading businesses including Marsh, Guy Carpenter and Oliver Wyman, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment. For more information, visit mercer.com. Follow Mercer on LinkedIn and Twitter.

LOCATION:
 
Hounslow, with free onsite parking
 
HOURLY RATE:
 
up to £16.80ph + holiday accrual + Office Angels benefits
 
HOURS:

We are currently working with a maintenance business in Hounslow, which is looking for a Data Analyst to join their team. This is a brand new role to the business, which is a temp to perm position. They are looking for someone who has experience analysing data and using Power BI to create dashboards. You will work with a friendly team and a business that has great culture and opportunities for progression.

title: Data Analyst - Temp to Perm

job_desc:
Department:
 
Product
 
Employment Type:
 
Permanent - Full Time
 
Location:
 
Wallingford, UK - Hybrid
 
Description
 
Working within the growing GTI Data Team, you'll collaborate with stakeholders across the business to build data requirements, develop and execute solutions. A focus will be working with our Universities team, enhancing our existing suite of data services, moving our offering from reactive to proactive and predictive.
 
Outcomes
 
Teams across the business have the data they need to make decisions, monitor performance and make pre-emptive interventions:
 
 
 
Use our internal tools to ensure teams have visibility of relevant data
 
Build performance models, enabling teams to easily spot customers with unexpected performance, allowing us to celebrate strong performance and intervene pre-emptively
 
Manage and own cross-platform tracking of our productsThe needs of our customers and teams are well understood:
 
Solidify the strong relationship between the Data Team, client facing teams and their customers
 
Build rapport with a range of stakeholders through regular communication and support
 
Develop a thorough understanding of the data requirements, challenges and opportunities within our platform offeringClients receive accurate and timely data, insight and best practice guidance:
 
Support the client-facing teams by owning the creation of regular campaign performance reports
 
Analyse aggregated product data to provide insight on best practice both internally and to clients
 
Provide ad-hoc and bespoke analyses and reports for select clients


 
Person Specification
 
 
This role is ideal for someone who has a passion for data and enjoys cultivating business relationships and working closely with customers. We foster an action-oriented culture of making pragmatic, data-driven decisions and enabling each other to deliver excellence.
 
 
 
Inquisitive and enthusiastic about data analysis, technology and business systems, keeping up to date with the latest developments in these areas
 
Effective stakeholder management, an excellent communicator, and able to mediate between business, Tech and Product stakeholders
 
Friendly and confident. You'll be working closely with people across the business, in different teams and with varying levels of data literacyAbility to work independently but also as part of a larger team


 
Work Experience, Knowledge & Skills
This is a role that sits equidistant between analytics and business intelligence. Support is available as needed; the most important prerequisites for this role are communication and adaptability, not intricate technical knowledge.
 
 
 
Excellent analytical and strong reporting skills with previous experience planning, managing & providing analyses to stakeholders
 
Understanding of BI/MI reporting tools (for example Power BI, Tableau, Looker or Google Data Studio)
 
Some understanding of relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL or other DBMS)
 
Familiarity with web analytics and behavioural tracking (for example Google Analytics, Matomo, Hotjar)
 
Ideally some experience of coding (preferably Python or Java) and knowledge of programming best practiceExperience using version control (via Git & Mercurial for example) is beneficial but not required


 
Other Information
 
 
Permanent role – 37.5 hours per week between Monday to Friday 9.00 – 5.30pm
3-month probationary period
title: Junior Data Analyst

job_desc:
THE ROLE
 
Bud is looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our Product team. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for leveraging, analysing, and driving actionable insights to the business and our customers. This role will report to the Lead Product Owner and will work within a well-established, talented Business Intelligence team on a day-to-day basis. The business intelligence team consists of 2 SQL/BI developers and testers. The role will include product owner responsibilities for the Business Intelligence team such as managing the product backlog and generating work for the team.
 
MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES
 
 
 
Interpret data and analyse results using statistical techniques
Present data in various forms for technical and non-technical stakeholders
Manage, cleanse and aggregate data from various sources
Develop data models and architecture that meet ongoing requirements for data collection whilst optimising statistical efficiency and quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Work with management and scrum teams to prioritise business and information needs
Manage the backlog of work for the Business Intelligence team


 
SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
 
 
Essential
 
Proven working experience as a Data Analyst
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Excellent Excel, SQL and data visualisation skills
Proven working experience with Microsoft PowerBI
Ability to design and communicate effective briefs to stakeholders


 
Desirable
 
Experience of owning a BI product
Previous experience as a Product Owner
Knowledge of other programming languages such as DAX, Python or R.
Machine learning experience
An understanding of BI testing
Experience of working within a Training Provider or funded learning environment
Understanding of training providers’ reporting needs and challenges
Scrum or Kanban experience e.g. Azure DevOps


 
KEY ATTRIBUTES
 
 
High levels of drive and determination, that strive to exceed expectations
Works with a sense of urgency and enjoys being in a fast-paced environment
Logical and analytical approach
Ability to work independently and collaboratively
Ability to identify issues quickly, investigate and solve complex problems and apply appropriate solutions
Resilient in the face of challenges
Adaptable to changing contexts
 


 
THE TEAM
 
You will be a key member of Bud, and work within the Product team. Our Product team works together with our Development, Test and Infrastructure teams to form our wider Delivery team. We collaborate together, following agile development practices to continuously ship incremental value to our customers and end users.
 
THE PERKS
 
Benefits
 
25 days holiday (plus bank holidays), rising to 29 days (fte) with service
Additional day leave for birthday
Hybrid working
Life Assurance
Private healthcare
Company Contributory pension scheme
Free on-site gym
Ongoing personal development opportunities


 
Bud Systems are not a sponsoring organisation. You must have the right to live and work in the UK without restriction or limitation.
 
 
A BPSS clearance is required for all Bud employees and the scope of this role may require an additional Security Clearance (SC).
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
The Position
 
About Roche:
 
We believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives. We are courageous in both decision and action. We believe that good business means a better world. That is why we come to work each day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigour, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow.
 
We are proud of who we are, what we do, and how we do it. We are many, working as one across functions, across companies, and across the world.
 
We are Roche.
 
About the Apprenticeship:
 
Our
 
Product Development Informatics (PDIX)
 
organization is co-creating a better future for patients through technology and information. We are an agile organization that brings together great people who are passionate about technology innovation, and who thrive in dynamic, cross-functional, and mission-driven teams.
 
Our agile organization is made up of structures called Networks and Chapters. “Networks” comprise business domain and technical experts aligned closely with our Product Development business partners to develop and deliver technology-enabled business strategy. Our “Chapters” are centers of expertise of deeply skilled people deployed for maximum impact. These teams work together to deliver outstanding value to our business, patients, and customers.
 
As a Data Science apprentice within the PDIX Data and Analytics Chapter, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to solve complex data problems enabling PD to transform data into actionable insights. You will collaborate with IT and business stakeholders to co-create data and analytics enabled solutions that help our teams fulfill our mission: to do now what patients need next.
 
The
 
Product Development Data Sciences
 
team in Welwyn Garden City is also seeking high calibre apprentices to join our teams to contribute to the development of our medicines, specifically the analysis, reporting and submission of clinical trial patient data.
 
In the biopharmaceutical industry, each data point is part of a patient's story and their contribution to developing better medicines and understanding disease. It is our responsibility to maximize the use of this data for answering new questions and enabling larger-scale analyses for generating new insights.
 
Successful candidates will use their data science and technical skills to contribute to the success of data science and insights generation at Roche working across diverse areas from the management and governance of data, to acquiring data and engineering solutions for visualising, integrating and analysing data, as well as ensuring data privacy,and also in areas such as learning and process management and healthcare compliance.
 
Apprentices joining Roche will work as part of a team in the Product Development Data Sciences department to deliver data and insights about our medicines and to provide solutions that aid the collection, databasing and analysis of clinical data for medicines in Roche’s diverse pipeline, contributing to the delivery of these to patients.
 
What you could be working on:
 
 
Leverage business acumen and technical expertise to support the quick creation of high-impact Prototypes/PoCs
Advanced data projects including predictive learning, neural networks, machine learning, anomaly detection, predictive analysis, exploratory data analysis and other data science practices
Generating insights from data, enabling us to optimise business performance. Solve complex data problems and deliver the insight that helps to define our strategy and enable our organisation to reach our patients faster
Collaborate in multidisciplinary agile teams to collect requirements, user specifications, approvals, and verify functionality and usefulness prior to full development of solutions
Collaborate with Data Engineers, Architects and Data and Analytics specialists to build lasting solutions to our data modelling


 
Essential Qualifications:
 
 
First or second class honors in computer science, Maths or related numerical discipline
At least A level Maths or Statistics (or equivalent)
Experience with Python programming
 
Level 2 Maths and English


 
Application Process:
 
 
Stage 1: CV & Cover Letter
 
Please ensure you include a CV and a cover letter with your application.
 
As part of your cover letter, Roche is keen to understand your motivation in applying for this position. You should, therefore, provide responses to the following questions:
 
 
Why have you applied for this Apprenticeship program?
 
If you had to choose a single example or achievement in your life, that you feel would make you suitable for this role, what would it be and why?


 
Your cover letter should not exceed one page.
 
Please not that all applications without a cover letter will be rejected automatically.
 
Video Interview
 
Once the HR review is complete, you may be invited to complete a video Interview to support your application.
 
 
Stage 2: Assessment Centre
 
If you are successful at the Video, CV and Cover Letter screening, you will be invited to the final stage of the application process. This will include a face-to-face interview, and relevant activities critical for the role, giving you a taste of Roche and the opportunity.
 
Application Deadline: 20th February 2023
 
Start Date: September 2023
 
Who we are
 
At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.
 
Our UK Pharmaceutical head office is situated in Welwyn Garden City, Hertfordshire, with beautiful countryside surrounding the area. Supported by major motorways & airports as well as being a 30 minute train ride to London, access is easy. Our award-winning office, known as Hexagon Place, was opened in 2005 and provides a modern, flexible working environment with facilities that are second-to-none. Around 2,000 people work at our Welwyn office in Global Early Development (pRED), Global Product Development (PD), Commercial (Rx) and our Corporate functions.
 
Roche offer a competitive salary plus the excellent benefits you would expect from a blue-chip organisation. There is a fully equipped gym on-site, a library and information centre, and an active sports and social club. We also have a subsidised staff restaurant providing foods to cater for every taste throughout the day. At the heart of the building is an informal meeting area known as The Street which features a coffee shop, snack machine and cashpoint. A second building on-site, called The Hub, contains modern meeting room and conference facilities. Roche promotes personal well-being and work-life balance. Therefore, flexible working options will be considered for all roles at Roche UK. Roche is committed to creating a diverse & inclusive environment. The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees, and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of Roche.
 
The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees, and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of Roche Products Ltd. title: Data & Analytics - Data Science Apprenticeship

job_desc:
MORE ABOUT THIS SKILLSET
 
Building, controlling, maintaining and delivering large data sets in the most effective and efficient way.

Data teams across the firm embody a keen attention to detail and quantitative discipline, focusing on data analytics and business intelligence to ensure our firm effectively and efficiently manages all aspects of the data cycle.

If you apply to this skillset, you will be considered for multiple roles across the firm that require this skillset. Please note division and function examples below are representative of opportunities common for this skill-set. The list is not exhaustive, and availability of open roles is determined based on business.
 
Internal Audit
assesses the firm’s internal control structure, advises management on developing control solutions, and monitors the implementation of these measures. Audit teams work alongside the Finance and Technology divisions and make sure the firm is operating in a way that is safe and functional across the firm’s footprint

The primary role of Internal Audit is to help protect the assets, reputation and sustainability of the organization. We ensure that Goldman Sachs maintains effective controls by assessing the reliability of financial reports, monitoring the firm’s compliance with laws and regulations, and advising management on developing smart control solutions. Our group has unique insight on the financial industry and its products and operations. IA assists the firm's Board of Directors Audit Committee in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities and regularly interacts with the external independent auditors.
 
 
1-3 years of experience, ideally with a Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or Statistics
Proficiency in programming languages, such as Python, Java, or C++
Knowledge of basic statistics, including descriptive statistics, data distribution models, Time Series Analysis, correlation, and regression, and its application to data
Strong team player with excellent communication skills (written and oral). Ability to communicate what is relevant and important in a clear and concise manner and ability to handle multiple tasks
Driven and motivated and constantly taking initiative to improve performance
 


 
Experience with data analytics tools and techniques
Well versed with Python/SQL coding
 
Familiarity with text analytics and NLP using Python
Familiarity with machine learning algorithms and exposure to supervised and unsupervised learning - Linear/Logistic Regression, SVM, Random Forest and Boosting, Clustering and Patterns Recognition techniques
Experience with analytical/ statistical programs such as SAS, SPSS, and R
Experience with visualization tools (Spotfire, Qlikview or Tableau) is a plus
Creativity/Innovation, i.e., ability to create new ways to improve current processes and develop practical solutions that add value to department
Exposure to Financial Industry Investment/Retail or Commercial Banking is a plus
 


At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.

We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2021. All rights reserved.

Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity
title: 2023| Early Careers | Data Analytics and Business Intelligence | Analyst | Birmingham

job_desc:
Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.
 
With the support of a senior consultant, you will have the opportunity to carry out various projects independently and in collaboration with Artefact’s teams of experts: Strategy, Activation, Analytics, Data, Creation.

At the agency or at the client’s premises, the consultant is a true project manager. The diversity of your missions will allow you to be as close as possible to customer issues, to acquire a real knowledge of data and to quickly develop your skills.
 
 
define the needs of its customers by conducting interviews with customer teams and multiple technology partners,
to help build, formulate and present strategic data recommendations for the client,
to organize and conduct workshops and training to ensure the success of its projects,
to develop and present data recommendations to clients,
to imagine and present new support proposals to convince our future customers,
to participate in training courses to acquire the technical knowledge necessary for its mission as an advisor and to keep abreast of the latest technological innovations on the market,
and finally to participate in the writing of content on transversal subjects (e.g. publication of research works, writing articles or business cases).
 


Graduated from a business school (desired), the most important qualities in our eyes are intellectual curiosity, autonomy and dynamism.

A first knowledge of digital marketing (within a start-up, agency, etc.) or consulting (Strategy, Management, IS), will obviously be valued.
 
Why you should join us
 
 
Artefact is the place to be: come and build the future of marketing
Progress: every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn
Culture: join the best team you could ever imagine
Entrepreneurship: you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We won’t give up until we make a huge dent in this industry!
 


Artefact are hosting an Open Day on March the 16th 2023 for potential future Consultants to join our ever expanding London office!
 
If you, or someone you know is interested in taking part, hit apply, or reach out to oscar.brown@artefact.com directly!
title: Junior Data Consultant

job_desc:
Role Description
IDG is an ethical security provider, which supports the work of international development organisations and private companies across Asia, Africa, and the Middle East.
 
IDG is growing rapidly worldwide, and the Bid Writer will play an integral role in supporting this expansion. They will work to the Operations & Plans Manager, primarily using their technical bid writing skills to produce high quality proposals that win new business for the organisation. The primary focus initially will be on United Nations and governmental / diplomatic bids globally.
 
Further to their bid writing tasks, they will also be required to assist the Ops & Plans Manager and other new and developing sections of the business with gathering business intelligence, conducting market studies and research, and providing support to the global Head of Business Development. In doing so, they will provide both valuable assistance to relevant parts of the organisation, while deepening their understanding of the business and operating environment in a manner which enhances the bids they produce.
 
We offer a competitive salary plus other internal benefits. The successful applicant work as a part of a young and dynamic London Office team, but with great flexibility for remote or hybrid working.
 
Duties & Responsibilities
1. Bid writing (primarily for UN and humanitarian / governmental / diplomatic bids).
a)     Work to the Ops & Plans Manager in the overall management of the bid submission process from Initial Opportunity Assessment to decision communicated
b)     Gather evidence (with the support of the Legal and Financial Departments) to complete Pre-Qualification Questionnaires (PQQ) and other pre-selection requirements where applicable
c)     Undertake market research for the kick off meetings
d)     Check the rules the bid must follow, ensuring IDG has the appropriate certification to be eligible to bid
e)     Present technical information in accessible formats
f)      Ensure that win themes are articulated in such a way to meet / exceed the client’s requirements
g)     Design, write, edit and submit bid documents
h)     Keep accurate records and save material to build a 'bid library' for future use.
 
2.     Operations & Plans
Provide general support to IDG Security Operations as directed by the Ops & Plans Manager.
a)     As a part of the London Office, assist in developing a full understanding of the business from an operational perspective to aid bid preparation
b)     Will gain a full understanding of the IDG Security Operations Management System in support of ISO 18788 reaccreditation.
 
3.     Acumen Support
 
Provide support to the growth and development of IDG’s new subsidiary, Acumen.
a)     Bid writing (as per above)
b)     Market research
c)     Business Intelligence.
 
4.     Business Development
Provide BD support to the Global Head of BD including:
a)     Support development of new markets for IDG Security and Acumen
b)     Ensure business development opportunities are highlighted and forwarded to GHBD
 
c)     Work alongside the GHBD to ensure bid and opportunity tracking software is kept up to date.
 
Qualifications
- Bachelor’s Degree
- 5 years + previous successful bid writing experience
- Experience with UK Civil Service / FCDO (procurement) is desirable
- Ideally qualified by the Association for Proposal Management Professionals (APMP)
- Excellent computer literacy with all Mac / PC spreadsheet, word processing, email, messaging and accounting software systems
- Preferably has experience of working in a multilingual, multinational environment.
title: Bid Specialist

job_desc:
Data Analyst
 
UST are currently recruiting for an energetic, innovative Data Analyst who has the gift of creating and pragmatically implementing data analytics.


About UST
UST is a leading provider of platforms, digital innovation, artificial Intelligence and end-to-end IT & Business services and solutions for Global 1000 companies. We are transforming corporations through deep domain expertise, knowledge-based ML platforms, as well as profound anthropological efforts to understand the end customer and design products and interactions that create delight. 
We are deeply committed to developing a comprehensive understanding of our clients’ problems and to develop platforms to address them.


About the opportunity
 
The successful candidate will sit within the Data Science and Analytics team and will have access to large datasets and varied insight which you’ll be using to inform and direct conversations on range optimisation, operational efficiencies and geospatial sciences. 


You will bring your experience but also learn from experienced practitioners. We want you to show us what you are capable of, you will be both supported and challenged as you deliver pioneering results.


We are looking for an energetic, innovative problem solver, comfortable working both independently and collaboratively in a team, who can take on responsibility and ownership, looking to create value from data, and create the insight to solve business problems.
 
 Required Skills
Relevant previous experience or a degree with commercial and quantitative elements, such as Business, Maths, Geography, Psychology.
Aptitude for logical thinking and problem solving, experience using and combining diverse datasets would be an advantage
Experience with data visualisation tools such as PowerBI
Ability to understand questions as analytical problems and subsequently using available data, quantitative modelling or statistical analysis techniques to develop solutions.
Strong attention to detail and have the drive to investigate potential errors.
Ability to organise and prioritise own workload, often balancing multiple projects and campaigns simultaneously
Proficiency in a coding language such as SQL, Python, R would benefit you.




Desirable skills: 
 
Experience with GIS software and techniques.
Demonstrable record of delivering results in a commercial environment.
Ability to deal well with ambiguity and an expert in prioritisation of needs.
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
DATA SCIENTIST | Remote - UK based
 
ABOUT THE ROLE
 
The role of the Data Scientist is to help discover and build algorithms for Wejo’s data products utilising data & analytics platforms in place for both stream and batch systems. You will be required to perform some basic engineering activities to across a wide range of datasets to prepare/curate the data.
 
Once the prepared data is in place, you will then utilise and apply the necessary industry/academic data models/algorithms to help understand and shape the data to underpin Wejo as a “data driven business”.
 
 
Key Responsibilities
 
Provide the insights and discovery on a variety of dataset across the business
Work with other members of the Data function to design, estimate and build big data products.
Work with the product owners and business analysts in analysing business requirements to design and implement data structures and fine tune performance to meet those requirements.
Review new external data sets and open data sources to understand potential usage.
Work with Infrastructure and DevOps teams to release and maintain live products.
Participate in establishing processes and best practices around development standards, version control, quality control, deployment, maintenance and change management.
Ensuring a professional image of the company and themselves is presented at all times.


 
ABOUT YOU
 
 
Data Science related qualification at degree level or higher
Experience in the field of big data engineering.
Strong experience with Hadoop and Spark using language of python or Scala
Solid understanding of statistical and predictive modelling concepts, machine-learning approaches, clustering and classification techniques, and recommendation and optimization algorithms
Knowledge of some / all of: regression, neural networks, decision trees (random forest, gradient boosted trees etc.), agglomerative clustering, k-means, gradient descent, logistic regression etc.
Ability to analyse large, complex, multi-dimensional datasets using SQL, R and / or python


 
 
You might also have:
 
 
Experience working with an Agile environment
Experience with SQL query engines. E.g. Hive, Impala or Presto.
Experience setting up build pipelines. E.g. Git, Jenkins and Nexus.
Experience with cloud computing environments. E.g. AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform.
Experience developing stream-processing systems. E.g. Kafka, Spark streaming, Storm or Flink.
Experience with data modelling and data warehousing. E.g. Postgres, Redshift.
Experience with other NoSQL technologies. E.g. Elasticsearch, Cassandra, Redis or Ignite.
Experience Managing Data ingestion and processing operations


 
**
 
**
 
ABOUT WEJO
 
Wejo is a global leader in the connected car market and is shaping the future of mobility. The connected car space is one of the fastest growing sectors in the IoT industry. Car manufacturers are looking to extend traditional infotainment systems, insurers are seeking a better understanding of risk, users are demanding more feedback and firms are generating increasing amounts of data and require support in understanding its applications and value. We specialise in creating new services and products to help clients make the most of their data and realise its value.
 
We bring together the brightest minds and industry experts with award-winning platform technology and advanced privacy and security to revolutionise the way we live, work and travel using connected car data, insights and analytics.

An exciting opportunity for an experienced SC Cleared Data Analyst to work for a large Public Sector organisation in London. You will be you’ll be supporting the future of data sharing across government.

organisation and time management skills
attention to detail and an ability to identify issues and to solve problems creatively, in accordance with strategic objectives.
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Our mission is to accelerate industrial decarbonisation and we are hiring - are you our next content superstar?
 
 
Location
: Home-working with weekly team meet ups in London
Your Experience
: 18 months-2 years of commercial content production in B2B events or business intelligence, You have a strong focus on high quality content that delivers great experiences as well as revenue targets.
 
 
About Us:
 
Decarb Connect is a global initiative that supports hard-to-abate sectors to decarbonise. Launched in January 2020, we are a growing start-up with an experienced team bringing expertise in network-building, content creation, in person/virtual experiences and data products.
 
 
Our focus is on sectors including cement, metals, refining, chemicals, glass and ceramics – all of which face significant challenges if they are to decarbonise and meet their net-zero goals. We support leaders in these sectors tasked with decarbonisation via a private members network, live and virtual events, reports, webinars and a podcast series.
 
The business growth in the past 3 years has been phenomenal and we’re on a mission to keep this going and support those driving decarbonisation to make a difference. Our mission is our priority, but we are a for-profit, commercial organisation.
 
Conference Producer: The Role
 
Are you curious about the way the world works – do you love the challenge of learning about new concept or issues? Are you creative, focused, analytical and have a strong motivation to succeed? Do you thrive on the satisfaction of doing a job well, and knowing that your work has purpose? Perhaps you're someone who doesn't want to be “just another cog in the wheel” - you want to join a team where you’ll have an impact on the business from day 1....
 
We’re on the lookout for an experienced and enthusiastic Conference Producer to take charge of existing events and new events and develop the strategy and content that will drive their growth. You’ll also support our Decarbonisation Leaders Network team by sharing intel and intros along with speaker suggestions for meet ups (separate from the event programmes that you’ll wholly own).
 
If this is you, talk to us about an exciting opportunity for you to build and grow a rapidly expanding global portfolio.
 
If the following describes you, get in touch:
 
 
You excelled at school and university and staying on top of global trends is important to you
Commercial approach to research, planning and event delivery
Entrepreneurial – a problem solver and opportunity identifier
Able to work autonomously, resourcefully and using your initiative
A confident communicator – great at using conversations to advance your research and to develop relationships
An organisational whizz – able to juggle multiple projects at different stages of development
A keen eye for detail – take pride in the quality and results of your work
Have a positive can-do attitude and thrive in a start-up environment and culture
A team player who can support marketing and sales teams effectively
Excellent writing skills to produce effective sales copy and craft benefit-driven messages in all aspects of your work.


 
Requirements
:
 
BA or BSc with a 2:1 degree or better
Proven interest or experience in climate-related/sustainability issues
Experience in energy, industry and/or investment events or content
Have produced content for international markets that drove delegate or subscriber revenue as well as sponsorship
Experience in launching new events
A* organisational skills - you meet deadlines and targets as a habit
Superior writing and editing skills: you can show what it means to write in a way that supports commercial goals. You naturally have a good eye for detail and are strong on copy proofing
You are commercially-oriented, but equally committed to providing audiences and clients with beneficial content and experiences


 
Role responsibilities
 
1.    Research with industry leaders –
 
The primary focus of your role is to research and develop content that will deliver our growth targets. You will conduct detailed, commercial telephone-based research with leaders from across the decarbonisation ecosystem. It will be your responsibility to develop relationships with key contacts and to record and share your learnings with the wider team.
 
2.    Agenda building –
 
You will translate your in-depth research into compelling, detailed agendas for conferences that resonate with our audience, reflect their priorities, and provide opportunities for solution providers to contribute to the discussions. You’ll be able to demonstrate how you’re your findings will drive delegate revenue and sponsorship revenue growth, year on year.
 
3.
 
Speaker acquisition –
 
You will secure a diverse speaker line-up including leaders from the hard-to-abate sectors to share their views, case studies and learnings from their decarb activities. You will need to be skilled at building rapport with senior-level executives to confirm speakers who will inspire, engage and educate our audience.
 
4.    Speaker management –
 
You will follow a defined process for managing speakers, gathering collateral and the maintenance of speaker relationships before, during and following each event you produce.
 
5.
 
Project management –
 
You will be the project manager for each of the events you produce, so it will be your responsibility to brief other members of the project team with your findings and rationale, and taking input to refine the product you are building. You’ll keep an eye on the sales channels and will support those in sales and marketing roles as needed, with the end targets in mind.
 
6.    On-site event delivery –
 
You will travel to in-person events to support the onsite delivery of your events. You will be the point of contact for all the speakers and responsible for the smooth and timely running of the full event.
 
7.
 
Work closely with our Membership Network team
 
– you'll ensure that you share topics, market intel with your team mates in the DLN team. You’ll be a regular provider of speakers, introductions and topic ideas to help grow membership content, you’ll also look for cross-promotion opportunities and be a champion of the network in the market.
 
 
What Decarb Connect can offer you:
•              25 days Holiday per year plus bank holidays plus additional holiday between Christmas and New Year.
•              Opportunity to contribute purposefully to issues surrounding climate and decarbonisation
•              Mentoring from senior team and Founder
•              Development and training opportunities and plenty of career growth as the business expands
•              Competitive salary and bonus scheme, stakeholder pension plan
 
To apply:
To be considered, you’ll need to send a compelling cover letter along with your CV that shows how you meet the requirements of the role to careers@decarbconnect.com
title: Conference Producer

job_desc:
Department:
 
Research and Insights
 
Employment Type:
 
Full Time
 
Location:
 
London, UK
 
 
You'll be working to put users at the centre of our design process, helping to deliver digital experiences that sports fans can't live without. Acting as an ambassador for data within Pulselive, you'll be championing the value and benefits the practice can bring to our clients and our products. In collaboration with other teams, you'll be defining analytics requirements, compiling actionable findings and recommendations, uncovering user insights, building dashboards, optimising digital performance, and delivering increased ROI.
 
As part of our rapidly growing Research & Audience Insights chapter, you'll need to thrive in a fast paced environment. With a few years of experience under your belt, you're ready to come in quickly and get stuck into client and internal workstreams. You'll embrace the opportunity to lead from the front, helping your colleagues understand the importance of data in design and development. In turn, you'll get to work with some of the biggest names in sports on products that bring enjoyment to millions of people worldwide.
 
 
 
 
Developed analytics frameworks across multiple clients. You've worked to level up clients' analytics programs, informing them on best practices and empowering them to do more with their data. Understanding that maturity varies, you've provided support in defining OKRs, capturing analytics requirements, and designing/developing analytics implementations. Most importantly, you've interpreted and distilled clients needs into data they can easily understand and act upon. From automated dashboards to regular health checks, you've found ways to tell a compelling story.
 
Driven forward data as a key pillar of Pulselive's offering. You developed clear business cases, synthesized quantitative research findings, and demonstrated value across the board. Within Pulselive, you've challenged the business to consider new investment opportunities when it comes to fan data — you might even be working on a new proprietary software through our Research & Development program.
 
Helped drive forward our testing culture. You helped mentor cross-functional teams on the value of analytics and experimentation, encouraging and empowering individuals to start thinking about data in new ways. Whether for an entirely new product or a simple feature release, you've worked collaboratively to find ways to measure the impact of what we built and demonstrate ROI.
 
Demonstrated the power of data in design. You identified and acted upon opportunities to integrate data into the creative process and development cycle 一 shaping the way that we build products and educating other members of the team. By identifying actionable patterns and trends, you've consistently impacted the way we design digital products.
Informed overarching analytics strategy. As part of the Research & Audience Insights chapter, you've helped develop a company wide analytics strategy, advancing the way we track and monitor user behaviour across digital platforms. Your work has ingrained analytics as a core part of every project, ensuring enough time and budget is dedicated to do things right.
Implemented best practices and streamlined our processes. You've optimised data collection systems, enabling more efficient data analysis and enhanced digital performance. Across clients, you've provided developers with clear instructions for analytics implementation, supported QA pre-release, and monitored post-launch to ensure everything is coming in smoothly.


 
Illustrated the possibilities of data visualisation. You've found innovative ways to capture, manipulate, and display data, uncovering new insights and driving innovative product development. In addition, you've helped the creative team to showcase data to fans in new ways, enhancing player profiles, match centres, and statistics across client products.


 
 
 
In the past, you have...
 
Worked with Google Analytics, Firebase, Google Tag Manager, Data Studio, and BigQuery (and/or similar digital analytics tools)
Have experience with quantitative UX research methods, like survey analysis, A/B testing, and Multivariate testing
Applied your knowledge of Python and SQL to analyse large data sets, run custom queries and set-up personalised, automated reporting dashboards
Leveraged the power of statistical computing (through R or some other tool) to produce tangible insights and actionable product recommendations
Worked in collaborative, cross-functional teams. You know how to work with designers, developers, and product managers to turn data into recommendations and requirements that feed directly into product development
Helped stakeholders translate objectives and questions into analytics requirements, ensuring that meaningful data are captured
Managed relationships with clients and stakeholders, telling compelling stories through data
Been exposed to the interplay between business requirements, product strategy, technical constraints, and user experience




 
It would be great if you...
 
 
Have experience with other analytics tools like Adobe Analytics, Segment, Data Studio, HotJar, Tableau, Conviva, Qualtrics, etc.
Have Google Analytics certifications
Have a good understanding of data layers and app/web data collection
Love sports and have a strong understanding of the different stakeholders in the space


 
 
At Pulselive we truly value our team and have developed our approach to ensure you are not only rewarded for your contribution but have access to unique benefits along with a positive approach to wellness. We want to ensure that your career, health and well-being are of the utmost importance at all times.
 
 
Benefits & Wellness
Flexible & Remote Working
Buy and Sell Annual Leave
Pension Scheme
Sporting Events and Tickets
Health & Wellness Activities
Complimentary Headspace Access
Annual Wellness Contribution
Mobile Phone Contribution
Sony Discounts
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
This is a very innovative london-based business within the automotive industry. They provide insightful data and information for Europe's leading vehicle design makers.
 
They are now looking to recruit a Graduate Data Analyst to join their high-performing team on a remote working basis.
 
Role
 
The Graduate Data Analyst for this automotive analytics business shall take on a number of key duties including:
 
 
Pulling data across various countries from business systems including Tableau and Salesforce
Maintaining high quality data by creating and implementing test procedures for KPI reporting
Analysing the KPI Tableau dashboard to check for inconsistencies
Scrutinising and identifying commercial and non-commercial trends from the reports
Taking ownership of specific areas of weekly and monthly reporting
Assisting in ongoing projects to introduce new data and analysis fields/tools
Ensure accurate and consistent reporting that reflects the commercial reality of the business


 
Profile
 
The Graduate Data Analyst for this exciting automotive business should have the following profile:
 
 
Recent graduate with a numerical/computer science degree
Ideally a strong academic background
Exposure to Tableau/Power Query is highly desireable
Confident with the use of Excel
Comfortable working remotely


 
 
£26,000 to £28,000 plus great benefits including:
 
 
Remote position
Summer time working hours (4 day work week)
Generous bonus scheme
Work from home allowance
Regular seasonal events
Study support package


 
The salary range/rates of pay is dependent upon your experience, qualifications or training.
 
Robert Half Ltd acts as an employment business for temporary positions and an employment agency for permanent positions. Robert Half is committed to equal opportunity and diversity. Suitable candidates with equivalent qualifications and more or less experience can apply. Rates of pay and salary ranges are dependent upon your experience, qualifications and training. If you wish to apply, please read our Privacy Notice describing how we may process, disclose and store your personal data: roberthalf.co.uk/legal-information/privacy-notice.
title: Graduate Data Analyst

job_desc:
Data analyst
 
Marketflow is global e-commerce & fintech group delivering solutions to power the online economy. We work hard to find people who help us make better decisions by working together on common objectives. We are committed to building an actively inclusive work environment that makes Marketflow an excellent home for everyone. For our international office in Macclesfield, we are currently looking to expand our team with an experienced Data Analyst.
 
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
 
 
Preparing and communicating analysis, relevant trends, and campaign performances (including SLA’s & KPI’s)

title: Data Analyst -URGENT-

job_desc:
At Auto Trader we have built a cloud data platform to support decision-making in many areas of the business. We use machine learning to help millions of car buyers find their next car, and we provide insight to help thousands of automotive retailers optimise their businesses. Our goal is for every process, product, and strategic decision to be informed by data and enhanced by analytic thinking. We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to support our vision of making Auto Trader a data science-led organisation.
 
Our Data Analysts work in cross-functional workstreams with data engineers, product leads, and developers, so you will be collaborating in a team with a diverse set of skills and personalities. These teams work together to develop insight-driven, market-leading digital products and services. As an analytical expert, you will develop data products and insight that drive decisions and solutions key to achieving your team’s objectives.
 
You will engage regularly with stakeholders, challenge assumptions, and champion data-driven decision-making. You will be supported by a Senior/Principal Data Analyst and collaborate with other Analysts and Scientists in your team.
 
As a Data Analyst, you will work across all of Auto Trader, so there is no shortage of opportunities to make an impact. Upcoming projects that you might work on include enabling online transactions as we evolve from a digital advertising to a digital retailing platform, or developing a real-time personalised experience for buyers on our website through our customer data platform.
 
Data Analysts form part of a wider analytical community of Data Scientists and Digital Analysts. Together we share insights, learn from each-other and overcome common challenges through regular showcases, feedback sessions and mentorship initiatives.
 
If you're interested in learning more about how we use Data Science at Auto Trader, you can read some blogs here; https://engineering.autotrader.co.uk/
 
 
 
Experience doing data analysis in a commercial or academic (e.g. PhD) environment
Experience delivering analytical tasks, being responsible for requirements and having the courage to challenge misconceptions
A good understanding of statistical topics and the ability to explain them to non-technical stakeholders. For example, this would include hypothesis testing and linear regression
Confidence analysing data with a programming language (e.g. Python, R)
Confidence delivering insight through good visualisation practices and compelling storytelling
An ability to collaborate in cross-functional teams with a diverse set of skills and prioritise input from a range of stakeholders
A passion for supporting your analytical community through collaboration and feedback


 
It would also be beneficial (but not essential) if you have:
 
 
Experience with our technology stack
Experience using a data warehouse and SQL
Familiarity with data science methods, such as machine learning to spot opportunities for data science
Experience using a business intelligence tool to create dashboards and promote self-service of insight


 
 
We're offering a salary between £35,000 - £60,000 dependent on experience, and a flexible benefits package to support your health and well-being. You'll have 28 days holiday per year, and that's in addition to bank holidays and half day closures on Christmas and New Year's Eve. Our Aviva pension scheme offers between 5% to 7% employer contributions depending on the percentage you choose to contribute, and we provide Bupa healthcare cover for all of our employees.
 
Our employee assistance programme, enhanced parental leave and share-save options and are just some of the other benefits on offer should you decide to join us.
 
Career development is something that we're passionate about at Auto Trader, and we all develop and learn things differently. Whether you attend an external conference, utilise a LinkedIn Learning license or choose one of our in-house masterclasses, there's something for everyone.
 
Our hybrid working model, Connected Working, combines office with home working. We've split it into fixed and flexible days to help you get the best out of the working week. Everybody has two fixed office days with their team, so you will know that the rest of your team will be in on those days. There is an expectation that everyone is, on average, in more than out; therefore, on top of your two fixed days, we should see you in the office on other flexible days. You can choose these flexible days in the office depending on your work, home and team commitments.
 
Find out more about Connected Working here or speak to a member of our resourcing team.
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Our people work differently depending on their jobs and needs. From hybrid working to flexible hours , we have plenty of options that help our people to thrive.
 
This role is based in the United Kingdom and as such all normal working days must be carried out in the United Kingdom.
 
Join us as a Data Analyst
 
 
Take on a new challenge in a cutting edge data team, in which you’ll contribute to the analysis of complex bank, franchise or function data to identify business issues and opportunities
We’ll look to you to provide high quality analytical input to help develop and implement innovative processes and resolve problems across the bank
This is a hands on role in which you'll hone your data analysis expertise and gain valuable experience in a dynamic area of our business
 


What you'll do
 
As a Data Analyst, you'll play a key role in supporting the delivery of high quality business solutions. You’ll be performing data extraction, storage, manipulation, processing and analysis, alongside developing and performing standard queries to ensure data quality and identify data inconsistencies and missing data.
 
Day-to-day, you’ll also be:
 
 
Collecting, profiling and mapping appropriate data to use in new or existing solutions as well as for ongoing data activities
Identifying and documenting data migration paths and processes, standardising data naming, data definitions and modelling
Helping to interpret customer needs and turning them into functional or data requirements and process models
 
Building and maintaining collaborative partnerships with key business stakeholders
 


The skills you'll need
 
We’re looking for someone with experience of using data analysis tools and delivering data analysis in a technology or IT function.
 
We’ll also look for:
 
 
An in-depth understanding of the interrelationships of data and multiple data domains
A background in delivering research based on qualitative and quantitative data across a range of subjects
Excellent communication and influencing skills
 


 
If you need any adjustments to support your application, such as information in alternative formats or special requirements to access our buildings, or if you’re eligible under the Disability Confident Scheme please contact us and we’ll do everything we can to help.
 
Apply for this job
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Role: Data Analyst
 
Salary: Up to £40,000pa
 
 
About the role
 
The
 
Data Analyst
 
is a critical role within RWS Group Technology as the organization moves towards being more data and analytics driven. This change in organisational construct is driving the need to review, rationalize & refine the currently diverse operating models within the organisation. You will be responsible for defining and governing the group data model, global data catalogue and data management strategy.
 
You will be seen as a trusted advisor on behalf of data across the organisation with development operations, business applications and IT.
 
This is a growing team with a high bar in terms of inviting new people to join us. We seek people who will help drive our business forward and challenge norms by striving for more. Aside from your skills and experience, we’re most interested in your growth mindset and development potential.
 
This is a full-time role that’s based in one of our European offices, but we expect to maintain a culture of flexibility and a mix of WFH and office time.
 
 
What you’ll do
 
Work with a vast array of data sources including translation, operational & financial to develop data processes and models which support our insight goals
Develop and maintain our group data model in line with our long-term business objectives
Providing technical leadership and direction for the companies engineering team
Advise on duplications & conflicts within the data models of the RWS Group (originating from the different entities) and identify practical solutions for aligning the data models.
Support the alignment of data governance across the RWS group and enforce through solution reviews and audits
Provide guidance as to how data quality and meta data management should be embedded in business processes & systems
Building effective relationships with senior technical staff so there is a common understanding of goals and challenges


 
 
What we’re looking for
 
 
Recent, working experience in a Data Analyst role
Experience with assessing and implementing enterprise-wide meta data management tools, data models and data catalogues
Expertise in SQL & SSIS is essential
Strong English communication skills
An expert understanding of data integration
Knowledge of information principles and policies
Strategic mind-set with the ability to focus on the “bigger picture”
Experience in integrating complex and cross-corporate processes
Analytical skills — Outstanding analytical and problem-solving abilities
Experience with data visualization in a tool such as Tableau, Business Objects, Power BI, Sisense is a bonus
Experience working with Cloud Based solutions is a bonus
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
About Modern
Modern is a B2B digital marketing consultancy working with innovative businesses. We provide marketing technology consultancy, cutting-edge digital strategy and marketing programmes across digital acquisition, brand amplification, marketing automation and account-targeted activity.
Our main offering is strategic services and associated activities to support the growth of innovation. We do this by exploring the best ways to use technology combined with marketing best practice for our clients. Modern’s clients are high growth innovative companies selling in the business to business space.
Our mission is to partner with businesses to help them transform their marketing function; challenging the status quo to unlock the potential behind their marketing technology, enhance the customer experience and drive revenue.
 
The role
The Data Analyst role is an integral role within Modern. The main focus of the Data Analyst role is to deliver data analysis solutions to our Clients. You will be adept at data management and data visualization. You will feel comfortable manipulating complex data sets and transforming them into dashboards, reports and visualizations using platforms such as Looker Data Studio (Google Data Studio), Tableau and PowerBI.
 
 
Working with the B2B sector, you will be responsible for delivering data in a way that drives actionable insights to improve marketing performance, customer experiences, and campaigns.
You’ll be a self-starter, collaborator and great communicator team player with superb analytical skills, you’ll provide performance analysis, website behaviour analysis and digital campaigns.
 
You’ll be the go-to person for gathering complex sets of data from multiple sources in order to consolidate performance insights. Working across multiple platforms, dashboards and data analysis programmes. You’ll love data and be able to take requirements from a range of stakeholders and problem-solve for the teams at Modern.
 
Key Accountabilities:
 
Compile and aggregate data from multiple sources to create reports highlighting KPIs and optimisation recommendations
 
Ensuring that reporting and analysis needs of clients are met as per the timeline and to agreed requirements
Designing, building and deploying reports, dashboards and analytical solutions, including data visualisation
 
Seek to drive automation of processes and streamline data aggregation via scripting and API integrations
Ensure maintenance of connectors for digital dashboards and reports
 
Ensure maintenance of documentation for report structures and processes
Ensure that reports meet presentation standards
 
Deep dive analysis where appropriate such as headroom analysis, audience analysis, performance analysis, website conversion analysis and digital customer journey mapping
Work closely with the Strategy team and Client Services team to provide reports, recommendations and analysis
Train and assist users of the dashboards and platforms


 
Essential Skills and Experience:
 
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Maths, Computer Science, Marketing, Business, or a related field
Have at least 2 years’ experience working in an analytics role
Extensive knowledge of Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google Data Studio, Google Cloud Platform
Proven track record with Supermetrics, Google BigQuery, and Tableau
 
Proven track record working with APIs and scripts
Experience with Python coding essential
Experience with SQL, JavaScript and HTML desirable
Advanced Excel / Google Sheets skills essential
Knowledge of marketing automation platforms such as Pardot, Eloqua, Marketo
Ability to create custom reports from multiple data-sets
 
Advanced data visualisation skills
Ability to work to an agency delivery model across multiple clients
Excellent attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical skills, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills relating to data projects
Google Analytics certified preferred


 
Benefits:
 
Business pension contributions
Comprehensive private medical insurance
Access to discount platform for everyday shopping
Access to financial advisor
Access to external mental and physical health support
25 days holiday annual leave plus bank holidays plus Christmas shutdown
Great culture with strong employee engagement initiative
Training and educational programme


 
Diversity, inclusion and wellbeing
At Modern, our mission is to partner with businesses to help them transform their marketing function; challenging the status quo to unlock the potential behind the technology, enhance the customer experience and drive revenue.
To achieve this, we put our people first by creating a culture of openness, personal growth and collaboration - where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and make it easy for others to do the same.
We therefore strategically choose to make sure we attract, develop, advance and retain our employees, understanding that the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

job_desc:
NRG are recruiting for an experienced Data Analyst to join one of the fastest-growing insurance companies that you have probably never heard of. As a part of the Claims Data Analyst team, you’ll be key in supporting the delivery of the claims strategy, by helping to redesign and automate end-to-end processes.
 
This role offers a salary up to £43,000 as well as a range of benefits including bonus scheme based upon business and personal performance, healthcare, life assurance and flexible & hybrid working.
 
You will be a dynamic, driven professional who is keen to help evolve the business in new directions. You will play an important role in driving the next phase of growth, managing multiple projects at one time.
 
As one of the fastest growing insurance companies in the world, you’ll have exposure to a wide range of technical SME’s to bounce of as well as having access to an excellent training package, personalised to you and your goals.
 
 
MI and data insight that enables the Business to make effective operational and strategic decisions.
Work collaboratively within the claims MI team to build and support process automation and address issues with SQL, Power BI and ThoughtSpot.
Supporting the development of analytical reports including iterating improvements in data models and processes to ensure robustness and scalability.
Documenting data processes and dictionaries to improve visibility and understanding of our data.
Analytical skill set with an ability to understand data requirements and support the development of data solutions.
Work with Claims Analytics to build business rules and automation processes. Then monitor these and address issues as required.


 
SQL skills including the ability to write and read highly performant code.
Knowledge of the fundamental principles of data warehousing and relational databases.
Data presentation using tools such as Excel, Power BI & ThoughtSpot
Pragmatic, strategic thinker who is able to prioritise and plan automation opportunities across claims.
Creation, development, maintenance and management of effective MI.
Experience with machine learning is a benefit.


 
To apply, click ‘apply now’ to be considered and one of the team will be in touch.
