title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
We are Touchstone, we manage a portfolio of properties on behalf of the UK's biggest landlords across the UK.
 
We want you to join the Places for People Group and the 11,000 other colleagues on our journey; colleagues who have helped to build, manage, and maintain places that people are proud to call home and stay active in. How do we do all this? We surround ourselves with customer focused, driven and supportive people. Our people live and breathe our SPIRIT values; we are the place for spirited people.
 
 
For more information, please download our job profile available on our website.
 
We are recruiting an Assistant Data Analyst to work in our new Data Team to assist developing a suite of standardised Power BI reports by collating, analysing, and producing reports from complex data sets within our private rental stock. This will involve reporting on all company data in relation to our tenancies, maintenance, compliance, customer satisfaction and finance with clear definitions, governance, and data management. You'll provide actionable insights and analyses to inform business decisions using ETL processes and Power BI data models.
 
This is a great development opportunity to the right candidate as you will be supported with technical and skill-based contact.
 
 
We are looking for someone who has a real passion for data and understands the role it can play in helping businesses make impactful decisions. You will have previous experience of data manipulation and consider your Excel skills to be advanced. As a skilled communicator you'll feel comfortable presenting to stakeholders, and you'll enjoy developing positive working relationships. If you have used software such as Power BI, Tableau or Business Objects this would be a great advantage, but we will support you to further develop your knowledge.
 
Above all you will be someone with a keen eye for detail, able to spot errors and have the tenacity to investigate issues and find why something isn't reporting as expected.
 
 
We are a large diverse and ambitious business, which will give you job security and all the challenge you could wish for. Here people can flourish, thrive, better themselves and work in fantastic communities with inspirational colleagues and customers.
 
 
We know that there's always more we can do to make you smile, that's why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to help colleagues save money or make their lives a little bit easier which can include
 
 
 
Excellent holiday pay and sick pay
 
Pension with matched contributions
 
Training
 
Extra perks including huge discounts and offers from shops, cinemas and much more.


 
 
What's next?
 
If you meet the criteria and are ready to make the next step in your career then apply following our simple 5-minute application process, upload a CV and a supporting statement which demonstrates how you meet the requirements of the role. If you have any questions, please call the recruitment team on 01772 666555.
 
Please note that we may bring the closing date forward, if we receive a large number of quality applications. If you are interested in this role, we would advise applying immediately to avoid disappointment.
 
If you are using a mobile device such as an iPad then ensure your CV is stored in the cloud, we currently support Google Drive, OneDrive and Dropbox.
title: Assistant Data Analyst

job_desc:
Do you want to learn while you earn, a job that pays you while you train????
 
 
Do you enjoy working with data, and have a strong attention to detail?
 
 
Who are we??
 
 
For almost a decade Sparta Global have been designing careers, coaching future leaders, and promoting a more diverse and equal landscape within the tech industry across the UK. We work with over 100 public and private business, partnering to power both their short- and long-term business plans and technical projects, with the help of our Spartan Consultants. Our work has garnered us with over 10 awards across the ED&I and Training arenas and has positioned us a Top 20 Employer for Social Mobility.??
 
We want you to view your time at Sparta as an investment into your future, that pays dividends along the way. The longer you stay with Sparta the wider the breadth of experience you will have, along with increasing opportunities to develop and earn more. No two career paths look the same at Sparta.??
 
What's the Job?
 
 
 
As a Dat Engineer, you'll be designing, building, maintaining, and troubleshooting the data pipelines that enable organizations to store, process, and analyse their data, and ensuring the data is reliable through testing and debugging. Looking for efficiencies and optimising the data pipelines for scalability and performance will be a focus.
 
You'll be handling and working with large sets of structured and unstructured data and will be responsible for ensuring that the data is organized and available for data scientists and analysts to use.
Working with others is key, you could be working with other engineers, developers, data scientists, analysts and even stakeholders to understand their data needs.
 


 
We're not expecting you to be an expert right away - that's where our award-winning Academy comes in. We're experts in building skills and confidence in a fun and supportive environment that will not only challenge but develop you into a confident and capable consultant. All we ask for, when everything is over, is an invite to the gala dinner in your honour.??
 
What we're looking for?
 
 
To be successful in this role, you should have skills in either C#, Java, Python or similar. You will be passionate about technology and eager to learn and grow your skills.??'?
 
Professionalism - How you present yourself to the wider business is important to you, to be seen as a credible and reliable individual that can handle responsibility.??
 
Organisation and Time Management- Nothing gets past you; you know what you're doing when and why. You meet your deadlines, plan-ahead and can even get-ahead with tasks!??
 
Problem-Solvers - No challenge is too big, and you get a thrill from solving them creatively.??
 
Communication and Collaboration - You can always find the right words to say and are able to work with others effectively in cross functional teams.??
 
Curious and Passionate- You're naturally curious about why things are the way they are and stay on top of new technologies and programming languages.??
 
Why should you apply??
 
 
We value respect and kindness and look for individuals with a growth mind-set and a passion for learning. We see ourselves as a people-powered business with vision and purpose and take every opportunity to recognise and reward the hard work of our Spartans. This includes putting them forward for individual industry awards, including Rising Star of the Year, Rising Digital Hero, and specific awards around their skill specialism. We promote continuous learning and development with increasing earning potential for everyone who joins us.???
 
On top of that we can offer;??
 
 
21 days annual leave + bank holidays??
An extra day off for your birthday!???
Bonuses and structured pay rises???
% Penson Contribution???
Employee assistance program???
Vitality health insurance???
Discounted gym memberships???
Yearly budget for personal development??
Access to alumni and community networks???
An opportunity to work as a brand ambassador?


 
What do I need to have to apply???
 
 
We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from candidates from all backgrounds and levels of experience.??
 
To be eligible to apply, all you need is to...??
 
 
Be able to relocate as necessary throughout the UK for client projects??
Hold the full rights to work in the UK without sponsorship??


 
Please note, unfortunately we cannot accept applications from candidates who require visa sponsorship or are on a Visa that will require sponsorship after it expires. We also can only accept applications from candidates currently living and residing in the UK.???
 
Once you have applied, you will be contacted by a dedicated Talent Coordinator to provide careers advice an application support and guidance.?
title: Junior Data Engineer

job_desc:
Citywire is currently looking for a Data Analyst to join our experienced and growing Technology team. You will be working closely with business stakeholders to understand their data requirements and helping them with the data they need to achieve their goals. We’re looking for someone with strong communication and interpersonal skills to join our team.
 
A little about us... Citywire helps people make better investments. We publish news, analysis and unique fund manager performance information to help professional investors make the best decisions about where to place their clients' money. Sustainability is at the heart of what we do. We employ around 300 staff and look for motivated, passionate and dynamic people from all walks of life and backgrounds. Professional development is paramount to us to keep innovated and we encourage training throughout your career. We have offices in London, Brighton, New York, Munich, Milan, Singapore, Sydney, and Paris. We have fully embraced a hybrid model of working.
 
Main Responsibilities:
 
 
As Data Analyst you will be involved in:
 
 
 
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their data requirements and help provide them with the data they need to achieve their goals.
 
 
Extracting data from underlying datasets and producing appropriate reporting solutions
 
Analysing and gaining insight from data to understand what it shows and how it can help drive business decisions
 
 
Working closely with the Data Engineering team to make sure data is in the correct structure for analysing and reporting, and with the Development teams to ensure the right data is captured at source
 
Empowering users within the business to become data champions in their own departments
 
Helping drive engineering projects based on business data needs


 
Job Specific Skills / Technical Skills / Requirements
 
 
 
Clear communication skills and ability to collaborate with colleagues of all levels
 
A strong analytical approach to data with the ability to analyse complex datasets, comfortable using raw data to build reports.
 
Proficient in data visualisation – expressing data in easy-to-understand formats


 
Experience using/working with:
 
 
 
Manipulating data using SQL.
 
Google Big Query
 
Visulatisation tools such as Looker Studio or equivalent
 
NoSQL Databases
 
AWS, GCP or similar cloud platforms
 
Excel, Googlesheets
 
Power Query


 
Who We Are
 
Honesty
,
 
integrity
,
 
fairness
 
and
 
respect
 
are four core values. We can and should disagree with one another, in the interests of getting the right answer. Arguments for truth, not ego. We should always focus on sustainability at every level of the company.
 
Excelling at your job will contribute to high performance at Citywire. You should have a continuous and constructive spoken dialogue with your manager about your performance, with reference to these behaviours:
 
A positive approach
;
 
collaborating with colleagues
;
 
a make it happen attitude
.
 
We offer a competitive salary and additional company benefits:
 
 
 
25 days holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after three years’ service followed by 30 days after five years’ service) plus bank holidays
 
Flexible working options
 
£480 allowance on any wellbeing activity and/or gym options. We will help with your monthly or annual costs
 
We have a personal trainer who runs virtual workout sessions during lunchtime weekly
 
Eye-test and glasses allowance
 
Competitive private pension scheme
 
Critical illness cover and group life assurance from day 1
 
Well-being: access to an independent Employee Assistance Programme available 24/7
 
Cycle to work scheme and annual ticket travel card loans
 
Techscheme, which lets staff buy the latest tech through their employer. Employees can spread the cost with payments from their salary across 12 months and make a National Insurance saving too


 
After two years continuous service you will also have access to group income protection and private medical and dental insurance
 
Check out our Youtube channel to find out more about us: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPMOUK4uLN7yZU8j79l4zcg
 
Additional Notes
 
Pre-selected applicants will undertake 2 psychometrics tests.
 
Interviews will take place via Zoom/Teams.
 
Citywire is an equal opportunities employer.
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Purpose of the Role:
 
 
 
 
The key challenge of this role is to develop data visualisations and user interfaces to improve our effectiveness in car development and our performance on track.
 
 
 
 
Role Dimensions:
 
 
 
 
This role lies within the Data Science team, which is part of the Software & Data Science department.  This team is responsible for a range of bespoke software applications and data tools used to process and analyse data, as well as improve the accuracy and efficiency of experimentation. This is achieved through development of analysis capabilities realised by advanced modelling and visualisation, as well as business analysis of the end-to-end workflows across the whole of the Racing team.
 
 
Data is the lifeblood of a Formula 1 team, flowing from the race car, test environments, and simulation. Understanding this data – extracting every drop of learning from it – is essential for car development and racing.
 
 
 
As a Data Visualisation Engineer, you will build on a foundation of knowledge in software development, data analysis, and visualisation techniques to develop innovative, data-driven solutions to technical challenges alongside senior members of the team. This will involve developing and supporting our internal analysis software platforms, to aid our learning from measured and simulated data. You will focus on producing innovative and performant solutions to visualising complex data in novel ways; creating intuitive, interactive user interfaces that unlock understanding and aid rapid, data-driven decision making.
 
 
 
You will work on projects through all stages of the development life cycle from initial analysis and requirements gathering through to deployment and operational support. Your work will be a mixture of longer-term development projects and operational support of the wind tunnel, simulator, and race car.
 
 
You will work in close cooperation and co-development with the other members of the team, as well as stakeholders across Engineering, in particular Aero Development, CFD and R&D. Hence, you should be comfortable both working on a project by yourself and jointly with others.
 
 
 
 
You need a keen desire to learn software development, particularly visualisation tools, following the department’s guiding principles, and a passion to use your skills to make the car faster.  Racing forges close teams. As such, we invest in our people, providing mentoring and professional development opportunities, particularly for those near the start of their careers.
 
 
 
Occasional flexibility to work out of office hours and weekends may be required. The role will be primarily based at the prestigious McLaren Technology Centre with a proportion of the time spent working from home.
 
 
 
 
Principal Accountabilities
:
 
 
 
To develop and support software tools for data analysis and visualisation in collaboration with your team
 
 
 
To work alongside engineers from across McLaren Racing to understand their workflow and challenges and translate these into ideas for bespoke data visualisation tools
 
To maintain consistent standards and approaches adopted by the team
 
To keep track of your timescales and provide regular progress reports
 




Desired Skills and Experience


Knowledge, Skills and Experience
:   


  Essential  


BSc in Computer Science or equivalent discipline (2:1 or above) or equivalent industry experience.  
High proficiency with data visualisation methods in Python and JavaScript 
Familiarity with object-oriented programming and software development best practices 
Effective communication, both written and verbal   


  Desirable   


Experience in the visualisation of complex data sets to understand underlying behaviour   
Familiarity with development of large software projects  
Experience with web frontend frameworks, such as D3 and React 
Familiarity with wireframing and other prototyping methods for lean project delivery 
Experience with SQL and document databases e.g. SQL Server and MongoDB  
Experience with Git version control 
Basic knowledge of aerodynamic theory   


 


Personal Attributes: 


Enthusiasm for engineering and science  
Ability to work to tight deadlines  
Comfortable with rapid changes to planned work 


What can McLaren offer?


We strive to provide a fun, innovative, collaborative and open culture where everyone’s input is welcome, and everyone feels part of our achievements. We work hard to create a culture of continuous improvement and support this with a proactive approach to management and personal development.


McLaren Racing is based at the iconic McLaren Technology Centre on the edge of Woking. Our large campus includes a gym, swimming pool, restaurant and indoor and outdoor break-out areas, as well as direct access to park land. MTC is connected to Woking mainline station via regular shuttle buses, from which London Waterloo is a 32min train ride.


We encourage hybrid working patterns to give you options to balance your home life and hobbies with your work, and offer a comprehensive package of benefits including private healthcare, car schemes, life insurance and generous pension contributions.
title: Data Visualisation Engineer

job_desc:
We’re a fast-moving and ambitious start-up making significant strides in the digital media space. Following the success of our latest investment round, we’re growing the teams across all parts of our business. We are building the largest global digital entertainment group.

Now we’re looking to extend our capabilities with like-minded talents that share our ambition and will take the front-row seats in the rocketship with us. We operate in a global, diverse, inclusive environment and are looking for people who are passionate about digital entertainment, put their innovative thinking into action, and are motivated to build something together that significantly disrupts the industry. We have an exciting roadmap ahead - do you want to be part of it?
 
Tasks
 
What you will be building with us - as our Data Scientist you will:
 
 
Devise and oversee data-centered projects.
Collaborate closely with the contributing teams and partners, and establish learning agendas, measurement plans, and success measures.
Analyze massive amounts of data to derive insightful findings with clear visualizations and presentations that will assist senior leadership in making decisions about strategies, products, and the business.
Grow our dashboards and make sure the data we analize is the right data to steer our business actions.
 


Requirements
 
What you add to our team:
 
 
A degree in data science, statistics, computer science, or similar.
Extensive experience (1-3 years) as a data scientist.
Proficiency in R and/or Python.
In-depth understanding of SQL.
Demonstrated history of devising and overseeing data-centered projects
Ability to relay insights in layman’s terms to help inform business decisions.
Supervision and mentorship abilities.
Capacity to foster a healthy, stimulating work environment that frequently harnesses teamwork.
Digital media industry experience
Knowledge of machine learning principles and techniques.
 


Benefits
 
We empower all our team members to develop into great entrepreneurs and to gain exceptional learnings. We have team members from Consulting, Investment Banking, Start-/ScaleUps and the Industry in our team and we are united by a joint desire to combine joy in our work with the ambition to build a global company in the shortest amount of time. If that’s the environment you could see yourself in as a leader, we are looking forward to hearing from you.
title: Data Scientist (Media) (m/f/d)

job_desc:
iPeople Solutions is currently for Data Analyst for our client based in London and surrounding areas. The successful candidate will support the transformation work aligning to key improvement strategy. The successful candidate will also support the client’s key workstreams enabling their projects to develop robust data insights that evidence the impact of key activity. Key duties & responsibilities:-Research, collation, capture, store and publish evidence and datasets to support planning and decision making across the programme workstreams.
 
The post-holder will be required to research and identify external and internal datasets that could support the objectives of the programme workstreams.
 
The post-holder will be responsible for ensuring that these datasets are captured within Client’s systems and are accessible to colleagues on demand.
 
Work with other analysts to ensure that evidence and data is joined up and shared to support better planning and decision making.
 
Liaise with stakeholders across the department and with partner organisations as well as working to ensure that systems and processes enable effective sharing and joining-up of data, subject to considerations of data protection.
 
Work with the programme leads to design key performance indicators to reflect priority outcomes and build the necessary systems and processes to capture and report against these. This will include defining and documenting new performance indicators, ensuring that responsibilities for data generation and collation are clearly understood.
 
Develop systems and processes to efficiently capture, record, validate, analyse and report data against key performance indicators for the programme.
 
The post holder will also be responsible for ensuring that the relevant systems and processes are in place for efficient and secure data capture, storage and reporting.
 
Prepare cyclical and ad-hoc performance reports for the programme board, workstreams and projects. This will include development and drafting of performance dashboards using all available tools to ensure efficient and accurate reporting.
 
Provide support, guidance, advice and challenge to the programme in improving data quality and to ensure that programme performance is maximised. Requirements:
Previous Data Analyst experience
Enhanced DBS on the update service
Good working knowledge of data extraction tools, including Business Objects, SRSS and SQL
Previous experience and working knowledge of R-Studio and Power BI
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills Working hours: 09.00- 17.00, Monday -Friday If you are interested in this position, please apply with your CV
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
A Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for managing data and analysis within Eaton. The individual will work on the development and implementation of the BI tools and analytics, communicating between upper management and the IT department and analyzing data to determine a corporation’s needs.
 
 
 
Developing and managing business intelligence solutions for the organization
Collaborating with team members for the purpose of collecting data and executing the company’s mission
Develop data collection processes
Reviewing and validating data
Oversee the deployment of data to the data warehouse
Monitor analytics and metrics results
Communicating insights to senior management and across the organization


 
 
Education level required
 
 
Maths, Economics, Statistics or other STEM degree


 
 
 
0 years


 
Technical knowledge
 
some experience with maths related coding such as:-
 
 
 
Python
R
SAS
Matlab
SQL


 
 
 
Moderate interpersonal skills
Ability to ask questions
Curiosity
Critical Thinking
Design of Experiments
Legal requirements (specific to Country)
EU working permit


 
What you will get from us
 
Eaton’s mission is to improve the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technologies and services. We provide sustainable solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic and mechanical power – more safely, more efficiently and more reliably. Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours. Eaton’s 2020 revenues were $17.9 billion, and we sell products to customers in more than 175 countries. We have approximately 85,000 employees.
 
We make work exciting, engaging and meaningful for our employees through our dedication to tackling some of the toughest power management challenges on the planet and by never losing sight of what matters. Our culture is built on a strong commitment to practicing our core values and supporting our employees with the tools they need to succeed. We pledge to always foster a diverse and inclusive environment, including inclusion resource groups that bring together employees who share a common purpose, interest or background. In the past year, our company has received top employment recognition by the Human Rights Campaign and almost fifty percent of our Board of Directors represented diverse groups. When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.
 
We have demonstrated our passion for sustainability with the recent announcement of cutting carbon emissions from the company’s operations by at least 50 percent by 2030. We are ethical, passionate, accountable, efficient, transparent and committed to learning. We are confident we can deliver on our promise to improve the quality of life and the environment because of the attributes that our employees embody.
 
We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.
 
Job: Marketing
 
Region: Europe, Middle East, Africa
 
Organization: ES EMEA Sales and Marketing Central
 
Job Level: Individual Contributor
 
Schedule: Full-time
 
Is remote work (i.e. working from home or another Eaton facility) allowed for this position?: Yes – Remote

job_desc:
Competition, regulatory and commercial disputes are increasingly resolved in the courts or by special tribunals. These require experts with the skills and competence to draft expert reports and present the quantification of damages and supporting evidence.

Punter Southall Analytics is a new organisation within the Punter Southall Group. We work with corporate clients and law firms to quantify how much they paid for the products and services they were overcharged for. Located next to Charing Cross station in the London headquarters of the Punter Southall Group, employees benefit from the first class infrastructure, support and stability of a large firm yet with a 'small team' atmosphere. This is a fully office based role.

We are currently recruiting for a talented graduate to join our team as an "Analyst". If you have a Bachelors in a quantitative subject and would like to begin a career in analytics we would like to hear from you.

As an "Analyst" you will assist quantification experts with all aspects of their job, mainly gathering historical data from primary and secondary sources as well as undertaking the administrative activities required to capture and document the provenance of the data.

For further details on the role and to see if you meet the criteria please click here.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Graduate Data Analyst

job_desc:
Our people work differently depending on their jobs and needs. From hybrid working to flexible hours , we have plenty of options that help our people to thrive.
 
This role is based in the United Kingdom and as such all normal working days must be carried out in the United Kingdom.
 
Join us as a Data Analyst
 
 
Take on a new challenge in a cutting edge data team, in which you’ll manage the analysis of complex bank, franchise or function data to identify business issues and opportunities
We’ll look to you to provide high quality analytical input to help develop and implement innovative processes and resolve problems across the bank
This is a hands on role in which you'll hone your data analysis expertise and gain valuable experience in a dynamic area of our business
 


What you'll do
 
As a Data Analyst, you'll play a key role in supporting the delivery of high quality business solutions. You’ll be performing data extraction, storage, manipulation, processing and analysis, alongside developing and performing standard queries to ensure data quality and identify data inconsistencies and missing data.
 
Day-to-day, you’ll also be:
 
 
Collecting, profiling and mapping appropriate data to use in new or existing solutions as well as for ongoing data activities
Identifying and documenting data migration paths and processes, standardising data naming, data definitions and modelling
Interpreting customer needs and turning them strategic analysis projects, functional or data requirements and process models
 
Building and maintaining collaborative partnerships with key business stakeholders
 


The skills you'll need
 
We’re looking for someone with experience of using data analysis tools and delivering data analysis in a technology or IT function. You’ll also need a strong understanding of data usage and dependencies with wider teams and the end customer, as well as a proven track record in extracting value and features from large scale data and an ability to talk to people at all levels of the business and make the complex simple.
 
We’ll also look for:
 
 
An in-depth understanding of the interrelationships of data and multiple data domains
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Strong experience in data analysis and reporting with extensive experience of Python, SQL, PowerBI or similar tooling
Proficient understanding of cloud data solutions and principles
Experience of Synapse, Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory, highly desirable
 


 
If you need any adjustments to support your application, such as information in alternative formats or special requirements to access our buildings, or if you’re eligible under the Disability Confident Scheme please contact us and we’ll do everything we can to help.
 
Apply for this job
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
We’re Dojo
 
Since launching Dojo in 2019 to address business owners’ pain points across the UK, we’ve seen incredible growth as a scaling fintech, welcoming over 60,000 new customers and growing the Dojo team to 900+ people across five locations. In that time, we’ve also introduced Dojo Virtual Queues & Bookings and the Dojo restaurant finder app, formerly known as WalkUp and loved by 600 restaurants and 600,000 diners across the UK. Find out more about the journey we’ve been on
 
.
 
Today, we work towards our mission to empower businesses to thrive in the Experience Economy by creating the tools and technology that turn transactions into meaningful relationships. For our business customers, that means fast funding, the fastest payments, smart integrations, and efficient virtual queues & bookings - all with instant insight across the board. For over 600,000 diners across the UK, that means getting seated at their favourite restaurants in just a couple of taps on the Dojo app. Whether it’s for busy business owners or hungry diners, every Dojo product is built to address real customer pain points by our dedicated teams in London, Bristol, Hull and Belfast.
 
The Role
 
This is your chance to join embed within one of our tribes to take their data-driven decision making to the next level. You will be the in-house expert on all things data - from gathering business requirements & problem statements to proactively driving solutions by taking stakeholders on a data-backed decision making journey.
 
If you’re the kind of person who loves to sit in the sweet spot of harnessing the power of data and technology, delivering rigorous scientific insights and having a direct impact on the digital landscape - this is the role for you.
 
What Will You Do…
 
 
Being customer-first is our primary ethos and you’ll be at the vanguard of this. Bringing our customers to life through data wherever decisions are being made, whether it’s participating in product refinements, working with our functional experts or presenting to our executive team.
You will own stakeholder relationships and deliver game-changing insights that drive the conversation and tribe objectives.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to define, refine, and measure KPIs which contribute to the company mission - To Empower the Experience Economy.
Craft powerful visualisations and dashboards in Looker that tell a story and empower stakeholders to self-serve with actionable insights so that we scale effectively.
 
As you acquire an in-depth understanding of one or more areas of the business, you’ll act as an expert mentor and develop and lead training and workshops to raise the standards of our utilisation of data across the company. Improve performance outcomes through the use of data and technology. You’ll be raising the bar.
 


 
What You Will Bring…
 
 
You’ve got experience with data wrangling/manipulation techniques and comfortable writing SQL queries to surface the data you need. You understand the concepts of data governance and stewardship, ensuring our sales and operations teams have access to useful and accurate data.
 
You'll have experience with Python.
You have previous exposure to Pricing analytics and/or Pricing experimentation.
You have an understanding of predictive and prescriptive analytical concepts whilst being solutions-oriented with the vision to anticipate how inefficient processes might become problematic at scale.
You’ll have the willingness to roll sleeves up - equally happy when building a hacky spreadsheet or state of the art Looker dashboard - and the foresight to know which one is appropriate.
Ability to work cross-functionally in an embedded framework. You have the expertise with technology and experience of solving product problems working alongside other experts from different domains.
You care about impact and are constantly seeking the necessary conversations to ensure that you are doing the right data analysis at the right time. You see your job as making a positive business impact, not completing tasks.


 
Our Technology Stack…
 
BigQuery / Snowflake
 
Scripting language: Python/R
 
DBT
 
Segment & Snowplow
 
Looker
 
Google Suite
 
Our values
 
At Dojo, we’re
 
curious
. We have an insatiable desire to learn and innovate. And we’re
 
relentless
. We persevere even when it’s easier not to. But, we’re nothing without our customers, who drive everything we do. From day one, Dojo was built on real customer pain points and every one of us is
 
customer-obsessed
.
 
Creating a more diverse, equitable and inclusive Dojo
 
Dojo’s 60,000+ customers reflect the diversity of the UK High Street. Building diverse teams that are representative of that to develop and deliver our business strategy is fundamental to continuing to create innovative products at Dojo. As a result, together, we achieve better outcomes for our customers and for Dojo.
 
Regardless of age, disability, race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, culture, educational background, parental status, neurodiversity or disability - whoever you are, if you’re passionate about your work, curious, relentless and customer-obsessed, we want to hear from you.
 
We pride ourselves on fostering a sense of community, which is only made stronger by each individual at Dojo, so you'll have the opportunity to meet a variety of people across levels, teams, and experiences throughout the interview process.
 
Find out more about our benefits and what it’s like to work at Dojo at
 
.
title: Insight Analyst - Growth

job_desc:
Data Analyst
 
Salary up to £45,000 per annum
 
The aim of the company is to build the UK's financial planning business - something our clients sorely need. This role helps us to do that by advancing the rejuvenation of our data gathering, analysis and reporting across the business which in turn will enable data-led decision making. We are aiming to develop a best-in-class Data & BI practice.
 
The Role
 
Gathering data from the core firms' databases and other discrete data sources. Based on the data gathered, the candidate will take responsibility for MI, data analysis, design, and production of reports for internal and external purposes and automation for these reports to be produced on a regular and ad hoc basis.
 
 
Data analyst accountabilities
 
 
 
Build first-class reports according to business specifications
Maintain the integrity of the MI Process with detailed review and data cleansing to ensure all data and reports are accurate, current, complete, and consistent
Liaise with our firms to review data related processes, suggest, and implement improvements and solutions
Provide general advice and analysis to internal business customers and develop overall business knowledge to facilitate this function
Ensure reports are completed within the specified requirements and the agreed SLAs
Regular and ad hoc reporting to satisfy external and internal customers


 
The role is hybrid, there will be need to visit either the office down in London or one of the respective regional offices at least once a month, the rest will be home working. Reporting to the Head of BI (business intelligence) will be part of the role.
 
 
Candidate Skills and Experience
 
 
The ideal candidate will have a degree or an equivalent in Mathematics or Statistics. They will need to have experience in building scalable MI/BI dashboards and reporting. Experience in reporting tools, introducing brand new systems would be needed.
 
 
 
Good stakeholder management at all levels of the business
Holds themselves to a high standard and delivers first-class solutions for both technical and non-technical users
Financial services sector experience, in particular wealth planning, a distinct advantage
Creativity, analytical and problem-solving skills


Proven ability to execute in a busy, high growth environment
Proven judgement and the ability to provide clear recommendations on complex matters
Excellent communication skills
Strong team player


 
 
Technical Skills
 
 
PowerBI (business information & analytics)
Python with associated libraries for Data Analysis, Web Scraping, Excel Integration and Automation (ideal, but not required)
Microsoft Power Automate
Excel


 
 
Benefits
 
 
A high growth business with a devoted and spirited team. This role is a key member of the team, giving the opportunity to learn in an exciting environment and to shape the growth of a new brand in one of the UK's most important industries.
 
 
Competitive salary and offers performance-based bonus schemes, staff share scheme, health care, other benefits, and 25 days' holiday.
 
To Apply
 
To apply for the position of Data Analyst, please send your CV to Joseph Bailey via the Apply Now button.
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
London & Partners is the business growth and destination agency for London. Our mission is to create economic growth that is resilient, sustainable and inclusive. 


We are a social enterprise, combining purpose with commercial rigour. We are funded by grants, partners and our portfolio of commercial ventures. 


We support high-growth businesses to scale – both international businesses expanding into the UK and London-based businesses growing internationally. We develop London as a destination and attract visitors and events. We grow London’s global reputation to support economic growth. We create partnerships and profit-making ventures that enable us to scale our impact. 


The International Scale Up Programme aims to support high growth London based companies to internationalise, enable aspiring exporters to prepare for internationalisation and support bespoke cohorts in different themes to scale their businesses. This could include specific sub sectors such as low carbon or themes such as underrepresented Founders. 


This programme will act as a single front door for companies who have global growth ambitions. 
 
Purpose of role
 


Working closely with the Programme Manager (Events) and wider delivery team to support planning and delivery of programme content for scale ups expanding into new international markets.
 
Key Tasks
 


Curate and deliver core programme content via face-to-face, hybrid and digital events such as workshops, office hours, networking sessions, and peer-to-peer activities.
Support the delivery of large-scale events including cohort launches across the Directorate.
Support the creation, communication and promotion of the core workstream content.
Support to develop and maintain an engaging content strategy to manage and nurture the cohort companies. Primarily through the planning, editing and coordination of content for a variety of digital communication channels including, social media, newsletters, case studies and peer-to-peer connections.
Support to service the Programme’s Partners and Mentor Network, including communication with a diverse range of stakeholders.
Maintain digital platforms used to support the operational execution of the Programme such as DocuSign, Eventbrite, Zoom, Salesforce and other platforms or applications.
Support with collection and collation of data and feedback to evaluate and enhance the support provided across the Programme.
Working closely with the marketing team to support the preparation and production of collateral and resources to facilitate the promotion and engagement of everything the Programme has to offer.
Working closely with the compliance team to maintain records as per grant guidelines including data collection for client activities, project reporting and feedback collection and collation.
Deliver ad hoc operational and administrative support for the wider team.


 
You’ll have/bring


Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Creative ability to devise engaging communication strategies
Experience of project-based work
Ability to interact with a diverse range of stakeholders.
Process driven with ability to work independently
Ability to use Microsoft Office.
An interest in economic development in London and an ability to pick up new subject areas quickly.
Experience of social media management and using digital communications or online platforms such as Salesforce, Eventbrite and Zoom would be valuable.
Knowledge of grant funded programmes and experience of working with SMEs and/ or startups would be valuable.
 
 
You’ll Get 
 


To join a fast paced, flexible and inclusive social enterprise
Hybrid working environment
30 days’ holiday in addition to UK public holidays 
Excellent employer pension contribution and private medical health insurance
 
Disclaimer: due to the high volume of applications we receive, we reserve the right to close a vacancy earlier than the advertised date. This is to ensure our teams can manage application levels while maintaining a positive candidate experience. Once a vacancy has closed, we are unable to consider further applications, so please submit your application as soon as possible to avoid disappointment.


London's diversity is its biggest asset. At London & Partners, we aim to ensure our workforce reflects the diversity of the city that we promote. We encourage applications from people of any age, gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation or assignment, faith or disability. We also appreciate that many people require flexibility in their working patterns and encourage you to talk to us at interview about any flexibility you may need, be it full-time, job-share, or part-time. 


If you need to receive this information and/or apply in an alternative format, please contact London & Partners by emailing rcorley@londonandpartners.com to discuss how we can help. 


We encourage applications from all sections of the community.
title: Events Executive - International Trade

job_desc:
EnergyPulse Analyst
Permanent – £28,000 to £32,000

Hybrid working plus competitive benefits

RenewableUK is the UK’s leading renewable energy trade association, specialising in onshore wind, offshore wind, wave & tidal energy and investing in green hydrogen technologies. We have an established, large corporate membership ranging from small independent companies, to large international corporations and manufacturers. Our role is to bring members together to deliver a clean electricity future which is better for the industry, the supply chain, consumers, and the environment.
 
We are a team of 50 who share a passion to contribute to a cleaner, greener, better future and would like to welcome a EnergyPulse Analyst/Researcher who can also be a part of helping our industry’s efforts to achieve net zero carbon use. This role will have a data & market intelligence focus and the opportunity to be involved in other areas of commercial and policy support to support RenewableUK in delivering a first class service to our members.

Our EnergyPulse Analyst will work closely with the Information Manager and EnergyPulse Team to ensure timely and accurate data and analytical outputs are maintained and best serve the needs of EnergyPulse users. The role will include researching key project and organisational information in the growing UK energy storage, onshore wind, and wider green hydrogen and offshore wind sectors; inputting data accurately into the EnergyPulse database; cross referencing and auditing data with other sources, producing bespoke analysis where necessary and recommending improvements to the provision of information and intelligence services; supporting the production of EnergyPulse insights, forecasts and dashboards; exploring leads and promoting EnergyPulse via online demonstrations or in person attendance of events & conferences; as well as assisting the wider Commercial Team with other ad hoc duties.

We are seeking a highly organised person who has a passion for data and its application, for renewable energy, and with the ability to work accurately and has excellent attention to detail. This is a great opportunity for someone who is keen to learn and develop their career working in a dynamic influential organisation in the renewables.

If this sounds like you and you would like the opportunity to make a real difference... to see the full job description, please get in touch. Application is by CV and a covering letter detailing why you consider yourself to be an ideal candidate. 

Please send to Jobs@RenewableUK.com If you have any queries, please contact Rhys Thomas at Rhys.Thomas@RenewableUK.com.

Closing date for receipt of applications: 23rd February 2023
Interviews from 7th March 2023.

RenewableUK values diversity and inclusion in all its employment practices and welcomes applications from anyone who meets the role and person specification requirements.
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Data Analytics Consultant
Salary: Up to £48,000 (+ bonus + bens)
Location: UK (Fully Remote)
 
About
This amazing opportunity is working for one of the global leading data companies supporting their clients across multiple industries including: Retail, Media and FMCG Manufacturers. They are looking to expand their data analytics team and seeking the skills and experience of a Data Analytics Consultant with a strong background in ‘Market Mix Modelling’ (MMM). The key purpose of the role will be to evaluate Media ROI whilst working with a highly effective team in the UK.
 
 
The Role
As a Data Analytics Consultant you will be working in a team to support contracted and ad hoc services to the clients. You will be responsible for managing projects from the initial sign off to the delivery of reports and results to the client.
 
Main Responsibilities:
 
 
Responsible for the initial set up, implementation, analysis and delivery of analytical projects using A/B testing, attribution and Marketing Mix delivering insight and recommendations for the clients future campaigns.
Working in a small team who different levels to develop subject matter expertise in the process and delivery of our media solutions.
Managing projects, end-to-end.
Liaise with media agencies and owners of companies to collect data for analysis.
Quality checking modelling outputs and providing feedback to the modelling team.
Making insightful recommendations to the client after interpreting modelling teams results.


 
 
Requirements:
 
 
Must have experience within Marketing Mix Modelling to evaluate Media ROI.
Must have experience working with a Media Company/Client
Understanding of Market strategy, and/or FMCG Business trends.
Knowledge of types of analytical principles such as A/B Testing, Multi-Touch attribution and Marketing Mix.
Strong analytical, strategic thinking skills.
An individual who is a collaborative team player, highly motivated and works well in high pressure situations.
Ability to manage large accounts, and confident with liaising/presenting to clients.
Strong skills in Excel.


 
 
If this role is of interest to you then please send your up to date CV
title: Data Analytics Consultant

job_desc:
Marketing & Data Analyst
 
About Gumtree
Our purpose is to make good finds happen, whether that’s finding the right buyer for your vintage collectibles or finding a local upholsterer to breathe new life into your sofa.
 
As a company we are on a mission to help people trade locally by making buying and selling
 
simpler, safer and more enjoyable, because we believe everything can find a new purpose (that’s good for you and the planet).
 
Role Outline
 
 
We are looking for an experienced and enthusiastic Marketing & Data Analyst to support the Gumtree Marketing proposition, ensuring we are reporting the impacts of our marketing as effectively and as accurately as possible. You will report to the Senior BI Analyst with a dedicated focus to our talented Marketing Team.

 The role will support the enablement of accurate, easy and timely data driven decision-making. Working with stakeholders and the wider teams to generate insights from our in-house data, identify new opportunities and actionable insights across the various marketing channels.
 
The role of Marketing & Data Analyst will define, monitor, interpret and adjust marketing metrics together with relevant stakeholders and make recommendations as needed to ensure we are optimising campaigns effectively and driving overall marketing effectiveness. Supporting the A&R (Paid / CRM) and Brand team with tracking, reporting and campaign evaluation through robust reporting, attribution modelling real time dashboards and econometric modelling. 

 The role will also be required to support on market and competitor insight and analysis, supporting the team strategically with longer term marketing initiatives. 

 This role acts as Marketing's voice, working closely with stakeholders to communicate effectively the contribution marketing makes to business performance (vibrancy and revenue), communicating activities, successes and strategy to the wider company, as well as managing questions on performance and ROI.
 
You will be well versed in the marketing landscape, and have the ability to connect different data sources for a 360 view of marketing performance. You will understand the balance between long and short term marketing and the full funnel mix.
 
Core Responsibilities
 
 
Provide analytical insight to channel specialists across the team, with the aim of improving performance, this includes creation and management of dashboards as well as analysis


Determine the best way for Marketing to track performance across all channels, and build out the required models and resources to achieve this (attribution and econometric modelling)
Forecast performance and key metrics
Help design, run and interpret campaign and channel tests
Understand the Gumtree audience and the key customer journeys to feed back insights to Marketing and Product
Understand and help measure the market, competitor performance & future trends
 


Skills / Experience Required
 
 
Previous experience as a Marketing Analyst working with a diverse set of marketing channels including SEM, CRM, marketing attribution, brand marketing, content marketing and conversion optimization
Solid skills and hands on experience in data retrieval and analysis of complex data sets (e.g. SQL, R or Python)
Previous experience in attribution/mmm/econometric modelling
Experience around visualisation & dashboard design with a focus on business stakeholders needs (e.g. Tableau, Looker, Google Data Studio)
Knowledge of and the challenges of attribution in a modern ecosystem
Strong analytical skills
 
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to translate concepts for both technical and non-technical audiences
Experience with conducting competitive research and analysing benchmarking data is an advantage


Perks
Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, we offer a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs.
 
That's why we're pleased to offer all employees full access to our comprehensive benefits package.
 
This includes:
 
 
25 days holiday per year increasing with length of service. 🏖️
Company bonus scheme. 💷
Private health insurance. 🏥
Private dental insurance. 🦷
Income protection policy. 💰
Conference & education budget. 🏫
Remote / Hybrid / Office based working available* 💻
title: Marketing & Data Analyst

Sodexo Benefits and Rewards Services (BRS)
, entity of Sodexo, we’re inventing entirely new ways to influence and enrich the lives of employees worldwide. We bring to life
 
benefit platforms and payment solutions to level up the quality of life at work to our 440,000 clients and 36 million of their employees in 31 countries.

SQL
.
-Statistical modelling techniques with
 
Python
.
-Design of dashboards in

(storytelling).

A meaningful job: build the future of employee benefits and contribute to the quality of life at work for others, you will impact positively local communities too. It counts!

Working at BRS is joining a multicultural team that moves as one. It’s also a place where your individual ideas, perspectives, and input count. Put a part of yourself into the future of employee benefits and meaningfully contribute to lives and communities worldwide.
 
– be the change. Let’s go above and beyond.

job_desc:
We’re a fast-moving and ambitious start-up making significant strides in the digital media space. Following the success of our latest investment round, we’re growing the teams across all parts of our business. We are building the largest global digital entertainment group.

Now we’re looking to extend our capabilities with like-minded talents that share our ambition and will take the front-row seats in the rocketship with us. We operate in a global, diverse, inclusive environment and are looking for people who are passionate about digital entertainment, put their innovative thinking into action, and are motivated to build something together that significantly disrupts the industry. We have an exciting roadmap ahead - do you want to be part of it?
 
Tasks
 
What you will be building with us - as our Data Scientist you will:
 
 
Devise and oversee data-centered projects.
Collaborate closely with the contributing teams and partners, and establish learning agendas, measurement plans, and success measures.
Analyze massive amounts of data to derive insightful findings with clear visualizations and presentations that will assist senior leadership in making decisions about strategies, products, and the business.
Grow our dashboards and make sure the data we analize is the right data to steer our business actions.
 


Requirements
 
What you add to our team:
 
 
A degree in data science, statistics, computer science, or similar.
Extensive experience (1-3 years) as a data scientist.
Proficiency in R and/or Python.
In-depth understanding of SQL.
Demonstrated history of devising and overseeing data-centered projects
Ability to relay insights in layman’s terms to help inform business decisions.
Supervision and mentorship abilities.
Capacity to foster a healthy, stimulating work environment that frequently harnesses teamwork.
Digital media industry experience
Knowledge of machine learning principles and techniques.
 


Benefits
 
We empower all our team members to develop into great entrepreneurs and to gain exceptional learnings. We have team members from Consulting, Investment Banking, Start-/ScaleUps and the Industry in our team and we are united by a joint desire to combine joy in our work with the ambition to build a global company in the shortest amount of time. If that’s the environment you could see yourself in as a leader, we are looking forward to hearing from you.
title: Media Data Scientist (m/f/d)

, 37.5 hours per week, Monday to Friday between
