title: Data Coordinator

job_desc:
Location: Icon 1, M90 5AA
 
About THG
 
THG is a fast-moving, global technology business that specialises in taking brands direct to consumers. Our world-class proprietary tech and infrastructure powers our extensive portfolio of beauty, nutrition and lifestyle brands and is now helping drive exponential growth of our clients’ brands globally.
We’re powered by a global team of over 10,000 ambitious people around the world. Our culture is fast-paced and entrepreneurial, it’s this DNA that has supported our incredible growth.
We’re always looking for individuals that can bring fresh and innovative thinking to THG, and play a part in driving the group forward on its exciting journey. So, if you’re ready to take the next big step in your career, challenge yourself every day and evolve with the world around you, THG is ready for you.
 
About Central Functions
 
Central Functions is formed of the teams and people that serve the entire business. These people are integral to the smooth running of the business; ensuring everyone is paid on time, that materials are sourced and arrive promptly, that we meet our legal obligations and that our health, safety, and security is safeguarded.
 
About Operational Excellence
 
Operational Excellence at THG delivers world-class Operations Transformation across the nutrition division and the wider group, identifying and implementing operational efficiencies and enabling global growth.
 
Reporting to the Business Analytics Manager, the Data Analyst - Operations will be responsible for interpreting data to inform wider stakeholders of how the business is doing, providing an insight into processes and identifying where improvements could be made. The post holder will be a recent graduate, and the role will be suited to those who have a background in mathematics, statistics or related subject in which the interpretation and analysis of data is required.
 
Responsibilities:
 
Analysing global operations KPIs – such as warehouse utilisation and allocation
Building bespoke automated reports/alerts to empower colleagues with data
Developing forecasting models to aid outbound demand planning
Working collaboratively across all of THG’s divisions and problem solving from a helicopter approach
Maintaining and owning existing data pipelines/dashboards and ensuring it’s accuracy
Lead ad-hoc projects to optimize operational processes
Perform root-cause analyses on key problem areas
Serve as a data expert to successfully support operational needs


 
Requirements:
 
Graduate in mathematics, statistics, business or related subject - Undergraduate or Masters
Proficient with SQL (preferred)
Experience with data visualisation software (Tableau/Looker/PowerBI) – preferred
Experience with programming languages (Python/R) – advantageous
Able to communicate effectively; using data to tell a story and drive business change


 
Benefits:
 
Competitive salary
Onsite Doctor
Employee discounts
Gym Discounts
Company bonus scheme
Company pension scheme


 
THG is proud to be a Disability Confident Committed employer. If you are invited to interview, please let us know if there are any reasonable adjustments we can make to the recruitment process that will enable you to perform to the best of your ability.
 
Because of the high volumes of applications our opportunities attract, it sometimes takes us time to review and consider them all. We endeavour to respond to every application we receive within 14 days. If you haven't heard from us within that time frame or should you have any specific questions about this or other applications for positions at THG please contact one of our Talent team to discuss further.
 
THG is committed to creating a diverse & inclusive environment and hence welcomes applications from all sections of the community.
title: Data Analyst - Operations

job_desc:
Date: 08-Feb-2023
 
City: London
 
Hours: Full Time
 
Job function: Data Engineering
 
Overview Of The Role
 
 
The Data and Technology Strategy team sits at the core of our infrastructure and consists of three key pillars: MarTech, Data Operations and Data Visualisation & Reporting.
 
Through our application of advanced technology solutions, we ensure efficiency of operational processes. This creates the foundations for effective work for our clients and ensures our teams capture and analyse all appropriate data points at both the macro and micro levels, which in turn drives performance.
 
The data visualisation team is responsible for delivering all reporting requirements across all government departments to the highest standards at all times.
 


 
You will be required to:
 
 
Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to define specific reporting requirements, managing all steps of the delivery process and communicate with relevant stakeholders accordingly
Configure relevant data streams via API or custom connectors, apply any data cleansing as needed, ensure Parent/Child data streams are configured accurately.
 
Fully understand the tagging requirements to ensure data is set up in a way that allows for easy and accurate visualisation.
 


 
We want you to:
 
 
Have knowledge of grouping, manipulating and analysing large data sets from a variety of sources and be able to transform relevant data into meaningful, clear and accessible reporting.
 
Apply a structured approach to planning and delivering reporting requirements to agreed scope and timelines.
 
Have knowledge of data visualisation platforms such as datorama or tableau and be able to apply advanced Microsoft Excel and data analysis techniques.
 
Demonstrate the 4 core MGOMD values throughout your work- ensuring progressive work through being inquisitive, brave, and imaginative.
 


 
What You Can Expect
 
 
Flexible working
27 days holiday + Bank holidays and option to buy or sell
Full range of benefits including Bupa, Pension Life assurance, Eyecare, Gym membership
Subsidised food and drink in our 7th floor canteen


 
D&I statement
 
 
At OMG, our vision is to be an agency where difference is valued and everyone is able to thrive in a culture of equality, inclusion and belonging. We are committed to providing a truly inclusive environment that reflects today’s society, where everyone is able to bring their true selves to work, and where diverse voices and backgrounds are valued, heard, and well-represented.
 
Be Your Best Statement
 
We want everyone to make the most of the opportunity to shine and showcase your talents and we are happy to make adjustments in the recruitment process so you can be your best. Please discuss any specific requirements with your dedicated Talent Attraction team member or if you would feel more comfortable, you can email us confidentially at beyourbest@omnicommediagroup.com to let us know how we can support you.
 
We will process your personal data in accordance with our Recruitment Privacy Notice which is available on www.omgukcareers.com
title: Data Intelligence and Visualisation Manager

job_desc:
We have a fantastic opportunity for an Assistant Data Analyst to join our Data & Analytics team to support analytics across the company. The team are responsible for managing and operating the new strategic cloud-based data platform. This platform is built on the Microsoft Azure platform utilising services including Power BI and Azure Synapse.

The Assistant Data Analyst role is a hands-on role, capturing business requirements and understand the underlying data, and proposing innovative solutions to help the business think differently and tap into value previous inaccessible.

Youll be in a team with other data analysts and data engineers of varying experience levels and provided the opportunity to learn.
 
We are looking for you to have a passion for problem-solving, understating data and telling a story with the result. Experience with Power BI and Excel visualisation and data manipulation skills are highly desirable.

Ideally you will have a degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, information management, or similar experience.

To be successful in this role you will be collaborative and organised with the ability to learn analytical programming languages.
 
Key Accountabilities will include:
 
Completing Data analysis

Building reports and dashboards

Problem solving

Business engagement

Data modelling and measure definition

In-life support and incident resolution

We value each employee as an individual and offer flexible and competitive packages to support that.
 
Being a family-owned business means we understand and value long term relationships. We are community minded, and our work is guided by inspiring better ways of creating the places, communities, and businesses of tomorrow.

Its our people who make Wates successful. We will only achieve our strategic objectives if we recruit and retain the best people and operate in an environment underpinned by inclusivity, diversity, and opportunity.

We offer industry-leading family friendly and flexible working opportunities that reflect the changing expectations of talent and enable you to manage personal and professional commitments as part of a balanced and healthy lifestyle.

As a responsible and inclusive employer, offering equal opportunities, we are proud to have been recognised through our Investors in People Gold accreditation and Disability Confident Leaders certification.

So, if youd like to work for an inclusive organisation which invests in you and your continued career development, and youre looking for your next challenge, wed like to hear from you.

(Please note that candidates represented by Agencies will not be considered at this time).
title: Assistant Data Analyst

job_desc:
The opportunity
 
CUBE is a vibrant RegTech business defining and implementing the gold standard of regulatory intelligence and change for the financial services industry. We deliver our services through a SaaS platform powered by an innovative combination of AI and proprietary data ontology classification.
 
We are creating the future and are a company rooted in technology, so we embrace that technology across our working practices which are rooted in strong values, team spirit and commitment to our customers and wider communities.
 
We serve some of the largest financial institutions globally and are expanding our footprint very fast. As we do so, we are keen for new talent to join us and realize their full potential to grow into leadership positions within the business
 
Role summary
 
You will be responsible for the analysis, reporting and data processing of automatically captured global regulatory data changes within our flagship product. Working alongside the rest of the publishing team, you will assist in the reporting and alerting to ensure we are adhering in all instances to our internal SLAs.
 
Location
 
London, remote. With travel to team meetings bi-weekly.
 
Responsibilities
 
 
Collect, compile and monitor data from different sources for example Databases, Spreadsheets and Reports.
Perform database queries across multiple tables to extract data for analysis.
Create reports of issues and resolutions, which will then be shared across the company in daily meetings.
Perform routine statistical analyses and ad-hoc queries.
Use a range of analytical techniques such as data mining, time series forecasting and modelling techniques to identify and predict trends and patterns in data.
Assist with the production and monitoring of performance dashboards and reports.
Assist with data quality checking and cleansing.
Apply the tools and techniques for data analysis, data visualisation and presentation.
Assist with the production of a range of ad-hoc and standard data analysis reports.
Manipulate and link different data sets as required.
Interpret and apply the organisations data and information security standards, policies and procedures to data management activities.
Summarise and present the results of data analysis to a range of stakeholders making recommendations.
Working within the Publishing Team alongside the Publishing Lead and another Data Analyst carrying out investigation and research, and delivering results to other teams across the wider company.


 
Skills
 
Required
 
 
Excellent research and analysis skills, with an ability to analyse and interpret large datasets and granular information
Clear communication skills
Microsoft Office application skills, with an emphasis on using advanced Excel functions
Database and reporting skills
An understanding of electronic resources, newsfeeds, and databases
Ability to observe strict confidentiality
Proven team skills in a previous position
Proven track record of delivering results within a set timeframe


 
Desirable
 
 
Familiarity with Regulatory Compliance, Financial Services, or previous experience in FinTech/RegTech
Computer Science/Data Analyst experience
Working knowledge of additional languages besides English (UK)
Experience working remotely in a global team


 
Qualities
 
 
Quick learner, with experience showing previous positions where unfamiliar processes had to be learned on the job
‘Research and investigative mindset’, with an eye for detail and consistency
Clear communicator, able to tailor explanations to fit different audience expectations


 
What working at CUBE offers
 
We offer a competitive package including pension, private health, a supportive work-from-home policy and the opportunity to join a rapidly expanding global business delivering cutting-edge technology.
 
 
25 days holiday (1 company nominated)
Pension
Group Life Assurance
Medicash plan
Private Medical
Design Your Home Office Equipment
PCHO (Laptop equipment)


 
About CUBE
 
CUBE was founded in 2011 and since then has provided global organizations with an automated solution to manage regulatory updates and requirements powered by artificial intelligence with options for full integration into other systems.
 
CUBE is growing rapidly with offices in the UK, USA and Australia, serving customers across top-tier global banks, insurers and asset managers in over 180 countries. Recently listed in the “Top 100 RegTech Companies of 2022”, CUBE is pioneering the development of automated machine compliance.
title: Data Analyst – Global Delivery Operations

job_desc:
Company Description
 
This role is available for both Remote and or Hybrid working in the United Kingdom
 
Hello, we're UW
 
We’re a bunch of great people working together, solving problems and having fun. Together, we strive to find solutions to help the great people around us get on with the things that really matter in life.
 
How?
 
It’s simple, we take the headache out of essential home services by providing them all in one place – energy, broadband, mobile, and even insurance. That’s one provider, one account, one bill, and lots of savings.

We’re a truly unique FTSE 250 company with a business model that has real social impact at the heart of it. Being a part of the UW community you’ll join a working environment like no other - one where everyone matters - be it our customers, our partners or you, our people.
 
About The Role
 
We are looking to recruit a Data Analyst to join the Digital Experience - Lifecycle capability in the Customer Experience Data Team. Reporting to the CX Data Analyst Lead, the role will play a key role in shaping lifecycle management in the business in close collaboration with Product and Marketing Managers, Developers, Data Engineers and Data Scientists.

This role requires hands-on activities and is fully embedded in delivering technical solutions.

You will have the opportunity to explore and address critical questions like:
 
 
How can we help customers to manage their accounts conveniently using their preferred digital channels?
How can we increase satisfaction and digital usage?
How can we reduce business costs by lowering call propensity?
 


What You'll Do
 
 
Work within the Customer Experience Team to align the customer journey and create recommendations for decision-making and operational efficiencies, shaping the product roadmap for the Lifecycle team.
Work within a domain team to analyse data, evaluate results, generate actionable insights and recommendations (including experiments) and deliver these to colleagues and data users
Set up new data models and automated reporting and dashboards in Looker to empower business teams to monitor the impact of their work.
Apply your expertise in quantitative analytics to understand drivers of risk and suggest strategies to mitigate them
 


About You
 
 
Experience in data analytics (exploratory and descriptive analysis)
 
Strong SQL and data modelling skills
Experience in data storytelling with strong visualisation skills (previous experience using Looker is a plus)
Ability to manage the time to produce high-quality work with deadlines
Great interpersonal and stakeholder management skills
Excellent communication and writing skills
Previous experience in CX, CRM or Product Analytics is preferred but not essential.
Ability to write code in Python or other languages commonly used to process data is a plus
 


Whats In It For You
 
Join a high growth FTSE 250 business with an ambition to grow our customer base to over 1 million over the next 4 years. Help us achieve our ambitions whilst learning and having fun. Become part of a fantastic business culture where people really are at the heart of everything we do.
 
 
Huge opportunities for exposure & development as we scale up.
Competitive salary including share options
25 days holiday plus Bank Holidays
Life Insurance up to 4 x your salary
Discounted healthcare & medical cash plans
A free virtual GP service
Private pension scheme
Share options and Save As You Earn Scheme
A range of Health & Wellbeing benefits including a confidential Employee Assistance Programme, virtual fitness classes and wellness tools
Discounted UW services (30% mobile & broadband, 10% energy & insurance)
A UW cashback card - earning you cashback on all your spending!
 


Apply here!
 
If you think this is the role for you and want to be part of UW’s extraordinary growth, apply now.
 
Additional Information
 
We provide equal opportunities, a diverse and inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone. You are welcome to apply no matter your age, disability, gender, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity status, race, religion or belief, or sexual orientation.

Please note, if you are applying for a role which involves having access to personal data, you will be subject to a background check. Where checks are unsatisfactory or incomplete and/or a failure to reveal information relating to convictions that you are required to identify as part of the background checks, could lead to withdrawal of an offer of employment.
title: Data Analyst (DEX - Lifecycle)

job_desc:
Job Title: HR & Payroll Data Analyst
 
Location: UK - Remote
 
Salary: £60,000

Contract: 6 month FTC to Perm
 
We are looking for an experienced HR & Payroll Data Analyst to join an established Accountancy firm, based in the UK. The primary purpose of the role is to provide accurate and effective analysis, reports, and data solutions to the companys HR and payroll teams.
 
The HR & Payroll Data Analyst will be responsible for collecting, analysing, and interpreting data, and providing reports and data solutions to the HR and payroll teams. The HR & Payroll Data Analyst will be responsible for conducting data audits, monitoring and benchmarking data trends, and creating data dashboards and reports. The role requires a technical understanding of HR and payroll processes, as well as an in-depth knowledge of data analysis.
 
Collect, analyse, and interpret data from the HR and payroll departments.

Conduct data audits and perform data validations.

Monitor and benchmark data trends and make recommendations for improvements.

Develop data solutions, dashboards, and reports for HR and payroll teams.

Identify and resolve data discrepancies.

Assist with the preparation of management reports.

Work with HR and payroll teams to develop data solutions.

Keep up to date with industry trends and best practices.
 
Bachelors degree in a relevant field.
 
In-depth knowledge of HR and payroll processes.

Proven experience in data analysis.

Excellent problem-solving skills.

Strong organisational and communication skills.

Proficient in Microsoft Office.

Knowledge of SQL and Tableau is desirable.

If you are interested in this role, please apply for immediate consideration and interview, and to receive further details about the role.
 
JGA Recruitment Group Ltd
("We") are committed to equality of opportunity for all applications regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships.
 
We are also committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. We are a specialist Payroll and HR recruitment agency and recruitment business as defined in the Employment Agencies and Employment Businesses Regulations 2003 (our business).
 
These statements together with our privacy notices set out the basis on which any personal data we collect from you, or that you provide to us, will be processed by us.
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Description
 
At award winning company AXA Health, we are passionate about helping all our customers be the best version of themselves. That applies to our employees too! We are excited to be launching our Level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship programme within the Digital and Data area of AXA Health. 

Within our digital transformation, our use of data is crucial. AXA Health is striving towards data-driven decision making and action at all levels, and we are helping to achieve this. We need to leverage our data, empowering our workforce and partners to use and treat data as an asset to drive decision making, support prioritisation and enable fast-paced delivery of products and services that benefits our customers

In addition, we need to manage our data with appropriate controls, governance, accountabilities and oversight, in order to ensure regulatory, legal and policy compliance and drive improvements in the availability and quality of data.

Along with our government approved technical training provider, you will be supported by, and work alongside, experienced Analysts to learn core analysis, modelling and data interpretation skills. To supplement your learning, you'll have the fantastic opportunity to rotate around our teams spending time supporting both business-as-usual activities and also getting involved with project team deliveries that take us closer to meeting our Digital transformation ambitions.
 
What you will be doing:
 
 
You will work internally, and with wider AXA Health stakeholders, to identify how data can solve business problems and contribute to end-to-end solutions from requirements gathering, getting data and turning this into business insights.
 
You will contribute to the design, creation, execution and maintenance of policies, guidance and wider solutions that help drive data led decision making and comply with relevant data legislation.
 
Become familiar with data regulations and ensure data is appropriately stored and archived, in line with relevant legislation e.g. GDPR
 
Develop data modelling skills to create data models in-line with business requirements across multiple transactional and analytical use cases and domains.
 
Support the development of dashboards and reports in the Visualisation and Model Building Phase.
 


At AXA we’re adopting a Hybrid way of working, empowering our people to balance their time between home and our office in a way that works best for them, their team and our customers. For this role, you will be expected in one of our AXA Health offices for collaborative working on an ad hoc basis.
 
Working Hours & Shift Pattern:
 
Full time, 37.5 hours per week, Monday to Friday. Due to the nature of your learning pathway, we’re unable to fulfil part-time or flexible work patterns.
 
Induction & Training:
 
When you join us, you'll have 4 - 6 weeks of training, having the opportunity to meet and observe your team, attend external meetings, all whilst learning about our products and services as you go.

This apprenticeship is all about maximizing your potential. You’ll be working with Insurance professionals providing you with every opportunity to thrive. If you put in the hard work, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to further your career with AXA, as earlier apprentices have all done. This will include the chance to study for more advanced qualifications.
 
This position will commence in September 2023, and interviews will be carried out at the end of April/ Start of May 2023.
 
Qualifications
 
Education Requirements:
 
 
3 A Levels (or equivalent) at grades A*-C in any subject but preferably one in a numerical or computing subject (e.g., maths, Science, Computer Science etc.)
 
In AXA Health, we value your potential, so we will also consider applications from those with a more diverse range of qualifications who are passionate about pursuing a career as a Software Test Engineer and committed to completing the Level 4 apprenticeship in Software Testing.
 
Apprentices without level 2 English and maths will need to achieve this level prior to taking the End-Point Assessment.
 
For those with an education, health and care plan or a legacy statement, the apprenticeship’s English and Maths minimum requirement is Entry Level 3.
 
A British Sign Language (BSL) qualification is an alternative to the English qualification for those whose primary language is BSL.
 


All applicants must reside in England to be eligible for the Government apprenticeship funding

To be eligible for this apprenticeship you must reside or spend 50% of your working time in England, and been a resident in the UK, the British Overseas Territories, or Crown Dependencies (Channel Islands and Isle of Man) for at least the previous three years before the start of the apprenticeship.

Due to the number of applications we expect to receive for this role, we reserve the right to close this advert earlier than the listed closing date to ensure we’re able to effectively manage interest. Therefore, if you’re interested in joining us at AXA, please don’t hesitate to apply.
 
What We Offer
 
One of the best things about joining AXA is our rewards package. At AXA UK, we’re appreciative of the people who work for us and our rewards package is reviewed regularly to reflect that. You can expect to receive:
 
 
Accredited apprenticeship qualification
Competitive annual salary up to £26,000
Annual company & performance-based bonus
Contributory pension scheme (up to 12% employer contributions)
Life Assurance (up to 10 x annual salary)
25 days annual leave plus Bank Holidays
Opportunity to buy up to 5 extra days leave or sell up to 3 days leave
AXA employee discounts
Gym benefits
 


Our ambition is to become one of the most inspiring companies to work for, as such we’re committed to supporting employee needs, providing meaningful career development and celebrating differences. We understand that everyone has individual work and home life responsibilities, therefore we’re happy to discuss flexible working arrangements for this role, should this be a requirement for you. We look for candidates with the right skills and values to join us and selection is based on a fair and equal process. As a regulated financial services company, all successful candidates will be subject to preemployment checks. We’re committed to providing equal opportunities for all, therefore we welcome and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. As a disability confident employer, we’re pleased to offer our support and access to the AXA Accessibility Concierge should you require an alternative method of applying or any reasonable adjustments to be made during the recruitment process.

To apply, click ‘Apply Now’ and you’ll be able to upload your profile/CV from there. If you’d like to discuss this role further or would like to engage with our Accessibility Concierge, please send an email to emma.watson@axa-uk.co.uk
 
About AXA
 
With a presence in over 60 countries, and 165,000 employees serving the needs of 107 million customers, AXA is big.

But never too big to care for every single person who works here. So when you join us, we promise to put our collective might behind you and your career.

You’ll work in an open and supportive environment where you’ll be developed, challenged and encouraged to move around to achieve even bigger and better things – nationally and internationally. You’ll learn directly from senior leaders, from the best in our business. And you’ll enjoy real responsibility, really early on.

Every large company today talks about supporting diversity and inclusion. But at AXA UK, these values form an integral part of everything we do. For us, it’s about bringing together the best talent, helping people to realise their full potential by being 100% themselves at work and delivering outstanding service to everyone – regardless of difference.

AXA Health is the UK healthcare specialist for the AXA Group. Whatever our customers’ health goals, we help them get there. That could be getting someone physio for an injury that’s holding them back, or finding them the right specialist to take their treatment forward. Our team are experts in their fields: from experienced cancer nurses to pioneering data analysts; from our highly respected customer service team to our wide-ranging in-house team of clinicians. We all work together to be the best we can be.
title: Apprentice Data Analyst

job_desc:
Overview:
The Data Operations Associate serves as the intermediary between Measurabl clients and external data providers and provides support by communicating between the two parties and troubleshooting and rectifying data transmission errors.
 
Essential Functions & Responsibilities:
The essential functions and responsibilities for this position include, but are not limited to, the following. Other duties may be assigned as needed.
 
Data Management
 
Assist with the review of Utility data to ensure the information in data migration meets the quality and content requirements
Perform or support other team members with Utility data cleansing, data audit, or data validation
Support the communication between Measurabl clients and external data providers by transmitting information between the two parties
Support daily, weekly and monthly processes & reporting around data feed functionality, data quality, and feed issue resolution
Support the data operations team in being the primary point of contact for our data vendors for tickets pertaining to account activations, issue resolutions, and data errors
Support data integrity and identify bugs that arise and notify appropriate departments to ensure resolution
Assist in documenting the best practices pertaining to Utility Sync


 
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
 
Ability to work and communicate effectively with others in a diverse, multiethnic and multicultural work environment
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, decentralized environment
Strong time management skills
Eagerness to learn
Knowledge of Excel including experience with Vlookup and PivotTables


 
Education & Experience:
We have identified the following programs, experience, and knowledge that have helped others find success in this role at Measurabl. We understand though that knowledge comes from many forms of learning and experiences. Above all, we consider a person’s potential impact in the role and value their unique path to this point in their career.
 
High School Diploma or GED
A combination of professional or educational experience (whether formal or informal) that affords you with the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed above


 
Supervisory Responsibility:
This job currently has no supervisory responsibilities.
 
Perks and Benefits:
 
Unlimited Time Off
Benefits in line with your local country requirements
Holiday Paid Time Off (A week of Holiday in December Included)
Amazing, Inclusive, Diverse Culture
100% Fully Remote
Flexible Work Hours
£670 office set up fund for new employees
Monthly phone & internet reimbursement
Stock options
Bonus potential


 
Compensation Range:
 
£31,500 to £38,500 + DOE


 
Equal Employment Opportunity:
We aim to be an equal opportunities employer and we are determined to ensure that no applicant or employee receives less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, age, disability, religion, belief, sexual orientation, marital status, or race, or is disadvantaged by conditions or requirements which cannot be shown to be justifiable.
title: Data Operations Associate, EMEA

job_desc:
Salary: £60,000 Per Annum
Location: Central London, Hybrid
Permanent
EH
 
We are currently working with a Venture Capital backed Start-Up in the Health & Wellness space, to find a Commercial Data Analyst for their growing Data Practice.
 
They have recently received Series A Funding of £35 million and have doubled in size over the past year helping them to modernise its space in the industry. You will be joining at the beginning of their Data journey and will be responsible for creating actionable insights and analytics as well as liaising with senior stakeholders.
 
This opportunity enables you to have full ownership of the Looker platform and create automated reports allowing different business areas to self-serve, utilising the techstack of Looker, Tableau, Snowflake dbt and Fivetran.
 
 
Role:
 
Create and maintain data models and visualizations to support strategic business decisions
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data requirements and develop appropriate solutions
Analyse and interpret complex data sets to generate insights and recommendations
Build and maintain self-service tools for data analysis and reporting
Work closely with the Head of Data and a team of 4 to drive data-driven decision making


 
Requirements:
 
The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced environment and will have a passion for personal development.
You will have a strong background in data analytics, and data visualisation.
You will have used one or more visualisation tools e.g., Tableau, Looker and proficient knowledge in SQL.
Familiarity or an interest in learning dbt.


 
If you are an ambitious entrepreneurial and driven Data Analyst, or you know someone who would be interested in this opportunity, please send your CV and contact details to ethan.harrison@finatal.com.
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
An affiliate of NS Lemos (the "Desk"), part of a large single-family office (the "Group"), invests in opportunities across maritime shipping sectors by identifying value dislocations in public securities, commodities, and forward freight agreements (FFAs). Our clients, now in their sixth commercially successful generation, have been shipping entrepreneurs for nearly two centuries.
 
 
We are seeking a Data Scientist to support the trading activities of the Desk, as well as the fundamental research that underpins the Group's broader involvement in the shipping sector.
 
 
Responsibilities:
 
 
Own database and analytics supporting the Desk and broader Group shipping businesses
Build and maintain shipping and commodities price and fundamental database within existing internal data infrastructure
Create and maintain web-based dashboard with visualisations of data, pricing, and fundamental models across shipping and commodities
 
Support the build out of fundamental shipping supply/demand models
Develop analytics to support risk management of a multi-asset portfolio (commodity derivatives, publicly listed securities, etc.)
Model the back testing of new trade and hedging strategies


 
Required:
 
 
Prior experience in a similar position
Proficiency in Python
Experience querying and configuring SQL databases
Understanding of statistical analytics, including regression analysis
Interest in machine learning and artificial intelligence
Experience with visualisation software and creating interactive web-based dashboards
Ability to clearly communicate to technical and non-technical stakeholders in a multi-geography, multi-cultural environment
Bachelor's degree in a related field
Available to work in person at our London office


 
Desired:
 
 
Experience working with GIS (Geographic Information System)
Knowledge of shipping and/or commodities
Understanding of risk management tools (VaR, cVaR, scenario stress testing, etc.)
title: Data Scientist

job_desc:
Our team helps clients measure the marketing effectiveness or ROI of their advertising investment, as well as advising on pricing strategy, brand development and other commercial topics.
 
The Analyst role is suitable for people with a quantitative background in statistics, economics, operational research, finance, or data science. Experience building econometric or MMM models is advantageous but not essential. We are interviewing for people across three grades including Graduate Analyst, Analyst and Senior Analyst.
 
The job will give you hands-on experience in econometric modelling and data manipulation using Excel and R / tidyverse. This role will put you on a client facing career track in consultancy but will also give you opportunity to hone your analytic and coding skills with the support of our data science team.
 
Ebiquity have an impressive roster of blue-chip clients in retail, automatic, financial services and FMCG providing excellent learning opportunities to those wishing to apply their technical skills to real world problems.
 
 
 
 
Delivering outstanding analytical projects for our customers based upon excellent data exploration, econometric analysis, and interpretation.
Automate and simplify data processing using existing tools and scripting tasks in R / tidyverse.
Create concise, insightful customer communications (presentations, documentations etc)
Continually accumulate and develop marketing effectiveness knowledge and sector expertise.
Take responsibility for keeping tasks on deadline and managing client stakeholders.
Provide clarity in communicating results to clients both verbally and using Powerpoint.


 
 
 
At least a 2.1 in a relevant quantitative degree (Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research, Economics, Econometrics or Data Science).
Coding skills in either R or Python. The preferred language at Ebiquity is R.
Competent with Excel, PowerPoint and Word.
Be able to communicate in a professional environment.
Intellectually curious with an open mind, a self-starter, genuinely interested in data.
A team player, happy working in small groups
Applicants must be eligible to work in the UK


 
 
We are a global fast-growing company which offers a variety of opportunities for you to develop your skill set and career. In exchange for your contribution, we can offer you:
 
A Competitive salary and benefits
Generous annual leave including an extra day off for your birthday
Fantastic office space in Old Street
A company focus on wellbeing and work life balance including initiatives like flexible working, mental health support and regular health and wellbeing events


 
 
Ebiquity aims to create a workplace that is open and supportive, and free of discrimination and prejudice.
We want the best talent available, regardless of race, religion, gender, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, disability or age.​
title: Analyst - Econometric Modelling

job_desc:
Our client who specialises in design, engineering and project management, are looking for Data Analysts, to join their Applied Technology team on a permanent basis.
 
They are looking for someone with:
 
4+ years of professional experience (they are hiring at a range of different levels).
Experience working in a project environment, including governance processes, requirements gathering with business users, and different cycles of testing
Experience with different coding languages and data transformation / modelling tools e.g., Python, R, SQL, NoSQL, Azure Data Factory, Power Query
.
Experience using data visualisation tools, e.g., Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, QuickSight
.
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
About us:
Tutorful began in 2015, and we’ve taken the tutoring world by storm. Today, Tutorful has over 11,000 tutors on our books who have taught over 2 million lessons to over 140,000 students. We have backing from a leading VC and several prominent tech executives. We’re a close-knit and highly-skilled team who love working together to create something that genuinely helps thousands of people.
 
Everything we do at Tutorful is promoted by 5 company values, encompassing our culture and how we work as a team:
- We put our customers first
- We favour small, autonomous teams with clear objectives
- We strive for impact
- We're open and transparent
- We work with awesome colleagues
 
We're building a platform that helps parents and students connect and learn with inspiring tutors, wherever they are.
 
Our Vision: To make life-changing tuition accessible to everyone!
 
The Role
We are building our teams to support our growth plans and so we are looking to hire a Data Analyst to join our Data, Analytics and Insights Team. This role will be fundamental in progressing the analytical capabilities across the company and help inform wider business growth.
 
Responsibilities
 
Work within multidisciplinary teams across the business to understand where data can add value and devise and implement solutions
Contribute to our product experimentation culture
Support our data first approach across the business
Communicate findings and solutions to senior management


 
Desirable Attributes
 
Self-driven, well-organised and able to test, learn, adapt and transform
High level of accuracy and attention to detail
Ability to interpret data and derive meaningful insight
Self-motivated, organised, Ambitious, driven individual


 
Ideal experience
 
STEM Degree educated
At least 1 year of relevant work experience
Strong statistical foundations
Experience with BI tool
Experience with hypothesis testing
Experience using SQL
Experience in Python, R, or equivalent
Experience using source control
Strong communication, effective problem solving, conceptual thinking, quantitative and analytical skills.


 
Salary range - £20,000 - 30,000
 
At Tutorful you can expect a great working environment and to continually improve your skills
 
Some of our benefits include:
 
25 days holiday, with an extra day for each year you are with us (up to 28
An additional 5 days unpaid is available, just in case you want it!
We have flexible working hours over the week around a set of core hours
Hybrid working model
Enhanced Maternity, Paternity and Adoption Leave
2 Wellbeing Days per calendar year
A great office environment, including free fruit, fab coffee, beer on Thursday afternoons, and company-organised socials
Everyone gets an annual training budget and there are opportunities to attend conferences and in-house training sessions
Company ‘skill sharing’ initiatives, along with external training opportunities
You get £250 in lesson credit every year to spend on the Tutorful platform
An awesome team to work amongst, who are genuinely improving education for thousands of people across the UK!


 
If the above is of interest to you or you have any additional questions, please feel free to contact us.
 
Don't meet every single requirement? Statistics show that women and people of colour are less likely to apply for a role unless they meet every listed qualification. Tutorful are dedicated to growing an inclusive and diverse team, so if you're excited about the role but don't meet every requirement we encourage you to apply anyway, as you might be the perfect fit!
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Role:
 
Junior Data Engineer (multiple headcount)
Hybrid / Flexible Working:
 
London / WFH
Level:
 
Entry
Benefits:
 
 
23 Days Holiday (+1 Birthday, +2 Life Events, +1 Admin, +Christmas Closure, + Team Days)
Mobile Phone contribution (monthly)
Sport club contribution (monthly)
Private Health Insurance / Medicash Scheme
Team Days
Away Days (Summer Events - last year we went to Switzerland!)
Flexible Working
Discretionary Company Bonus
Kit Drops


 
Two Circles is a vibrant, multi-award-winning and rapidly-expanding sports marketing agency. We work with some of the world’s biggest sports organisations including the NFL, Premier League and UEFA.
 
We’re looking for growth-oriented, dynamic and motivated new team members to help us build a once-in-a-lifetime sports business and reimagine the commercial frameworks of the global sports industry.
 
Every day, our team analyses billions of pieces of behavioural, attitudinal and purchase data from sports fans spanning the globe, using the latest machine-learning and data visualisation technology. We do this to give our clients the tools and insight required to build direct relationships with fans, grow engagement, and drive revenue across their event-day, sponsorship and media businesses.
 
We have a global team of 500 Two Circlers working from six offices across the world (London, New York, Los Angeles, Melbourne, Paris and Bern) who work cross-region to service our expanding international client base. See here for some examples of our work.
 
As part of our ongoing growth, we are looking to innovate with our technology stack and are seeking a Junior Data Ops Engineer to onboard Clients and maintain the Two Circles services and products we provide them, including:
 
Data Operations:
 
Configuring and maintaining the cloud-based applications, components and infrastructure that underpins our market-leading products and service, from provisioning environments all the way to user access management and permissions
Data Management:
 
Aggregating and structuring diverse sets of data, and providing machine-learning-powered models to forecast and influence commercial performance
Data Analytics:
 
Analysing commercial performance, audience segmentation, and monitoring sales and marketing campaigns in real-time


It is a fantastic opportunity for a smart, dynamic and ambitious person interested in working for sport’s most exciting agency at our UK headquarters, located at the heart of London’s technology hub.
 
Role Profile:
As a Junior Data Engineer at Two Circles, you play a key role assisting our team of engineers configuring and supporting data and BI solutions for the largest sporting organisations in the world. Using your keen eye for detail, logical and analytical mindset and understanding of configuring data technology, you help implement Two Circles’ industry leading data solutions for our clients and projects.
 
There will be plenty of opportunities to rotate through different teams (Data Engineering, BI Engineering) to give you real learning and development chances in different areas of our tech team. You can take significant ownership over what you learn and what you want to have different exposure to!
 
You collaborate with multiple internal teams to understand requirements, thoroughly planning and testing changes before accurately implementing them to a high standard of client and colleague satisfaction. You are a natural problem solver managing multiple proactive and reactive tasks and assignments, effectively prioritising your work, identifying risks and clearly communicating these to stakeholders.
 
You thrive in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment and are equally comfortable discussing technical concepts with your DataOps & Engineering peers as you are explaining them to less technical colleagues.
 
When you are not delivering against specific projects or contributing to effective IT Operations activities, you are spotting opportunities to add value or realise improvements, working on your own professional development and learning objectives or sharing knowledge with other Two Circlers.
 
This role will be part of the Data & Engineering Team.
 
Your main duties & responsibilities:
 
Monitoring our data management platform and associated data pipelines, working with Engineering colleagues to provide expert support as required
Supporting the onboarding of new clients into our Data Analytics and Management products including configuration of data ingestion, data mapping, opt-in tracking, customer matching, data export and client facing dashboards and analytics
Using Data Management hubs to configure and manage client environments, including implementing changes, testing and supporting the regular release of feature updates
Working across the DataOps & Engineering function to help input into feature specification and ideation to improve product and services offering
Providing client-facing Services and Product teams with accurate and informative reports on data quality, integrity of transformation procedures and timeliness of task sequences and schedules
Reconciling data throughout stages of collection, processing and presentation
Playing a role in our User Access Management process across Two Circlers and Client users
Protecting the data entrusted to us by our clients at all times


 
The ideal background and skills we are looking for include:
 
 
Understanding of IT Operations and Service Management practices, including incident/request, change and problem management, monitoring, events and alerting, task tracking and fulfilment toolsets, capacity planning
Demonstrable knowledge of data-intensive technology environments, or equivalent higher education qualification
Analytical mindset with some experience of Systems and Data configuration, e.g. DWH, CMS, CRM, ERP, PIM
Basic knowledge of at least one of the following data query languages; SQL or Python/Pyspark
Awareness of Data Protection, Privacy and Governance principles, e.g. GDPR
Producing and maintaining good standards of documentation
Great self-starting attitude and keen to join an entrepreneurial organisation where every working day is different
Excellent time management, organisational skills and attention to detail
Problem solver - you have a curiosity and a willingness to learn new things
A team player who contributes to collective goals above personal gain


 
Process:
 
 
Introductory Call with Emily - Talent Manager (30 mins over Teams)
 
Tech Team Day -
 
16th October
 
(fun exercises, relaxed/informal Q&A sessions with the team over a coffee, tech presentation, tour of the office and an interview -
 
lunch and travel expenses provided
)


 
 
Though these are the basics written down, we will principally be recruiting for energy, values and commitment – both to Two Circles and to your career.
 
 
Our recruitment process will be honest & thorough, and so will our roles. In return, we can offer honesty, integrity, and the chance to progress in the organisation as quickly as you develop within it.
 
 
Two Circles is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
title: Junior Data Engineer

job_desc:
Our CEO & Board have positioned ‘using data to better serve customers’ as one of our 4 strategic pillars of our business and this investment intends to keep us ahead of the curve in the pet care industry.

To achieve this, we have built an internal analytics capability, the Petcare Analytics Group, that creates value by helping our business to make better decisions that improve pet welfare, enable a brilliant customer experience and optimise the working practices of our colleagues and partners.
 
As part of our expansion of the Petcare Analytics Group, we are looking for a Data Scientist to join our existing Data Science team.

As a Data Scientist, you will help deliver transformational projects centred around predictive modelling, optimisation and marketing personalisation.
 
 
Providing thought-provoking analytics from a large range of internal and external data sources to inform and guide strategic debate at all levels within our business. This will be across all functions in the Pets at Home Group
Delivering evidence-based stories in a compelling way that enables stakeholders to take action
Being a domain expert and a technical authority within the Advanced Analytics function. Maintaining a commercial mindset and identifying opportunities that are mutually beneficial for our businesses and their customers
Identifying process and data quality improvements and partnering with other areas of the Petcare Analytics Group to continually improve our business and VIP loyalty scheme data
Proactively feeding back to the business analysis and data products that lead to improved understanding and operational efficiencies. Curating a knowledge bank that can assist other business functions
Sharing knowledge, technical best practice and outcomes to develop more junior members of the Data Science Team and other teams that you partner with. Taking a leading role in the technical development of others
 


You'll have a proven ability and experience of applying Data Science techniques to create commercial value, ideally from within a consumer-centric business.

Strong SQL skills and extensive experience of working with large-scale data warehouses is essential. You'll also have experience of analytical programming languages such as R/ Python/ Scala.

Further key experience/attributes includes;
 
 
Demonstrable experience with core data science methods such as classification, regression, time series forecasting, clustering, nearest neighbour, neural networks, embeddings, dimensionality reduction and anomaly detection.
Experience with Geographic Information Systems and an understanding of geospatial analytics methods is (desirable but not essential)
Experience with attribution modelling within a marketing context (desirable but not essential)
Highly numerate with a solid understanding of statistics and the ability to translate complex analysis to non-technical stakeholders.
Demonstrable experience of managing end-to-end data science projects, from understanding business needs, combining relevant data sources and building solutions, to creating commercial success through measurable deployment
 


Our diversity and inclusion vision is that everyone is welcome and feels part of our group. If you think you’re a good match to what we are looking for, and you share our belief that together ‘we’re better with pets’, we’d like to hear from you, whatever your background or circumstances.
 
At Pets at Home we have an ambitious plan, to become “The Best Pet Care Business in the world” and a key part of delivering this in sustainable way will be our most cherished assets: our People and our Culture. We are a business built on strong values and behaviours which guide everything we do. These are our foundations which will help us to deliver our better world pledge to create a better world for pets and the people who love them.

The Pets at Home Group includes over 450 stores, over 310 Groom Rooms and 440 First Opinion Vet Practices. It’s fast-paced, innovative, fun and we put people at the very heart of everything we do. We are committed to developing a culture of inclusivity where everyone is able to come to work and be themselves, a culture which welcomes everyone irrespective of what makes us all unique.
title: Data Scientist

job_desc:
Turtl is an exciting software company with more than 300 customers around the world and 120+ employees based in London and Boston.
 
Our software enables anyone to create, personalize, publish and track digital documents - with no need for specialist design or coding skills. Turtl is used by businesses of all sizes, from small organizations to big names, such as Cisco, Nestle and Lexus. We think there’s huge potential for growth given the wide applicability of our software and the clear benefits we’re hearing from customers.
 
It’s a fast-paced work environment, so we’re looking for talented people who want to continuously learn and actively embrace challenges. You’ll find Turtl a straightforward and open place to work, where colleagues can be relied on to help.
 
If you’re ready to take that next step in your career, then it’s a great time to be joining the team!
 
LONDON
 
Our London office is located within Second Home, Spitalfields, a unique coworking space in the heart of East London's tech hub. With an open-plan space, ideal for collaborative working and networking, this is home to a broad range of teams including Marketing, Customer Success, Sales, Account Management, Finance, Legal and People teams. We have on-site cafe, rooftop terrace/bar, weekly wellness and cultural events, as well as fully stocked kitchens within the building.
 
THE ROLE
 
Reporting to the Data Acquisition Manager, and sitting within the Marketing Operations function, you will be responsible for collecting and updating information about prospects and customers and ensuring the data in the CRM is kept up to date. You will also have the opportunity to support other areas of the business on research related activities and special projects.
 
 
 
You will undertake desk research on customers and prospects to better understand both the organization’s issues / objectives and the departments / staff we should be targeting to sell Turtl.
 
You will display a clear understanding of business related persona fit, technology use case and general comfortability with pre-defined target markets.
 
You will use research tools such as Zoominfo and Linkedin Navigator to find relevant personas and contacts to add to the CRM/Database.
 
You will maintain the CRM/Database to ensure contact information is complete and up-to-date, and that invalid records are removed.
 
You will provide accurate and timely reporting on your activity to meet challenging research targets.
 
You will uphold the values and cultural ethos of Turtl in all dealings internally and externally.
 


 
 
 
You are a great problem solver who can combine analytical capabilities and creative thinking to generate practical insights and solutions.
 
You are highly organised and can prioritize workload effectively and have excellent attention to detail.
 
You have strong communications skills, and are able to engage with people across multiple geographies, and at different levels.
 
You are a proficient user of Excel.
 
You have great research skills.
 
We are particularly keen to hear from ambitious candidates who are looking to progress further within our company as several others have done in this role.
 


 
 
We offer a competitive base salary, share options within Turtl, plus up to 25 days of holidays (plus bank holidays), as well as a birthday day off. Funded by Turtl, you’ll be enrolled in our workplace pension, life assurance and Perkbox schemes. We offer our employees a flexible approach to hybrid working where they can split their time between working from home and the office.
 
EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES STATEMENT
 
Turtl is an equal opportunity employer and are committed to growing a diverse workforce that represents all people regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity. We encourage applications from all backgrounds and will make any recruitment or interview adjustments that will ensure a comfortable candidate experience.
title: Data Researcher

job_desc:
Our Organisation

The Football Association [The FA] is the not-for-profit governing body of football in England. It is responsible for promoting and developing every level of the game, from grassroots through to the professional game, and generates significant revenue to support investment into English football each year.

The FA oversees England international teams across men's, women's, youth and disability football, as well as running the National League System and FA Competitions including the Emirates FA Cup, Barclays FA Women's Super League, FA Women's Championship, and Vitality Women's FA Cup, and the world-class facilities of Wembley Stadium and St. George's Park,
 
all with a purpose to Unite the Game and Inspire the Nation.
 
The Role

Support The FA's Grassroots division in its ever-growing demand on data and reporting, especially in relation to Sport England funded activities. This role will primarily work on data visualisation through Power BI dashboard builds, alongside translating business requirements into business value.

This opportunity would be ideal for someone in the earlier stages of their career, looking to develop and grow in this key role.

Key Accountabilities
 
 
Gather, understand, and document detailed business requirements then manipulate complex data sets relating to grassroots football to meet these requirements
Develop management reports, KPI reports, and dashboards that enable Grassroots Football and County FA colleagues to understand and transform the impact of their activities
Transform raw data into intuitive and impactful visuals, working with business owners to ensure they are confident using the reports to gain insight
Communicate data analysis findings to stakeholders across the organisation in an engaging and impactful manner
Collaborate with other members of the Grassroots Digital & Data Strategy Team and the Data Architecture Team to identify and resolve data and reporting issues
Proactively improve processes around reporting: set-up and maintain automated data processes, improve quality assurance approaches, and implement new testing processes
Execute additional tasks as required in order to meet FA Group changing priorities.
Comply with all company policies and procedures to ensure the highest standards of health, safety and wellbeing can be maintained.
 


What we are looking for
 
Experience
 
 
You have experience working with data visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, Looker, etc.)
You have experience managing complex datasets and working with relational databases to produce insights
You have experience building strong relationships with collaborators and engaging stakeholders from across business divisions
 


 
Communicative: You can convey complex, technical concepts simply and effectively, adapting your communication for different audiences
Organised: You are comfortable managing recurring and ad-hoc reporting queries and working to deadlines
Collaborative: You're a team player and you are energised by working with colleagues across the business
Driven by quality: You strive for data quality with structured and accurate working methods.
Proactive: You have an ability to identify and act on issues and opportunities before they arise.
Technical: You have basic SQL and/or DAX skills
 


 
You have played a role within grassroots football – as a player, referee, and/or team/club admin – or another sport
You have experience gathering requirements from the business and translating them into dashboards and reports that meet the business' needs
You have experience with Google Analytics
 


 
Technical: Intermediate SQL and/or DAX skills (ability to query data across multiple tables, etc.)
 


What we can offer you
 
 
An exciting and challenging role within a changing, dynamic and world-renowned sports organisation.
Attractive benefits and a competitive salary.
 


Please be aware that unless you are on a homebased contract, your contract with The FA will specify a fixed location of either Wembley Stadium, St. George's Park or our Processing Centre.

We currently work within a hybrid working model whereby the expectation is to work from your contractual location for part of the week, and as and when required by the team. The remaining days can be worked remotely. We will continue to monitor this model and it may be adjusted in future if deemed necessary.

The Football Association Group promotes inclusion and diversity, and welcomes applications from everyone. If you have any particular requirements in respect of the recruitment or interview process please mention this in your application.
title: Data Reporting Analyst

job_desc:
ClearML is a unified, open source platform for continuous machine learning (ML), trusted by forward-thinking Data Scientists, ML Engineers, DevOps, and decision makers at leading Fortune 500, enterprises, academia, and innovative start-ups worldwide. We enable customers to build continuous ML workflows -- from experiment management and orchestration through data management and scheduling, followed by provisioning and serving -- to achieve the fastest time to ML production, fastest time to value, and increased performance.


As a member of the Data Science team at ClearML, you will have the opportunity to contribute to our mission of transforming the ML space -- bridging software, machine learning, and automation . Our team is focused on improving the customer experience of our MLOPs platform and tools through data-driven insights, research, and development.


In this role, you will work closely with product, engineering, and growth teams to understand how data scientists and machine learning engineers are using our tools and make recommendations for improving their capabilities. You will also have the opportunity to share your findings and recommendations with organizational leaders, as the Data Science team plays a key role in shaping the overall strategy and culture of the company. 


By joining ClearML, you will have the chance to be a part of a dynamic team that is dedicated to advancing the field of machine learning and helping ML engineers train high-performing, fair, and reproducible models.


Responsibilities: 


Partner with the Growth and Product teams to identify ideal users, their behaviors within the product, and ways to optimize the growth team's efforts.
Work with Product Managers to incorporate your expertise in machine learning into the development of new tools and features for data scientists.
Develop data science models and statistical methods to inform business strategy and enhance customer experiences.
Act as a mentor and educator for the entire team by sharing not only the outcomes of your projects, but also the process and methods used, to empower all team members to become data-savvy.
Work together with engineering and product development teams to build and test ML/DL solutions stretching the entire spectrum of ML operationalization from data processing, model training, hyperparameter tuning, deployment, and model management.


About you:


Experience in predictive modeling and inferential statistics in a Data Science setting.
Familiarity with causal inference methods and experience in building related models.
Strong skills in working and analyzing real datasets using SQL, Pandas, and data visualization.
Knowledge of growth and product metrics, including modeling, customer segmentation, and customer acquisition.
Basic understanding of deep learning and CV concepts and architectures.
Passion for MLOps and deep learning products and ecosystems. .
A track record of creating well-documented and easy-to-follow code. 
Excellent communication skills, including the ability to clearly convey ideas to people with different technical backgrounds.
Strong writing and presentation skills for insights and data visualization.
Knowledge of SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java, or C++ is a plus. 
Familiar with Kubernetes and/or perhaps similar container system
Strong math and analytical skills, with business acumen
BSc or BA degree in Computer Science, Engineering or other relevant area; graduate degree in Data Science or other quantitative field is preferred


About ClearML
ClearML is a unified, open source platform for continuous machine learning (ML), trusted by forward-thinking Data Scientists, ML Engineers, DevOps, and decision makers at leading Fortune 500, enterprises, academia, and innovative start-ups worldwide. We enable customers to build continuous ML workflows -- from experiment management and orchestration through data management and scheduling, followed by provisioning and serving -- to achieve the fastest time to ML production, fastest time to value, and increased performance.
 
In this way, ClearML accelerates ML adoption across business units, helping companies reach their revenue potential and materialize their ML investments. With thousands of deployments and a vibrant, engaged community, ClearML is transforming the ML space -- bridging software, machine learning, and automation. To learn more, visit the company’s website at 
https://clear.ml
.
title: Data Scientist

job_desc:
People have always been at the heart of St. James’s Place, we value long-term relationships and we are a home for people who care about the future – financially, environmentally and socially. These core values have enabled us to become a leading FTSE 100 Wealth Management company.
 
Junior Data Analyst
 
Location:
 
Hybrid Cirencester/Remote (2 days p/wk in Cirencester office)
 
Employment Type:
 
Permanent
 
We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Junior Data Analyst. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, and implementing data integration solutions using ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tools and technologies.
 
 
You will be expected to learn one or two of the following ETL systems including; SQL, Talend, Matillion, Snowflake, Informatica, DataStage and Tableau Prep. Training and support will be provided to help you accomplish this.
 
 
Once the data is extracted you will work with others to make the data available to those who need it, or create data visualization reports as necessary for Stakeholders. This will be done using Tableau or Power BI.
 
 
What you’ll be doing:
 
 
 
Support the development of self-serve reporting by being an SME in divisional data sources and engaging with data recipients.
You’ll help with the design and develop ETL processes using tools such as Talend, Informatica, or Datastage.
Extract data from various sources, including databases, flat files, and APIs.
Transform data using techniques such as data cleansing, data mapping, and data aggregation.
Load data into target systems such as data warehouses, data lakes, and business intelligence platforms.
With support, you’ll design and build new reports/dashboards based on divisional requirements by being a SME in the use of the division's chosen data visualisation tool (i.e. Tableau).
Deliver regular MI insights to the Senior Management Team within agreed SLAs, provide written commentary and analysis on the contents of the reports.
Maintain appropriate procedure documents for team tasks, completing an annual review across these to ensure they remain up to date.
Support projects by working with stakeholders to elicit the MI requirements, delivering on these by building the required MI and providing relevant insights into the data produced.
Any ad hoc tasks as required within the MI or wider Strategy & Change team which can utilise the individual’s analytical and data driven approach.


 
 
Who we’re looking for:
 
 
 
Proficiency with ETL tools such as Talend, Informatica, or Datastage.
Good understanding of SQL and database concepts.
Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret large and multiple data sets.
Experience developing new data sets and defining MI & reporting requirements for a large division.
Strong experience with Tableau preferred, together with advanced Excel skills with experience in designing and building dashboards.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with ability to present your findings from complex data sets to the end user is a simple and easy to understand way.
Ability to amalgamate data from multiple sources and present it in a simple and functional way.
Ability to identify data requirements and define required data sets.
Successfully engage in multiple projects simultaneously.
Proof reading skills and a strong eye for accuracy.
Ability to interact professionally within diverse groups, including executives, managers, subject matter experts and end users.


 
 
Flexible Working
 
 
 
We understand that employees work best in different ways, at different times and in different environments. We value all of our employees and appreciate that everyone is unique, and at one of many stages within their career. Recognising this, we have introduced a hybrid working policy to provide greater flexibility for part-time work, job-sharing, remote working, and flexibility on hours. Our people are encouraged to work in a flexible way that suits their lifestyle where it can be accommodated, so please ask the question and start a conversation!
 
 
Research tells us that applicants (especially those from underrepresented groups) can be put off from applying for a role if they do not meet all the criteria or have been on an extended career-break. If you think you would be a good match for this role and can demonstrate some transferable experience please apply, regardless of whether you tick every box.
 
 
Why work for us?
 
 
 
Our Rewards
 
 
 
In addition to an attractive salary and eligibility to participate in the discretionary annual bonus opportunities, you will also receive an excellent benefits package including:
 
 
Non-Contributory Pension – 10% (increasing with length of service) with further pension matching
Meaningful protection benefits with real value, such as 10X life cover, PHI, and critical illness.*
Best in class terms and conditions including 6 months paid parental leave.
Private Medical and Dental Insurance
28 days holiday entitlement plus bank holidays (based on full-time equivalent) with the option to buy up to an additional 5 days holiday
Discretionary bonus scheme dependent on company and personal performance, varied by level
Not applicable to fixed term contracts (standard uplift applies in lieu of the protection benefits)


 
 
Our Culture
 
 
 
Our culture is the glue that binds us together - It’s one of our biggest assets and one of the biggest reasons for our success. It’s underpinned by core values of doing the right thing, being the best version of ourselves and investing in long term relationships.
 
 
We want to embrace diverse backgrounds and experiences to connect with clients, solve problems and innovate. We raise our voice on the things that matter to us and drive change from the front. Contributing to our inclusive culture is vital, ensuring a space for everyone to be their authentic self, no compromises.
 
 
In all we do, we consider how our work affects the communities in which we belong. Over 96% of our group employees are involved in supporting our communities through financial education, charitable giving and volunteering. Over 80% of all our employees and Partners donate each month to our Charitable Foundation, which is now the 3rd largest corporate charity in the UK.
 
 
SJP are delighted to have signed The Armed Forces Covenant, and we are active members of LGBT Great, 30% club, The Diversity Project, Disability Confident and more! Find out more: https://www.sjp.co.uk/careers/life-at-sjp
 
 
Our Awards:
 
 
 
We understand it’s important to be proud of the company you work for, that’s why we’re proud to share with you some of our recent awards:
 
 
Wealth Manager of the Year – Growth Investor Awards 2021
Best Wealth Manager – Shares Awards 2021
Championing LGBTQ Inclusion - Financial Adviser Diversity in Finance Awards 2020
Top 75 Employer - Social Mobility Foundation Employer Index 2021


 
 
To find out more visit: https://www.sjp.co.uk/about-us/our-awards-and-recognition
