title: Junior Data Analyst

job_desc:
Data Analytics Engineer | 100% Remote
 
OVERVIEW
 
As a Data Analytics Engineer at Wejo you will be working with Big Data, with over 11 million cars globally we collect data for more than 44 billion journeys every day! A core part of your role will be to discover new techniques for drawing meaningful insights from connected car data for real-life applications.
 
WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING AS A DATA ANALYTICS ENGINEER
 
At Wejo, we’re turning that data into insights & intelligence products. As a Data Analytics Engineer you will be:
 
Working with a rich, highly granular dataset of driver behaviours across the world
Turning product ideas into insight products via code, in a scaleable & repeatable way
Tackling cutting-edge analytical challenges with a high-calibre team, and across multiple business functions, including Data Science, Engineering, Product, Solutions Consulting, to name a few!
Demonstrating feasibility of an idea with simplistic, but accurate, prototypes based on real driver behaviours
Unearthing & integrating new datasets to complement the data we already have


 
We know that working together and listening to each other is what makes us strong, so in this role we want to hear your ideas of new data structures and new methodologies we can implement to further improve the way we derive value from our connected car data.
 
WHAT YOU'LL NEED AS A DATA ANALYTICS ENGINEER
 
 
Spark
Python (esp. pandas, pyspark, geopandas)
Scala
Databricks
SQL
R
Any BI/Visualisation tool (bonus)


 
We know our tech stack is unique, and as we always like to say it's all about the journey. You don't need you to be an expert in all of these right now, but to have a combination of them and along with the right attitude we will help get you there by upskill and cross training you into the new and emerging technologies that we use.
 
Nice to have
 
Experience working with geospatial data
Experience managing data ingestion and processing operations
Experience with presenting analytical insights to non-technical audiences


 
ABOUT US
 
Wejo is a global leader in the connected car market and is shaping the future of mobility. The connected car space is one of the fastest growing sectors in the IoT industry. Car manufacturers are looking to extend traditional infotainment systems, insurers are seeking a better understanding of risk, users are demanding more feedback and firms are generating increasing amounts of data and require support in understanding its applications and value. We specialise in creating new services and products to help clients make the most of their data and realise its value.
 
We bring together the brightest minds and industry experts with award-winning platform technology and advanced privacy and security to revolutionise the way we live, work and travel using connected car data, insights and analytics.
title: Data Analytics Engineer

job_desc:
Data Analyst
Salary £38,000
 
 
Our Data Analytics Platform Design team is currently recruiting for a Data Analyst to be a part of their innovative and tech focus team to support on a variety of exciting IT development projects.
It’s an exciting time to be a part of our team and business!
 
 
We are constantly modernising our complex data estate - cloud and data lake are our strategic targets, with business self-service and the concept of Mesh computing also in our sights. Having experience with these specific skills is desirable, however we are happy to provide the opportunity to you if you have a healthy appetite to learn and develop these skills with us.
 
A bit about the role:
Our Data and Analytics Platform Design team manage, prepare and assure a wide selection of data assets to support a diverse group of business areas within our Life, Pensions and Global businesses. The team liaise with key internal stakeholders from the finance, actuarial, and regulatory reporting teams, alongside various MI, Business Intelligence and Data Science communities within Aviva.
 
As a Data Analyst, you will support a range of development and transformation projects, balancing the needs of business projects with the need to continually modernize our complex IT estate. Our design team is multi-disciplined and multi-faceted - as a member of our pioneering team, you will provide data analysis capability across multiple teams, collaborating with business users, solution developers, solution architects, and designers.
 
 
Skills and experience we’re looking for:
 
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Excellent SQL scripting skills
Ability to demonstrate understanding relational database construct and concepts
Ability to demonstrate understanding of Data Ware Housing, Data Lake and Big Data concepts


Desirable Skills:
 
Familiarity with AWS cloud-based solutions and/or data lake solutions and experience or exposure to Life & Pensions industry, with some familiarity with the associated products and systems


 
What you’ll get for this role:
 
Salary up to £38,000 (depending on location, skills, experience, and qualifications)
Generous pension (starting level Aviva contributes 8% when you contribute 2%)
Eligibility for annual performance bonus
Family friendly parental and carer’s leave
29 days holiday per year plus bank holidays and the option to buy/sell up to 5 additional days
Up to 40% discount for Aviva products
Brilliant flexible benefits including electric cars
Aviva Matching Share Plan and Save As You Earn scheme
21 volunteering hours per year


 
Aviva is for everyone:
 
We are inclusive and welcome everyone – we want applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences. Excited but not sure you tick every box? Research tells us that women, particularly, feel this way. So, regardless of gender, why not apply. And if you’re in a job share just apply as a pair.
 
We flex locations, hours and working patterns to suit our customers, business, and you.
 
Most of our people are smart working –spending around 50% of their time in our offices every week - combining the benefits of flexibility with time together with colleagues.
 
To find out more about working at Aviva take a look here
 
We interview every disabled applicant who meets the minimum criteria for the job. Once you’ve applied, please send us an email stating that you have a disclosed disability, and we’ll interview you.
 
We’d love it if you could submit your application online. If you require an alternative method of applying, please give Lacey Lane Mckoy a call on 07385425912 or send an email to lacey.lane-mckoy@aviva.com

company_type: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
job_desc:
We’re the UK's largest ports operator with a network of 21 ports around Britain. We handle around one quarter of the UK's seaborne trade and contribute £7.5 billion to our economy every year.

It’s a story we’re proud of but it doesn’t end there. We’re transforming our business and embracing the future.

We offer a vast range of roles spanning the UK, all rooted in a culture that welcomes diversity, fosters talent, encourages internal movement and progression, and places safety as our number one priority.
 
Data Analyst (IT) – Level 4
 
What’s it all about?
 
Throughout this apprenticeship you will gain the knowledge, skills and behaviours required to become a capable Data Analyst. The broad purpose of a Data Analyst is to ascertain how data can be used in order to answer questions and solve problems. Data analysis is a process of requirement-gathering, inspecting, cleansing, transforming and modelling data with the goal of discovering useful information, informing conclusions and supporting decision-making. Data analysis has multiple facets and approaches, encompassing diverse techniques under a variety of names. In today's world, data analysis plays a crucial role in making decisions more evidence-based and helping organisations operate more effectively.
 
How long does it take?
 
The apprenticeship will take up to 3 years to complete.
 
Where is the role based?
 
This role is based in Southampton. You will be expected to attend regular workshops with Cambridge Spark (these will all be online).
 
What are the entry requirements?
 
 
GCSEs at grade 4/C or above in English and Maths.
A Levels (or equivalent)
Strong organisational skills.
Good customer management and relationship skills.
Able to use own initiative and make decisions.
Resilience, with the ability to maintain professional and positive attitude in a customer-facing environment.
Effective and efficient time management.
 
Able to work with senior stakeholders and maintain confidentiality.
Good computer skills and knowledge of relevant software such as Microsoft Word and Excel.
 


https://www.instituteforapprenticeships.org/apprenticeship-standards/data-analyst-v1-1
 
When joining ABP you will find an environment that is both welcoming and challenging. We reward our employees well and offer a generous remuneration package, employer pension, private health insurance and a range of other benefits.

Please note that ABP undertake random screening for substance abuse and operate a zero-tolerance policy. A medical will be required before starting this position also.

We are an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their background, which helps us to provide a diverse and inclusive working environment.

First things first: you want to know what you’re actually applying for. It’s impossible to capture every nuance of a role – especially at a rapidly growing company like Mews – but if we had to distill it down to a job description (which we do, because this is a job description), it would be this: We're looking for a Data Analyst to join one of our product teams and help us deliver great products & RnD operation insights to our RnD teams and leadership. You will be helping shape our product strategy and improve RnD processes. You will be a part of the team responsible for building Looker reports, making ad-hoc data analysis and helping others interpret their data.
 
 
We are looking for a Data Analyst, who will strengthen one of our cross-functional product teams at Mews with experience and willingness to constantly innovate and question the way we do things here. The ideal candidate will bring a new set of skills and knowledge into the existing product team and work closely with other data analysts and our data platform team.

Work within a product team on building amazing features

GlobalData Plc, is a premium business intelligence company specialising in industry analysis across multiple industry sectors and we have one main goal – to supply our clients with timely expert analysis on key business issues critical to their market

Research Analysts will be expected to develop their research and analysis skills to allow them to make significant contributions to the core products of the beverages team. Furthermore, associates will be expected to contribute to any consultancy research projects as required.

Research and analysis:
 
Industry Profiles are designed to offer clients a quick and reliable way to retrieve data and forecast information on key industrial and consumer sectors across the world's leading economies. The Associate Research Analyst will therefore use established research and analysis techniques to locate market data and present future-focused opinion.
·
 
Produce high quality output:
 
Follow the standards outlined in the process manual. Self-proof all work. Ensure consistent delivery of work according to the pre-determined targets.
·
 
Suggest product or process improvements:

title: Graduate Analyst

job_desc:
Faithful+Gould is one of the world’s leading project and programme management consultancies operating at the forefront of the property and industry sectors. Placing great emphasis on the training, development, and progression of our staff, we’re dedicated to providing high quality professional services with cutting-edge expertise to our clients.
 
Read more about how you can thrive with us.

We are a collaborating team working from multiple locations across the UK. Providing support for transportation infrastructure projects with a focus on Cost Management, Estimating and the wider Faithful+Gould organisation on digital.
 
In your role as Construction Data Analyst, you will be responsible for the following -
 
 
Creating and managing databases and data systems involves reorganizing data into a format that is readable with eliminating damaged data, fixing coding difficulties, and other problems.
Using automation technologies for data extraction from primary and secondary sources.
Using statistical tools to identify, analyse, and interpret patterns and trends in large data sets that could aid in diagnosis and prediction and evaluating data to establish its value and quality.
Assigning numerical values to essential business functions to assess and compare business performance over time.
Creating reports for management that include trends, patterns, and predictions based on relevant data.
Preparing final analysis reports to assist stakeholders in comprehending the data-analysis steps and making critical decisions based on various patterns and facts.
Analyse the results and interpret them for the clients’ benefits.
 


 
A winning attitude - you can spot opportunities, manage expectation, and show tenacity, resolve and inclination to see things through.
Meet the Challenge - you never see your own development as done. You spend time alone and with you team to reflect, learn and absorb new ideas.
Team Player - you create a great framework for teams to work within. You publicly credit individuals and teams for high performance, anticipating problems, and helping resolve conflict among colleagues or clients. You continuously build successful partnerships with other business units and clients.
Customer Driven - you raise the standards of customer service through role modelling, dealing swiftly with feedback from customers. You have the commercial awareness to know the cost-of-service delivery and how to manage for value.
Aware - you are forward looking and clearly understand your own role in fulfilling the wider goals of Faithful+Gould. You can read situations well, understanding and influencing the dynamics and drivers of relationships with colleagues and clients alike.
Adaptable - you can guide change and put yourself in the shoes of others; understanding the impact which decisions may have. You have a flexible attitude and can use different approaches to provide support.
 


Essential -
 
 
A knowledge of project/cost management and practices within the construction industry.
Degree or equivalent experience working towards membership of a relevant professional association.
Excellent inter-personal skills with an ability to communicate effectively at any organisational level, both internally and externally with clients.
An understanding of project controls processes and business process analysis, able to interrogate client’s ways of working, and then design and document their business processes promoting digitalisation and automation.
Able to gather and transform disparate and complex data sources into focused management information, tailored and targeted for any specific audience.
Excellent knowledge of MS Excel, PowerPoint and Word.
Reporting experience including detailed knowledge of Power BI, able to develop robust data models and attractive, interactive dashboard visualizations that provide management insights and highlight actionable intelligence around specific areas of concern.
Able to interrogate and discover hidden and meaningful patterns within data, either to measure historic events or to predict the likelihood of future outcomes.
Well versed in best practices for information management, assurance and security including data standards, reporting and analytics.
 


Desirable -
 
 
Knowledge of Microsoft Power App and Power Automate.
Knowledge of programming languages such as VBA, SQL, Python, etc.
Knowledge of at least one of Project Management Information Systems such as Cost X, Cost OS, Primavera P6, Unifier, EcoSys, PM Web, Proliance, CEMAR, SmartSheets, etc.
Knowledge of Document Management systems such as Aconex, BIM 360, SharePoint, ASite, etc.
 


Why work for Faithful+Gould?
 
Join us and expand your career on some of the industry's most exciting and newsworthy construction projects – from mission-critical COVID-19 facilities to the world's tallest hotel, London's Heathrow Airport to Europe's first eco-friendly mosque. You'll enjoy invaluable exposure to international expertise as well as innovation in local niche areas.

In 2020, we took away Silver and Gold in the Construction Manager of the Year Awards; and made finalist for the Young Surveyor of the Year. So, you'll be part of a team where our standards are high, as are the rewards. And, at every career stage, you'll benefit from industry-leading programmes to help improve your skills and knowledge.

Communities are at the heart of our work. Together, our people are proud to be working towards a Net Zero Carbon future and regenerating cities across the UK. Read about more of the ways we're making a positive impact.

https://careers.snclavalin.com/csr
 
To help you get the most out of life in and outside of work, we offer employees "Total Reward." It's a package that can be tailored to your changing lifestyle, career and personal needs. You'll enjoy benefits such as fitness funding, leadership training, professional accreditations, and career planning for any stage of your career.

Making sure you're supported is important to us. So if you identify as having a disability, tell us ahead of your interview. And let's talk through any adjustments you might need.

YourReward at SNC-Lavalin (snclavalin.com).
 
Faithful+Gould, a member of the SNC-Lavalin Group, is a leading international consultancy with over 70 years of integrated project and programme management expertise. With us, you'll be surrounded by the skills and support to develop in ways that work for you. You'll be trusted to play a vital role in the organisation while making a tangible difference to the world and our future.

https://careers.snclavalin.com/faithful-gould

https://careers.snclavalin.com/
 
This role may require security clearance and offers of employment will be dependent on obtaining the relevant level of clearance. If this is necessary, it will be discussed with you at interview. If applying to this role please do not make reference to (in conversation) or include in your application or CV, details of any current or previously held security clearance.
 
We are committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive community - a place where we can all be ourselves, thrive and develop. To help embed inclusion for all, from day one, we offer a range of family friendly, inclusive employment policies, flexible working arrangements and employee networks to support staff from different backgrounds. As an Equal Opportunities Employer, we value applications from all backgrounds, cultures and ability.

title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Do you want to work for a company that provides innovative high quality data on projects that really matter such as offshore renewable energy?
 
Are you ready to extend your technical knowledge and experience by delivering crucial projects that help shape our marine environment?
 
Hereat ABPmer we are currently recruiting for a GIS Analyst, based at our Town Quay office in Southampton with hybrid working.
 
This is a technical role that involves contributing to and managing a diverse range of projects across the coastal and marine space. You will be responsible for handling and working on a range of spatial data outputs whilst working closely with colleagues within the Data Team and the wider project team.
 
The work we do in the GIS team is crucial to our clients and partners. Our success depends on our people performing at their highest level. That is why learning and development is the cornerstone of ABPmer. You will have the opportunity to work on a range of diverse and exciting projects in different sectors such as renewables, Government and marine conservation, and have the chance to further develop your knowledge and expertise.
 
For this role you will have a degree in a relevant marine or GIS field including a good understanding of the marine environment. You will also have some relevant practical experience in processing and analysing data in a consultancy or regulatory background.
 
You will also need to be an organised, and self-motivated individual, with good data analytical and engaging visualisation and presentation skills.
 
We offer a competitive salary, hybrid working and excellent benefits including 26 days holiday (plus bank holidays), private healthcare and dental plan, annual bonus, holiday purchase scheme, excellent pension, electric vehicle lease scheme and lots of employee discount offers!
 
The health and happiness of our employees is meaningful to us. This value is reflected in our extensive benefits programme, supporting the physical, mental and financial wellbeing of our colleagues.
 
What will you be doing?
 
Analysis and interpretation of 2D and 3D spatial data
Data management
Providing technical support on a wide range of projects
Project management and client engagement
Working with ESRI web applications and data services
Report writing and presentations
Contributing to internal research and team development initiatives


 
What skills and experience will you have?
 
Experience of ESRI software products, including ArcGIS Desktop and ArcGIS Pro
Data processing and GIS analytical experience in the coastal and marine environment
Strong technical analysis and cartographic skills
The ability to work efficiently and effectively manage multiple project deadlines
Proven experience in managing data quality and quality control of outputs
Excellent report writing, presentation and communication skills


 
 
Experience in any of the following would be great but is not essential:
 
Coding proficiency in Python, ESRI Python APIs and ModelBuilder
Practical experience working with ArcGIS Online and ArcGIS Enterprise applications
Proficiency with relational databases (MS SQL Server) and SQL queries
Working understanding of ArcGIS extensions (3D Analyst, Spatial Analyst)
Competence with Excel formulae and VBA/macros
Delivering GIS related training
Knowledge of R, CAD or OpenSource GIS software.


 
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

job_desc:
About Noon
 
At Noon, we believe in Student First in everything we do. That’s why we’ve built a global social learning platform that radically changes the way people learn, with the aim of positively impacting millions of students across the globe and bringing education to everyone.
 
Our open platform is loved by 10+ million students across 8 countries and is growing all the time – our aim is to radically transform the lives of 50+ million learners by 2023! Our students use Noon every day to engage with live interactive classes and gamified peer learning features, study with celebrity teachers, and compete and socialise with their friends.
 
We are a distributed company with a collaborative culture. We come from a diverse set of backgrounds and countries, enabling us to work at a global scale whilst bringing local impact by being a part of the communities we serve. As a fast-paced, innovative scaling business, our ability to learn at speed is powered by our obsession with our “student-first” culture that ultimately defines what we do and why we do it. Our principles: Student first, Never Deprive a Learner, Be Better Everyday, Be original, Own It & Be Bold. These values got us to where we are today, and they’re a big part of what we’re looking for in you.
 
What you will do
 
As a Data Analyst embedded into the Product team, you will play a key role in shaping the student experience on Noon. Specifically, you will:
 
 
Work closely with feature teams to develop the right metric to focus on, and help the team set an ambitious goal (OKR) against this metric
Identify user needs through usage pattern analysis to help feature teams focus on areas of highest opportunity
Work closely with stakeholders across engineering, product, design, and UX research to drive product decisions
Design experiments that will enable feature teams to make effective product decisions, and help teams evaluate the results of these experiments
Cultivate a data-driven culture throughout the organisation by exposing data through Tableau and Superset dashboards for internal stakeholders to view on-demand
Identify opportunities to automate manual processes
Work closely with the data engineering team to shape the overall data strategy for the company
Manage and mentor other data analysts across the organisation.


 
About you
 
 
Numerical/Analytical minded (degree in a numerical subject is preferred)
Minimum 3 years of experience as a data analyst, ideally working on consumer-facing products
Proficient in SQL or similar data querying languages
Experience with dashboarding/ reporting tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc
Excellent stakeholder and time management skills
Experience with owning multiple projects from start to finish
Experience with experimentation (A/B testing), eg Firebase, Mixpanel
Familiarity with statistical analysis in Python, R, Matlab.


 
About the Benefits
 
You will be joining the world's first social learning platform where you can have a real impact in a smart, low-ego, multi-cultural team. We provide an environment where you can develop your skills and deliver meaningful work that matters. You’ll be able to enjoy a competitive salary as well as a full spectrum of generous perks and rewards:
 
 
Not a morning person? No problem! We offer flexitime and a great work-life balance, including 2-3 days working from home per week
25 days annual leave and Christmas office closure days on top
Generous pension scheme – Noon matches up to 5%
Full premium Private Medical Scheme including Family cover
Subscription to Perkbox
Income Protection and Life Assurance to help you to protect your future
Cycle to work scheme and commuter season ticket loan
A well-stocked fridge, plenty of snacks (some healthy, some not so healthy)
Regular social activities, including team outings in line with Covid-19 guidelines


 
Why work at Noon?
 
 
The opportunity to work within an innovative start up in its initial stages and help shape our success globally
Work with a team who believes in STUDENT FIRST, you will have an opportunity to build the first (BE ORIGINAL) Open Social Learning Platform that can impact millions of students across the globe
A working environment where you can look at things differently and challenge and offer solutions and that also offers you a freedom to commit ‘n’ number of first time mistakes – NEVER DEPRIVE A LEARNER
Complete ownership and responsibility for the success of your autonomous team across all scope of works – OWN IT and BE BOLD
An opportunity to work with a bunch of Young, Smart, Driven, and Dynamic people who are committed to go BEYOND SELF and solve business challenges
Work closely with the leadership team who live by the value of BE BETTER EVERYDAY to help grow an amazing organisation
Help us to build the future of education!


 
About Diversity & Inclusion
 
At Noon, we respect and value differences. We know that when people from different backgrounds and with different points of view work together, we create the most value – for our clients, our people, and society. We’re so lucky to live in a society where differences are celebrated, so we’d expect nothing less from our teams. That means whatever your race, religion, sexual orientation, or gender, this is a place to feel at home, express yourself freely, and make your mark. Noon is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of age, disability, gender identity, marital status, race, colour, ethnicity, religion, sex, national origin, or sexual orientation. We aim to be truly representative of the world and for each and every employee to feel respected.

job_desc:
Lloyd’s is the world’s leading insurance and reinsurance marketplace. We share the collective intelligence and risk sharing expertise of the market’s brightest minds, working together for a braver world.
 
Our role is to inspire courage, so tomorrow’s progress isn’t limited by today’s risks.
 
Our shared values: we are brave; we are stronger together; we do the right thing; guide what we do and how we act. If you share our values and our passion to build a future that’s more sustainable, resilient and inclusive, you’ll find a home at Lloyd’s – build a braver future with us.
 
Lloyd’s is the world’s leading insurance and reinsurance marketplace. We share the collective intelligence and risk sharing expertise of the market’s brightest minds, working together for a braver world.
 
Our role is to inspire courage, so tomorrow’s progress isn’t limited by today’s risks.
 
Our shared values: we are brave; we are stronger together; we do the right thing; guide what we do and how we act. If you share our values and our passion to build a future that’s more sustainable, resilient and inclusive, you’ll find a home at Lloyd’s – build a braver future with us.
 
Lloyd’s is seeking to recruit an MI Analyst (Actuarial) to provide analytical support to maintain oversight of syndicates, managing agents and members’ agents, via the development, operation and presentation of capital & reserving management information.
 
Market Reserving & Capital (MRC) is the actuarial department in the Corporation and is responsible for market oversight as regards monitoring the adequacy of reserves and capital at syndicate level, and for the calculation of capital requirements for members and the Central Fund.
 
Principal Accountabilities
 
You would be expected to support various aspects of the work, these could comprise of:
 
Develop and enhance MRC reports and processes:
 
Use SQL Server to manage our data.
 
Creating R scripts to automate data processes.
 
Encourage the use of GitHub within the MRC team.
 
Develop and maintain our suite of Business Objects reports.
 
Work with Data Analytics on the development of QlikSense applications.
 
Gather and analyse the data required for the projects and ad-hoc tasks including performing gap/ impact analysis in Excel (including VBA).
 
Provide wider support for the business:
 
Provide support to MRC and other teams across Lloyd’s including data analysis, as required.
 
Be a point of contact between the business (MRC), Group Technology and Data teams.
 
Assist MRC key datasets (Technical Provisions Data (TPD) and Gross Quarterly Data (GQD)):
 
Understand the reserving and wider datasets used by the reserving team
 
Assist in the collection and management of the key reserving data sets, the TPD and GQD, from the market.
 
Assist in the validation process of these key data sets, including communicating issues to the market.
 
Skills and Knowledge
 
Time management: Manage own time and delivery of tasks to meet deadlines, keep others informed of timescales for delivery and any delays in good time.
 
Analytical skills: Undertake detailed technical analysis under guidance.
 
Delivery: Work independently on clearly defined tasks to deliver high quality output that is checked for internal consistency and meets agreed deadlines.
 
Communication: Able to communicate to a range of stakeholders both inside and outside Lloyd's in person and in writing. Able to direct communications appropriately to others within the team.
 
Flexibility: Able to manage priorities on multiple projects simultaneously and communicate any issues arising.
 
Collaboration: Show respect and positive regard for others in every interaction.
 
Technical: Skills in data management and reporting software, for example SQL Server. Also, intermediate MS Office skills
 
Basic knowledge of insurance principles and practices would be beneficial but is not a requirement
 
Diversity and inclusion are a focus for us – Lloyd’s aim is to build a diverse, inclusive environment that reflects the global markets we work in. One where everyone is treated with dignity and respect to achieve their full potential. In practice, this means we are positive and inclusive about making workplace adjustments, we offer regular health and wellbeing programmes, diversity and inclusion training, employee networks, mentoring and volunteering opportunities as well as investment into your professional development. You can read more about diversity and inclusion on our
 
.
 
We understand that our work/life balance is important to us all and that a hybrid of working from the office and home can offer a great level of flexibility.  Flexible working forms part of a total reward approach which offers a host of other benefits over and above the standard offering (generous pension, healthcare, wellbeing etc).  These include financial support for training, education & development, a benefit allowance (to spend on our flexible benefits such as gym membership, dental insurance, extra holiday or to partake in our cycle to work scheme), employee recognition scheme and various employee discount schemes.
 
By choosing Lloyd's, you'll be part of a team that brings together the best minds in the industry, and together with our underwriters and brokers, we create innovative, responsive solutions allowing us to share risk and solve complex problems.
 
Should you require any additional support with your application, or any adjustments, please click the following link;
 
https://cleartalents.com/apply/lloyds-msa1645695881
 
Please note, clicking on this link does not register your application for the vacancy

job_desc:
We are working closely alongside a Local Authority in
 
Tower Hamlets
 
to assist with the appointment of a
 
Data Analyst
, on a
 
1 Year contract
, likely to be extended at clients discretion.
 
Please apply with your CV for immediate consideration. This is a brilliant opportunity to start working for public sector.
 
Summary
 
We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our transformation work aligning to our key improvement strategy - Improving Care Together. This is our vision to support adults to meet their goals, be connected to others and as independent as possible. This role will support our key workstreams linked to the ASC Transformation Board, enabling our projects to develop robust data insights that evidence the impact of key activity.
 
Role & Responsibilities
 
 
Research, collation, capture, store and publish evidence and datasets to support planning and decision making across the programme workstreams.
The post-holder will be required to research and identify external and internal datasets that could support the objectives of the programme workstreams.
The post-holder will be responsible for ensuring that these datasets are captured within Council systems and are accessible to colleagues on demand.
Work with other analysts to ensure that evidence and data is joined up and shared to support better planning and decision making. This will mean liaison with stakeholders across the council and with partner organisations as well as working to ensure that systems and processes enable effective sharing and joining-up of data, subject to considerations of data protection.
Work with the programme leads to design key performance indicators to reflect priority outcomes and build the necessary systems and processes to capture and report against these. This will include defining and documenting new performance indicators, ensuring that responsibilities for data generation and collation are clearly understood.
Develop systems and processes to efficiently capture, record, validate, analyse and report data against key performance indicators for the programme.
The post holder will also be responsible for ensuring that the relevant systems and processes are in place for efficient and secure data capture, storage and reporting.
Prepare cyclical and ad-hoc performance reports for the programme board, workstreams and projects. This will include development and drafting of performance dashboards using all available tools to ensure efficient and accurate reporting.
Provide support, guidance, advice and challenge to the programme in improving data quality and to ensure that programme performance is maximised.
 


 
Essential Criteria
 
 
Experience working within Adult Social Care data and transformation.
Good understanding of the Adult Social Care operating context.
Good working knowledge of data extraction tools, including Business Objects, SRSS and SQL.
Experience and working knowledge of R-Studio and Power BI.
Intermediate or advanced Microsoft Excel skills.
 


 
Please note:
 
 
You should be available to work immediately or at a short notice.
You should have right to work in U.K
 


 
Disclaimer
: Brackenberry Ltd is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy. We are committed to equality in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. Unless otherwise stated all of our roles are temporary, though assignments can be and often are, extended by clients on a longer term basis and can sometimes become permanent.
 
Important
: We will interpret your application as being permission to submit your CV to this role (with the right to represent you) unless you advise us to the contrary.
 
Your DBS must be either through us or be accompanied by a subscription to the DBS updating service.

title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
RMSI is a global leader in geospatial and engineering solutions. These solutions address global issues of climate change, natural calamities, human habitation, food security, autonomous transportation, smart utilities and networks.
RMSI is one of the largest geospatial employers with an employee base of over 5000 resources and is consistently ranked amongst the top companies to work for. RMSI has three states of the art development centers in India, at Noida, Hyderabad and Dehradun and five fully owned international subsidiaries in US, Canada, Australia, UK, and Middle East.
RMSI is a CMMI Level 5 assessed and ISO 27001 & ISO 9001:2015 certified company. Adopting these standards ensures that we provide the highest levels of software development processes and information security to our clients. RMSI has also achieved IS0 14001:2015 (for compliance of Environmental Management System) and ISO 45001:2018 certification (for compliance of Occupational Health and Safety Management).
 
Role: Technical Lead
 
The Technical Lead is responsible for leading Data Technicians and Technical Support resources to deliver high quality, consistent and repeatable Desktop Investigation, Data Analysis and Data Correction to Scottish Power Energy Networks Asset Data. This will involve setting and managing to time and quality various tasks which are required to effectively deliver workstreams assigned, ensuring working is carried out to defined project parameters. This will be undertaken as part of the Network Data Improvement Programme (NDIP)
 
Job Responsibilities
 
• Preparing Documentation for Workstream Stage Gate sign off
• Allocating work
• Answering queries on Workstreams
• Assisting with the creation of business rules and process flows
 
The successful applicants will be self-motivated, able to work well as part of a team, as well as on their own initiative and be able to adhere to strict deadlines.
 
Key skills for the role are:
1.Using defined requirements set out within the stage gate framework, becomes the subject matter expert for assigned workstreams, leading and defining on project documentation with support from technical support.
2. Leads on assigning tasks to technical support resource relating to the setup of pre/post production desktop data investigation, analysis and correction work packages, ensuring timely delivery as set out by Project Manager.
3. Leads on assigning tasks and managing performance levels with data technicians related to workstreams/work packages, in conjunction with Technical Support resource to ensure timely delivery as set out by Project Manager.
4. Leads on and performs data investigation and analysis of asset data, drawing valid inferences to suggest business rules. Seeks authorization and acceptance through presenting outputs successfully to management and SPEN asset data experts using appropriate tools and formats.
5. As part of the stage gate process, Prepares / formats working spreadsheets to be completed by the project Production and Quality Assurance teams.
6. Supports the project manager to track progress by ensuring a fit for purpose, auditable and current view is maintained throughout the project lifecycle.
7. Highlights risks and issues of assigned workstream to Project Manager
8. Seeks technical guidance for task delivery from Project Analyst with line management from Project Manager
9. Works in line with agreed project process flows to allow timely authorisation of project workstream documentation
10. As necessary, supports Project Manager in maintaining cross business working relationship with project stakeholders through meeting attendance and forums, specifically:
a. Data Management Teams
b. RTS PowerOn Teams
c. Asset Management Business Leads
d. Project Network Engineer
11. Produces and delivers training documentation and group training related to assigned workstream.
12. Supports Project Manager with provision of information to enable delivery planning in terms of timescales and resources requirements.
13. Interfaces with other staff members to promote efficient work management, consistency and adherence in standards, procedures and processes to develop a culture of completion.
14. Ensuring the provision of adequate and timely MI reporting and production, including any additional requests from Project Manager.
15. Performs other project related duties as required by Project Manager and Portfolio Manager.
 
Technical Requirement:
Extensive knowledge of ESRI, SAP, Power On and Excel.

job_desc:
Data Analyst
Inside IR35 Contract
Leeds, West Yorkshire – Hybrid working
 
An exciting opportunity for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to work for a leading consumer brand on a major transformation programming, support the Data Analytics Manager in delivering impactful and actionable insights that drive growth.
 
As a Data Analyst, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyse data, identify trends and opportunities, and develop data-driven strategies. You will also own and develop digital analytics tools to monitor and analyst data, identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
 
Working as part of an established but growing Data Analytics function, the Data Analyst will also be responsible for building reports and dashboards to communicate insights to key stakeholders, as well as identifying areas of data improvement and working with the Data Analytics Manager to implement solutions.
 
Data Analyst – Key Requirements:
 
Significant experience working as a Data Analyst within a highly commercial or customer focused environment
Strong experience with web analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and Adobe Experience Platform (AEP)
Proficiency in at least one programming language such as JavaScript, Python, or SQL
Experience with customer data platforms (CDP) and attribution modeling
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms such as Microsoft Azure would be beneficial
Experience working in the retail or eCommerce sector would be advantageous
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic digital environment
Experience working with large volumes of data / big data
 
This role will be based out of the client’s head office in Leeds, though they operate a hybrid working policy, with the expectation to be on-site only when the role and responsibilities require it.
 
We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
We strongly encourage applications from people of colour, the LGBTQ+ community, people with disabilities, neurodivergent people, parents and people from lower socio-economic backgrounds. If there’s anything we can do to make adjustments for you in the hiring process, please don’t hesitate to let us know. We’re intentional about building a diverse, inclusive and equitable environment. Check out our diversity, equity and inclusion statement.
 
Looking to do work that matters?
 
We get it – it’s why most people come to Cleo. Together we’re fighting for the world’s financial health, building an AI that helps our users make the best money decisions from day one. We’ve helped 5 million people so far with personalised insights and a voice you don’t expect in FinTech. But it’s time to do more.

As we enter the next phase, we’re looking for more improvisers, data geeks and grown ups who want to own their work and create meaningful change.
 
The team
 
You’ll join the existing data science function here at Cleo; a thoughtful and collaborative team of 10 dedicated data scientists, ML engineers, and analysts with significant industry experience that is at the heart of everything we do at Cleo. You’ll build and deploy production models that developers will feed directly into the product.

This position is essential in the expansion of both product and business. We are highly data driven, whether that be understanding natural language, deriving insights from financial data, or determining which financial product is best suited to a user. We have interesting problems to solve on an ever-increasing scale

Here's a great blog post on how data science works at Cleo!

You’ll be working on a hugely impactful workstream, helping us understand our users' finances, so we can coach them through the power of chat. You’ll be working as part of a cross functional team to develop Cleo into a hyper-personalized financial coach.
 
 
Improving our current machine learning models
Actively building and productionising classifiers - no dependencies on engineering teams
Working to implement and utilize GPT, to continue developing our hyper-personalized AI assistant
 
A wide range of ML tasks: classification, recommender systems, NLP
Finding opportunities for model and product improvements in Cleo's extensive datasets of chat conversations, spending patterns, and app interactions
 


 
At least 3 years of experience in data science or related roles
Commercial experience of deep learning, NLP and text analysis
Ability to write production quality code in Python and SQL
Experience deploying machine learning / deep learning algorithms into production
Experience conducting large scale A/B experiments
A strong ability to communicate findings to non-technical stakeholders in a concise and engaging manner
Experience with NLP methods
 


Nice to have
 
 
Experience with containers and container orchestration: Kubernetes, Docker, and/or Mesos, including lifecycle management of containers
Experience working with AWS technologies such as EC2, S3, Sagemaker
 


What do you get for all your hard work?
 
 
Salary banding can be seen here. You'll also have equity options. You can view our progression framework and salary bandings here: https://cleo-ai.progressionapp.com/ - This role would be from level DS3 depending on experience
 
Work at one of the fastest growing tech startups, backed by top VC firms, Balderton & EQT Ventures
Cleo is a culture of stepping up. We want, and expect you to grow and develop. That means trying new things, leading others, challenging the status quo and owning your impact. You’ll have our support in everything you do. But more importantly, you’ll have our trust.
We treat you as humans first, employees second. Because we can’t fight for the world’s financial health, if we’re not healthy ourselves. This means the usual perks but it also means flexibility.
Other benefits include;
 
 
Check out our new benefits package here: https://web.meetcleo.com/blog/big-benefits-energy-the-latest-cleo-employee-benefits
25 days annual leave a year + public holidays (+ an additional day for every year you spend at Cleo)
401k matching in the US and 6% employer-matched pension in the UK
2 months paid sabbatical after 4 years at Cleo!
Early finish every Friday
Regular socials and activities, online and in-person
Online mental health support via Spill
And many more!
 




UK App access:
 
The Cleo app is no longer downloadable in the UK (but only until next year). If you’re an existing user, you’ll still have access to the app. But some features won’t be available (just for a little while). Why? 99% of our users are based in the US – where financial health is often overlooked. We’ve decided to shift our focus to where we can provide the most value and make the greatest impact for users who need it most. Then we’ll be able to apply what we learn to better support our UK users in the future. Check out this page for more information.
title: Data Scientist - Chat

job_desc:
About Us
 
The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.
 
You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.
 
Allstate operate a very flexible hybrid working policy that will allow you to design your working week in collaboration with your manager with a blend of remote and office working for NI based employees as well as condensed working patterns (4 day week/9 day fortnight).
 
Join our team and you’ll find challenge and reward in a culture of innovation, support and balance.
 
 
Location
 
 
Belfast/Derry-Londonderry/Strabane
 
 
Your role in the team
 
 
The Data Marketplace team is a crucial team within Allstate Technology and Strategic Ventures. It is driving critical data governance and cataloging across the enterprise to truly transform data-driven decision-making at Allstate.
 
The Data Marketplace Adoption role propels enterprise-wide adoption of the Data Marketplace’s automated data management and data access provisioning solutions. The Data Marketplace suite of tools encompasses both vended and internally developed solutions. These include an enterprise data catalog to inventory Allstate’s most critical data assets and data standardization tools used to build Allstate’s data structures and manage reference data.
 
As part of the team, you will have a strong product mindset coupled with excellent communication skills. You will provide innovative thinking and education to enable solutioning and onboarding of our customers. The successful candidate will promote and drive adoption of data management capabilities with data inventory, data privacy compliance, and data quality impacts. You will do this through understanding and knowledge across the products ‘how they work and are used’ and will be a key driver in connecting the dots to effectively influence and deliver prioritized business outcomes.
 
Responsibilities
 
 
 
Proactively contribute, communicate, and commit to the common vision of the enterprise strategy of treating data as a corporate asset
 
 
Facilitate information gathering sessions to onboard and support our customers, ensuring adherence to data governance standards and best practices within expected timeframes
 
 
Partner with stakeholders and other information analysts to translate business requirements to enable data management capabilities with data inventory, data privacy compliance, and data quality impacts
 
 
Develop and author data management process documentation to educate the customer on best practices, providing guidance and recommendations on implementation
 
 
Establish priorities and address conflicts between peers
 
 
Identify technology and process constraints. Partner with other information analysts to mitigate issues and risks ensuring the team and the work improves and delivers.
 
 
Manage work through effective planning. Outline objectives, timelines, risks, and deliverables, ensuring priority and timely execution and delivery for the most important work
 
 
Consistent self-directed development to build skillset and knowledge establishing yourself as a subject matter expert (SME) for data management, data governance, and data privacy best practices
 


 
 
So, what are the essential criteria to apply?
 
 
 
 
All candidates must evidence an existing right to work in the UK
 
 
1+ years business experience working within Information Technology. Preferably within data, data analysis, data platform, or data management
 
 
Strong experience using Office365 and SharePoint
 
 
Project management skills with ability to drive decisions, prioritize delivery and influence those around you
 
 
Excellent communication skills with ability to clearly communicate project decisions, structure, document, and drive cohesive partnerships.
 


 
 
We also have some desirable criteria
 
 
 
 
A degree level qualification (or equivalent) in a discipline such as Business, Math, Computer Science, Data Science
 
 
Previous experience as an Information Analyst
 
 
Experience working within agile methodologies
 
 
Experience utilizing Power BI
 
 
Exposure to data governance, metadata management, and data privacy compliance principles
 
 
Experience working with data management tools such as: Informatica Axon, Informatica Enterprise Data Catalog, Informatica Data Privacy Manager, Collibra Data Intelligence, Alation Data Catalog Platform, Atlas, Infosphere
 


 
What We Offer
 
As Digital DNA’s Workplace of the Year 2020 & 2022 winners, we offer a generous benefits package that includes flexible annual leave entitlement, dental and healthcare insurance, an attractive pension package and discounts on gym memberships, public transport and parking.
 
Allstate invests heavily in your development, as an employee you will have access to multiple world-class learning platforms and courses from our award-winning in-house Learning & Development team.
 
We pride ourselves in providing clear career paths and opportunities for internal mobility allowing you to further develop within the organisation.
 
We encourage a better work life balance and you’ll have the opportunity to apply for various flexible working arrangements.
 
 
Statement on Fair Employment and Equal Opportunities
 
 
Allstate NI wishes to ensure equal opportunity is given to all job applicants. This company will not discriminate on the grounds of race, gender (including gender reassignment status), sexual orientation, religious belief, political opinion, marital status, age or disability.
 
We are an equal opportunities employer. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons. However, as women are currently under-represented in our workforce, we would particularly welcome applications from women. All appointments will be made on merit.
 
Applicants should note Allstate NI complete AccessNI background checks on all candidates offered a position.
 
 
The closing date for receipt of applications is Tuesday 21st February 2023
title: Data & Information Analyst (hybrid)

job_desc:
Data Visualisation Analyst - Tableau - Alteryx - 12 months contract - Hybrid working
We are seeking an experienced Data Visualisation Analyst with strong Alteryx and Tableau skills to join JP Morgan in Bournemouth on an initial 12 months contract. There may be a potential to work the role from one of the London offices but Bournemouth is the preference.
 
You will work with the Workforce Insights Area Product Manager to help define high-impact, long-term strategies to build world-class teams in two of JPMC’s largest tech-centric groups. You will use your data wrangling skills, creativity, and close collaboration with senior stakeholders to support the organization in data-driven decision-making across the employee lifecycle. The ideal candidate will quickly grasp complex business problems and convert them into data solutions. You are equally comfortable spending your day analyzing a complex data set, building a dashboard, and ideating on the underlying business problem.
 
Key Responsibilities:
 
Create dashboards and reports that answer key questions about technology talent and workforce strategy
Be resourceful and creative in finding and analyzing data
Be the expert on internal people-related data and find data-driven solutions to stakeholders' problems
Communicate to non-technical partners about actionable insights and analytical methods
Automate tasks and add efficiencies to traditional data processes
Collaborate with multiple teams and navigate unstructured, ambiguous environments
Drive end-to-end projects independently while managing stakeholder expectations
Guide your peers and partners in developing their data fluency and analytical skills


 
The ideal candidate for this role:
 
Professional experience as an Analyst in a business intelligence role

Advanced understanding of data analysis and visualization tools specifically Excel, Tableau and Alteryx.

Exhibits strong problem-solving skills

Influences others to achieve goals
Can confidently and quickly make decisions
Operates with great attention to detail
Executes with high quality at a rapid pace
Has a passion for people and data


 
Preferred qualifications
 
Experience with people analytics projects
Experience with statistics and data science techniques


 
 
*Please note that this role will work on a hybrid model of 3 days in the office and 2 days work from home. When working from home you will require your own PC/Laptop*

What Will I Be Doing In This Role?

title: Junior Data Scientist

job_desc:
This clients mission is to establish the foremost Business Visa and Document Procurement company globally. They are leveraging top-tier expertise, cutting-edge technology, and extensive knowledge to deliver the industry's premier travel document management program to their clients.
 
Their team thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced, and visionary setting, and is deeply committed to providing unparalleled customer service with a combination of expertise and dedication.
 
As a Data Analyst, you will have the critical responsibility of maintaining and managing specific data within our Dynamics 365 CRM platform. In close collaboration with our research teams, you will ensure that records within our CRM accurately reflect changing requirements. Your role will encompass mapping data between the CRM and external systems that generate business documents, and integrating them into new and existing RPA processes. You will also leverage your expertise in XML language, utilising it within Dynamics CRM to create queries that enable data mapping and export.
 
To succeed in this role, a strong attention to detail is essential, along with the ability to work effectively with remote teams globally. You will work with technologies such as ActivePDF and DocumentCorePack to produce intricate documents, driven by the data stored within the CRM. Your role will require a keen interest and aptitude for data handling and technical problem solving.
 
Responsibilities:
 
 
Collaborate with internal research teams to update data stored in the CRM system in response to changes in visa processes and requirements.
Develop an understanding of the Microsoft Dataverse data structure and its mapping to fields within the CRM and our customer-facing portal.
Apply XML to map data fields from the CRM system to fields on web-based government portals or PDF application forms, allowing the fields to be leveraged by RPA processes.
Identify and report discrepancies between the fields captured within our CRM and the data required for visa application processes to relevant teams.
Analyze large data sets to identify discrepancies and recommend best practices for maintaining data effectively across all systems.
Use data contained within the CRM to generate or modify letters/forms with ActivePDF or DocsCorePack.
Conduct testing on data mapping and document creation to ensure accurate results, working closely with IT and research teams.
Communicate the outcomes of testing to other teams within the business.


 
The Ideal Candidate will possess the following qualifications:
 
 
A comprehensive knowledge of MS Office applications, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
Proven experience in data mapping, entry, and upkeep.
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to gather, structure, and evaluate data.
Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Comfortable working remotely and in virtual environments.
Knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM/Dataverse and reporting tools such as PowerBI is an advantage.
Capability to analyze large data sets and present findings in a concise format.
Aptitude for comprehending business processes and the impact that data has within these processes.
Previous experience with tools like ActivePDF, DocumentCorePack, and XRM Toolbox is also advantageous.


They are offering a competitive salary of up to £35K depending on experience plus benefits. This is a Hybrid role based in their Sheffield office asking you to go into the office 3 days a week.
 
If this sounds like the role for you apply now!
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
London (Hybrid Working)

Permanent

Full Time

Grade 3
 
Our passion at Currys is helping everyone enjoy the latest tech. We’re proud of the service levels we provide for our customer – online, in-store or in their homes. And it’s all down to our people, 30,000+ capable and committed colleagues, learning together, growing together, making us amazing and celebrating the wins.

Do you have a logical approach to problem solving? An inquisitive mind that doesn't take facts at face value? Are you able to clearly communicate sophisticated ideas to non-experts? We're looking for applicants who can answer yes to all of these questions.

The Digital Analyst will perform a robust, statistics-led approach to developing new frameworks for effectively evaluating the impact of A/B test experiences on customer journey and personalisation campaign. The role will develop machine learning models to segment user behaviours to support personalisation. Communicating performance on a macro scale and looking at contributing factors that are changing the customer experience and financial performance.
 
Key Role Responsibilities
 
 
Apply advanced statistical analysis, such as correlation, regression, for data validation or performance review
Provide data analysis and interpretation for model implementations, continue testing, and evaluation of the results
Build machine learning models to determine the behavioural triggers which premeditate certain user behaviours as intent to purchases, product category preference
Combine data sources into custom reports and dashboards, diagnosing problems to provide actionable insights
Liaise with the Optimisation team to ensure appropriate measurement, tracking and understanding of test results, and how they influence the wider business
 


Key Skills, Qualifications & Experience
 
 
Numerical and analytical skills, capable of using multiple data sources to analyse complex problems, identify cause and effect and deliver insightful and practical solutions
Strong problem-solving and creative skills and the ability to exercise good judgment and make decisions based on accurate and timely analysis
Working with large data sets and using quantitative analysis/modelling to drive business results
Experience with Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics
Experience with coding languages or process automation tools such as SQL, Python, git
Experience with Cloud (preferably Google Cloud Platform)
Degree or equivalent in Science in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or related subject
Visualisation tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Google Data Studio.
 


We’re one team and we celebrate all of the great things you do. One way we show our gratitude is by giving you access to a range of lifestyle benefits including:
 
 
Competitive pension scheme
Access to discretionary company bonus scheme
Life Assurance
Staff discounts and offers
Employee assistance programme
Cycle to work scheme
Hybrid working; arrangements will depend on your role and business requirements. You could be working from our primary Currys Campus at Waterloo (WeWork), meeting & collaborating at Currys regional workspaces or working from home.
 


Beyond that, we'll be with you every step of the way, enabling you to get the most out of your role. We're building a team that brings technology to people, making their lives better, easier and fuller, and you can be part of it.

job_desc:
Data Analyst (Freight Invoicing)
 
 
Location: Corby (
 
 
 
Hybrid)
 
 
Employment Type: Permanent
 
 
About the role:
 
RS Components spends over £60M per annum on global freight. As part of the Transport strategy, we have identified that we have an opportunity to reduce costs through greater control of the freight invoices from our transport providers. The Freight Invoicing Specialist is responsible for processing transport invoices and will be accountable for ensuring that savings are delivered through validation of spend with transport providers.

The role will receive and process the outputs from the Freight Bill Audit engine as well as manually validate some invoices. You will work with our transport providers to reach resolution of invoicing issues (e.g. invoice inaccuracy and identifying opportunities for service credits) and working with the broader transport optimisation team and our Managed Service transport provider, Kuehne & Nagel.
 
 
What you will do:
 
 
 
Receive and review outputs from the Freight Bill Audit Engine
 
 
Manual validation of some invoices
 
 
Manual validation of duty and tax invoices to support customs compliance team
 
 
Recommend payments for approved invoices, dispute challenged invoices with logistics service providers
 
 
Raise requests for credits/service credits for incorrect billings and under target performance
 
 
Ensure that appropriate parties are informed of resolutions – to include other members of the transport team, logistics service providers, accounts payable etc.
 
 
Initiate and lead transport cost savings activities
 


 
What we’re looking for:
 
 
 
Excellent analytical skills
 
 
Proactive and can meet deadlines under challenging work pressure.
 
 
Experience of the freight Industry
 
 
Attention to details to quickly spot out wrong billings
 
 
Good communication skills
 
 
Experience in stakeholder relationship management
 
 
Good Excel skills
 


 
A bit about you:
 
 
Nothing gets past you
 
 
– You possess hawk-like attention to detail and you take immense pride in your work, whether it’s copywriting and proofreading, ensuring branding and messaging is in line with the company brand to find the latest news and stories
 
 
You can Plan and React
 
 
– You understand the importance of timing, when to move fast on a trending hot topic, or when to plan in advance content that supports national events or recruitment activity.
 
 
You have Energy
 
 
– You approach your work with enthusiasm, positivity, and willingness to deliver the best results, whatever the challenge.
 
 
We are RS Group.
 
RS Group is a global integrated omni-channel solutions partner for industrial B2B customers who design, build, and maintain industrial equipment and operations. We are a FTSE 100 company with £2 billion in revenue, operating in 32 countries, shipping 60,000 parcels a day to over 1.2 million customers worldwide.

Our Vision is to be first choice for all our stakeholders, and we know that starts with our people. At RS we want everyone to show up to work as themselves and know that they will be supported and encouraged to develop and grow. We want work to be a place that excites and empowers, a place where you can be passionate and challenge people to think differently.

We want to hire the best talent, people who share our values and understand that when we act with respect and humility, we can do great things. That’s why we’ve put our purpose at the heart of our organisation, we want to make amazing happen for a better world. We empower our people to make a difference, innovate to make more possible and deliver to make it happen.
 
 
Are you ready to explore the possibilities?
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Location: South Yorkshire - relocation assistance and package on offer
Working Model: Office based
Salary: £33,000 - £40,000 PA + benefits
 
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Marketing Data Analyst to join a global sportswear brand. Our client produces market-leading performance products in conjunction with our team of elite athletes, coaches and sports scientists.
 
OVERVIEW.
 
Are you a talented Marketing Data Analyst with a passion for translating data into actionable insights that drive business strategy? Do you enjoy collaborating with brand teams to blend the art of the creative with the science of data to optimise results? In this newly created role you’ll have the opportunity to build the data infrastructure and strategy from the ground up. You’ll play an integral role in the next phase of a rapidly expanding and highly respected nimble business and you’ll be a crucial player in a dynamic, creative and entrepreneurial team.
 
WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING.
 
Working closely with the Brand Director you will lay the foundations that will lead to the long term success of the data and overall business strategy and will:
 
• Conduct an exhaustive audit of the brand’s data asset across all available sources and report back findings and recommendations.
• Report on the suitability of current systems and softwares and identify opportunities for data consolidation.
• Recommend a tailored CRM, software and infrastructure solutions that will enable the business to achieve its objectives in the short, medium and long term.
• Architect and implement CRM, software and infrastructure solutions and design and embed new business processes to support the data strategy.
• Ensure GDPR compliance.
 
Once the foundations have been laid you will:
 
• Use your expertise to turn data into actionable insights that will inform and focus the strategy and identify key wins that will drive business success.
• Turn your insights into action by informing each piece of the marketing strategy; from the type of content being produced to its duration, when it is deployed and how often and how it is measured.
• Clean and validate the brand's data asset and develop acquisition, retention and reactivation strategies.
• Help define the brand’s key performance indicators and design reports to track the business’s performance.
• Design and report on campaign performance, across all touch points (social, eDM, web traffic etc)
• Conduct A/B creative testing across all channels (ecommerce site, eDM, social etc) to inform the optimisation of all communications.
• Use real-time insights to measure, refine and optimise the performance of all channels
• Take the lead on the brand’s eDM strategy by briefing, building, deploying and reporting on email marketing campaigns.
• Design data segmentation models to allow tailored customer communication.
• Design and implement an effective, engaging and lucrative trigger and events strategy.
• Work with stakeholders in other departments (customer service, ecommerce, retail etc) to develop a single customer view.
• Constantly iterate, measure, report and refine.
 
WHAT YOU’LL NEED.
 
• Knowledge or experience of SQL, R, VBA, Python, Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.
• To excel at Excel
• Proven experience in designing and delivering data strategies and actionable insights that have driven commercial success.
• The initiative to work to a broad brief and identify commercial opportunities in the data, translate the data into insights and translate the insights into action in the form of a winning strategy.
 
Hands-on experience with MarTech tools such as Google Analytics, Magento, Shopify, MailChimp etc.
• Proven ability to operate within the GDPR framework, seeking opportunities to further increase trust with the customer.
• The ability to communicate complex data and insights to a varied audience.
• Experience of use large or complex datasets and maintaining and developing data modelling processes
• Proven experience delivering marketing data & analytics solutions to B2C eCommerce brands
• Experience delivering CRO & attribution modelling solutions
• Experience implementing visualisation solutions e.g. Tableau, Qlik or similar
• Experience & knowledge operating across CRM, Data Strategy & Campaign Management
• Excellent project management and communication skills including the ability to influence stakeholders

Data Analyst
 
We have an exciting new opportunity with an incredible fast-growing company who are looking for a self-motivated Data Analyst to take ownership of their data strategy.

job_desc:
Join us as a Data Analyst
 
 
Take on a new challenge in a cutting edge data team, in which you'll manage the analysis of complex bank, franchise or function data to identify business issues and opportunities
We'll look to you to provide high quality analytical input to help develop and implement innovative processes and resolve problems across the bank
This is a hands on role in which you'll hone your data analysis expertise and gain valuable experience in a dynamic area of our business
 


What You'll Do
 
As a Data Analyst, you'll play a key role in supporting the delivery of high quality business solutions. You'll be performing data extraction, storage, manipulation, processing and analysis, alongside developing and performing standard queries to ensure data quality and identify data inconsistencies and missing data.

Day-to-day, you'll also be:
 
 
Collecting, profiling and mapping appropriate data to use in new or existing solutions as well as for ongoing data activities
Identifying and documenting data migration paths and processes, standardising data naming, data definitions and modelling
Interpreting customer needs and turning them strategic analysis projects, functional or data requirements and process models
 
Building and maintaining collaborative partnerships with key business stakeholders
 


The Skills You'll Need
 
We're looking for someone with experience of using data analysis tools and delivering data analysis in a technology or IT function. You'll also need a strong understanding of data usage and dependencies with wider teams and the end customer, as well as a proven track record in extracting value and features from large scale data and an ability to talk to people at all levels of the business and make the complex simple.

We'll also look for:
 
 
An in-depth understanding of the interrelationships of data and multiple data domains
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Strong experience in data analysis and reporting with extensive experience of Python, SQL, PowerBI or similar tooling
Proficient understanding of cloud data solutions and principles
Experience of Synapse, Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory, highly desirable
