job_desc:
Data Analyst
Leeds, West Yorkshire
1 to 2 days in the office per week
 
About the Data Analyst role:
 
We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst professional with a passion for using data to drive business decisions to work on an exciting customer-driven data transformation programme. As a member of the data insight and analytics team, the successful Data Analyst will work closely with colleagues from various departments to understand key business processes and design, implement, and maintain data models to optimize these processes.
 
Reporting into the Data Analytics Manager, the Data Analyst will be responsible for collaborating with stakeholders to understand data requirements and identify areas for improvement, whilst also designing and building data models that drive insights and support decision-making.
 
Utilising a combination of technical and commercial experience, the Data Analyst will also be tasked with querying and manipulating large datasets to extract and clean data for model input, working the across the full life cycle of data models, including monitoring and maintenance
 
Data Analyst – Key Requirements:
 
 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with SQL and other data manipulation or reporting tools (e.g. Power BI, Alteryx, Tableau, etc.)
Familiarity with data modeling and data architecture concepts
Good communication and stakeholder management skills
Ability to work with non-technical stakeholders and bridge the gap between technical and business needs to drive value and insight from data


 
Data Analyst – Benefits:
 
 
Competitive basic salary
7% company bonus scheme
Enhanced contributory pension
Free parking
25 days holiday (plus bank holidays)
Excellent career progression and training
Flexible working hours & location
Additional lifestyle perks


 
This Data Analyst role offers huge opportunities for growth and professional development, as well as the chance to be part of a team driving the company's data-driven transformation, all whilst working for a highly successful people-focused business.
 
We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Does working for Multi-National Lottery Operator with a market-leading presence in Austria, the Czech Republic, Greece, Cyprus, and Italy sound like the perfect place of employment for you?
Over the next two years we are going to embark on a large-scale transformation journey, unparalleled in the existing market, and a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for anyone both within and outside the betting and gaming industry. They can’t talk too much about their plans – you’ll have to speak to us to find out more – but they can promise a fast-paced, exciting environment, innovative projects like none you have worked on before, and the opportunity to transform a core pillar of the UK economy, while contributing to good causes that benefit society.
 
Job Description:
Data Analyst - Full Time - Hybrid
 
 
 
Join our journey to create a new experience for the National Lottery and help us to power change for the greater good.
About us:
Allwyn UK is part of Allwyn Entertainment Group – a multi-national lottery operator with a market-leading presence in Austria, the Czech Republic, Greece, Cyprus, and Italy. In 2022, Allwyn was selected in a Government tender as the Preferred Applicant to operate the UK’s National Lottery from February 2024.
 
Over the next two years we are embarking on a largescale transformation journey to build a bigger, better and safer National Lottery that delivers more money to Good Causes. Once-in-a-lifetime opportunities exist for people from within and outside the betting and gaming industry to join us play a part in giving the National Lottery a fresh start
 
Role Purpose:
Working in the Commercial team that are data and insight driven – proactively supporting all team members across the product team and working closely with the Consumer Insights Manager. Also working as part of the wider team executing on the Transition plan for Consumer Insights.
 
This role will be focused on data analysis for product but may at times be asked to support analysis needs for other areas such as marketing, CRM and digital.
 
This role will have functional reporting into the Consumer Insights Manager and subject matter reporting into the Head of Product, working closely with the team of Product Managers.
 
 
Role Responsibilities:
 
Analyse a broad array of data points from internal and external sources related to Company IP, Product and Library Assets
Combine and analyse data sets to gain insights into the National Lottery product portfolio and sales performance
Respond to insight queries from the product team
Present analytical outputs to key stakeholders, taking complex information and communicating it as clear and actionable insights.
 
Execute aspects of quantitative and qualitative research where required, including questionnaire design and development
Proactively analyse research findings to develop Allwyn UK friendly internal reports for both quantitative and qualitative reporting, using a story-based reporting approach
Support product lifecycle research programs to ensure product and planned marketing campaigns will resonate with relevant target audiences
Ensure highest level of data quality and validation


 
Key Measures of Success:
 
Respond to queries within the agreed timeframe
Provide high quality outputs with digestible summaries and recommendations
High quality of data visualisation
Proactive approach to data analysis with insights and recommendations actively raised to the team
Support the business planning process with insights, modelling and forecasting inputs
Work closely with other Consumer Insights team members to develop internal qualitative and quantitative best practices


 
Key Skills and Experience:
 
Experience with application development is a plus
Experience in using either: SPSS, SAS, SQL
Experience in manipulating data in excel and using other platforms e.g. Tableau
Bachelor’s degree from a recognized university, Master’s degree/MBA strongly preferred
3 + years of relevant job experience working in areas of data analysis
Ability to understand and translate technical, numerical data
Experience in data analysis for product development and management
Experience in the interactive entertainment industry a plus, with a preference on gambling
Consumer research or research agency experience a plus

job_desc:
About Townhouse
Townhouse was created with a single goal: to disrupt and reinvent the global nail salon industry. We are the fastest growing beauty brand in the UK and are driven by a passionate and disruptive team in achieving our mission. We grew 300% last year and that’s just the beginning!
We’ve brought together a world class team from a wide range of industries. And as we’re growing extremely fast, we need brilliant people (like you!) - to join us on our journey and help us deliver our goal.
 
Reporting directly to the CTO, you will be an experienced Analyst who has a track record in delivering excellent results. Working alongside an experienced Team, you will be assisting with all areas of the business to build and grow the Data function and team.
 
Your responsibilities include (but are not limited too):
 
Conducting full life cycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design
Developing our data science function and frameworks from scratch - having a wide range to choose the right technologies, framework and processes needed to achieve world class results
 
Building sophisticated predictive models to support our operations, acquisition and marketing teams
Building out our analysis and reporting capabilities
Working with complex datasets to extract valuable business insights, and work with other stakeholders across the business to understand business needs, and turn these insights into strategic actions
 
Monitoring performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.


 
Qualifications:
 
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics (or other data science type course)
Experience in Data models, database design, data mining & segmentation
Experience with programming languages such as Python, R, Javascript, SQL
A sound knowledge of statistics and statistical packages for analysing datasets
Very strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at report writing and presenting findings.
 
Excellent communication skills, and ability to work with a range of technical and non-technical stakeholders across the business, up to the C-Suite.


 
Benefits
 
Competitive salary
Scope for rapid career progression
Hybrid working environment (on agreement with managers)
“Townhouse Perks” comprehensive benefits package


 
Work
 
Full time, 40 hours / week
Right to work in UK required
Office based in Tottenham Court Road
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Location:
 
West End, London (hybrid working)
Salary:
 
£40000 - £50000 depending on experience
Bonus:
 
20-30% of salary
 
Company:
 
Global FinTech SaaS company that works with private equity / credit and real estate investors. They provide data science that provides insights into client’s portfolios. Investors make important decisions and produce significant returns based on the data from the platform.
 
 
Job role:
 
The Data Analyst will provide financial analytics to support clients, including significant focus on financial modelling / statistical analysis for alternative investors & financial services companies, as well as supporting on-going performance reporting and monitoring.
 
Responsibilities:
 
 
Performance Analysis
· Development of Asset Management analytics across many geographies and asset types
· Maintenance and on-going development of models used to analyse performance, refine key assumptions, re-forecast cash flows and update valuations
· Monitor and analyse credit and service performance of portfolio investments, including forecasts and key covenants tests
· Deliver analytics to support optimisation of performance, aimed at improving returns as well as managing risks
· Monitor and assist in the preparation of internal / investor reports
 
Investment Analysis and Transactional Support
 
· Build financial models to assess the value and review risk of potential investments, incorporating asset-based cash flow and credit risk analysis
· Prepare investment analysis, including asset level analysis and risk-based simulations for presentation to internal / external constituents
· Assist in broader market research and source external benchmark data
 
Experience:
· Experience working in the analytics function of a data driven company preferably within the financial services sector.
·
 
Experience using R and Python to interrogate large datasets and undertake
 
complex behavioural analysis.
· Hands-on experience designing, building, and implementing statistical models to predict consumer behaviour.
· Numerical degree, preferably at a Masters level (i.e. mathematics, science, engineering or economics). Batchelor’s degree will be considered.
· Development and improvement of data to support continuous evolution of a more competitive analysis
· Data modelling, profiling and cleansing techniques.
· Experience translating data from multiple sources (from different countries/language) and map them to UK standardised data
Desirable:
· Familiarity with Microsoft technology stack, including data integration, collaboration and business Intelligence tools and their underlying technologies (SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, SharePoint, Visual Studio and TFS).
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Data Analyst -
 
An exciting new opportunity has arisen within a global sales organisation for a talented Data Analyst, with excellent report building skills with Power BI. This role will be sitting on the sales floor within their IT department, in a unique, fast-paced, lively environment.
 
You will come into the organisation to take ownership over the Business Intelligence for the organisation, acting as a figurehead for BI and have real influence over what direction you take the company in the future. This is a highly interesting role in that you will be able to make this position your own and have flexibility around your own work.
 
Within the organisation, there is extensive opportunities for career progression and gain paid Microsoft Certifications - with quick promotion reviews and an hour a week dedicated to learning new skills. This isn't limited to something in your day to day work, but could be other technical tools or languages that you personally have a keen interest in!
 
Location & Working Pattern -
 
Due to the highly collaborative nature of the team, everyone is currently in the office regularly and this role will require 5 days a week in the Hertfordshire office, reducing to 4 days after probation. We can therefore only accept UK based applicants with the full, unrestricted right to work in the UK (unfortunately we cannot offer sponsorship and due to the length of the project, must have the right to work until at least 2026).
 
Skill-Set -
 
 
 
You will need to have strong Power BI development experience, building brand new dashboards from scratch
 
Experience with Power Query and DAX
 
Stakeholder management experience will be essential
 
An understanding of API's and how to integrate them into Power BI would be beneficial, but by no means essential
 
Experience with either SQL or M Language may be beneficial - however you will have the chance to up-skill with both tools in this role


 
Benefits -
 
 
 
This role is offering up to £48,000 (depending on experience)
 
On-site parking and on-site gym available
 
Extensive training and development programme
 
Quick career progression and regular promotion reviews


 
If this sounds like the type of role you could be interested - please apply now!
 
Nigel Frank International are the global leaders in niche Microsoft Technology recruitment. I specialise in Microsoft BI, SQL Server and Azure Analytics recruitment placing talented candidates in various roles such as Engineers, Analysts, Architects, Consultants, Project Managers and Management roles. We're the proud sponsors of SQLBits and the London Power BI User Group - which takes place in our Nigel Frank offices monthly! Visit our LinkedIn or London PBI UG Page for more information!
 
Twitter: @ NigelFrank_BI
